quotes.quote: I do the very best I know how-the very best I can; and I mean to keep doing so until the end. If the end brings me out all right, what is said against me won't amount to anything. If the end brings me out wrong, ten angels swearing I was right would make no difference.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: The less their ability, the more their conceit.
quotes.author: Ahad HaAm

quotes.quote: Great ability develops and reveals itself increasingly with every new assignment.
quotes.author: Baltasar Gracian

quotes.quote: Natural ability without education has more often attained to glory and virtue than education without natural ability.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Be systematically heroic in little unnecessary points, do every day or two something for no other reason than its difficulty, so that, when the hour of need draws nigh, it may find you not unnerved or untrained to stand the test.
quotes.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: The trick of it, she told herself, is to be courageous and bold and make a difference. Not change the world exactly, just the bit around you. Go out there with your double-first, your passion and your new Smith Corona electric typewriter and work hard at ... something. Change lives through art maybe. Write beautifully. Cherish your friends, stay true to your principles, live passionately and fully well. Experience new things. Love and be loved if at all possible. Eat sensibly. Stuff like that.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: It is a great ability to be able to conceal one's ability.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: Martyrdom... is the only way in which a man can become famous without ability.
quotes.author: Malcolm Forbes

quotes.quote: I know of no more encouraging fact than the unquestioned ability of a man to elevate his life by conscious endeavor.
quotes.author: Paul Graham

quotes.quote: Ability will never catch up with the demand for it.
quotes.author: Paul Graham

quotes.quote: Dressing up is inevitably a substitute for good ideas. It is no coincidence that technically inept business types are known as "suits."
quotes.author: Robert Half

quotes.quote: Nerds don't just happen to dress informally. They do it too consistently. Consciously or not, they dress informally as a prophylactic measure against stupidity.
quotes.author: Thomas H. Huxley

quotes.quote: There is something that is much more scarce, something rarer than ability. It is the ability to recognize ability.
quotes.author: Tom Lehrer

quotes.quote: Perhaps the most valuable result of all education is the ability to make yourself do the thing you have to do, when it ought to be done, whether you like it or not; it is the first lesson that ought to be learned; and however early a man's training begins, it is probably the last lesson that he learns thoroughly.
The Army has carried the American ... ideal to its logical conclusion. Not only do they prohibit discrimination on the grounds of race, creed and color, but also on ability.
I do not regret one professional enemy I have made. Any actor who doesn't dare to make an enemy should get out of the business.
quotes.author: Bette Davis

quotes.quote: Acting is all about honesty. If you can fake that, you've got it made.
quotes.author: George Burns

quotes.quote: Talk low, talk slow, and don't talk too much.
quotes.author: John Wayne

quotes.quote: Acting is not being emotional, but being able to express emotion.
quotes.author: Kate Reid

quotes.quote: Acting is the most minor of gifts and not a very high-class way to earn a living. After all, Shirley Temple could do it at the age of four.
quotes.author: Katharine Hepburn

quotes.quote: Being a celebrity has taught me to hide, but being an actor has opened my soul.
quotes.author: Meryl Streep

quotes.quote: Empathy is at the heart of the actor's art.
quotes.author: Meryl Streep

quotes.quote: One is obliged to do a great deal of kissing in my line of work: air kissing, [butt] kissing, kissing up, and of course actual kissing. Much like hookers, actors have to do it with people we may not like or even know.
quotes.author: Meryl Streep

quotes.quote: Pretending is not just play. Pretending is imagined possibility. Pretending, or acting, is a very valuable life skill and we do it all the time.
quotes.author: Meryl Streep

quotes.quote: While I am overwhelmingly proud of work that I, believe me, did not do on my own, I can assure you that awards have very little bearing on my own personal happiness, my own sense of well-being and purpose in the world.
quotes.author: Meryl Streep

quotes.quote: Women are better at acting then men. Why? Because we have to be. If successfully convincing someone bigger than you are of something he doesn't want to know is a survival skill, this is how women have survived through the millennia.
quotes.author: Meryl Streep

quotes.quote: There's a rule in acting called, "Don't play the result." If you have a character who's going to end up in a certain place, don't play that until you get there. Play each scene and each beat as it comes. And that's what you do in life: You don't play the result.
quotes.author: Michael J. Fox

quotes.quote: The most difficult character in comedy is that of a fool, and he must be no simpleton who plays the part.
quotes.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quotes.quote: I love acting. It is so much more real than life.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Acting like someone you're not is exactly what it takes to realize you're capable of more than you ever knew.
quotes.author: Roger Moore

quotes.quote: I enjoy being a highly overpaid actor.
quotes.author: Sir Ralph Richardson

quotes.quote: Acting is merely the art of keeping a large group of people from coughing.
quotes.author: Tom Stoppard

quotes.quote: When a man plays a woman in a dress, you're halfway there. It's inherently funny. When a woman plays a man, for whatever reason, it's not that instant kind of funny.

You can be a little bit darker and rougher on the stage, partly because when you're in the theater, people have come to see you, and so they kind of know what they're in for. In television, you are sort of sneaking into people's homes. So, I think you can be a little bit darker on stage.
We're actors - we're the opposite of people.
We have too many high sounding words, and too few actions that correspond with them.
quotes.author: Abigail Adams

quotes.quote: I've arrived at this outermost edge of my life by my own actions. Where I am is thoroughly unacceptable. Therefore, I must stop doing what I've been doing.
quotes.author: Alice Koller

quotes.quote: All human actions have one or more of these seven causes: chance, nature, compulsion, habit, reason, passion, and desire.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Men acquire a particular quality by constantly acting a particular way... you become just by performing just actions, temperate by performing temperate actions, brave by performing brave actions.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Actions lie louder than words.
quotes.author: Carolyn Wells

quotes.quote: Deliberation is the function of the many; action is the function of one.
quotes.author: Charles de Gaulle

quotes.quote: The superior man is modest in his speech, but exceeds in his actions.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: You cannot have a proud and chivalrous spirit if your conduct is mean and paltry; for whatever a man's actions are, such must be his spirit.
quotes.author: Demosthenes

quotes.quote: I have long since come to believe that people never mean half of what they say, and that it is best to disregard their talk and judge only their actions.
quotes.author: Dorothy Day

quotes.quote: An event had happened, upon which it is difficult to speak, and impossible to be silent.
quotes.author: Edmund Burke

quotes.quote: Action is character.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.quote: You ask me why I do not write something....I think one's feelings waste themselves in words, they ought all to be distilled into actions and into actions which bring results.
quotes.author: Florence Nightingale

quotes.quote: In this theater of man's life, it is reserved only for God and for angels to be lookers-on.
quotes.author: Georges Clemenceau

quotes.quote: Happiness lies not in the mere possession of money. It lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort.
quotes.author: Herbert Hoover

quotes.quote: When a man asks himself what is meant by action he proves he is not a man of action. Action is a lack of balance. In order to act you must be somewhat insane. A reasonably sensible man is satisfied with thinking.
quotes.author: Jean Paul Richter

quotes.quote: Somewhere deep down we know that in the final analysis we do decide things and that even our decisions to let someone else decide are really our decisions, however pusillanimous.
quotes.author: John Locke

quotes.quote: Words without actions are the assassins of idealism.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Only actions give life strength; only moderation gives it a charm.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: I have always thought the actions of men the best interpreters of their thoughts.
quotes.author: Samuel Butler

quotes.quote: I was seldom able to see an opportunity until it had ceased to be one.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: We defend and we build a way of life, not for America alone, but for all mankind.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Don't be too timid and squeamish about your actions. All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Life is one long process of getting tired.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Nothing will ever be attempted if all possible objections must be first overcome.
Aggressive fighting for the right is the greatest sport in the world.

We are face to face with our destiny and we must meet it with high and resolute courage. For us is the life of action, of strenuous performance of duty; let us live in the harness, striving mightily; let us rather run the risk of wearing out than rusting out.
Delay is preferable to error.
Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: If we had no winter, the spring would not be so pleasant: if we did not sometimes taste of adversity, prosperity would not be so welcome.
quotes.author: Anne Bradstreet

quotes.quote:
By courage I repel adversity.
(Adversa Virtute Repello)
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: He knows not his own strength that hath not met adversity.
quotes.author: Ben Jonson

quotes.quote: Be more prompt to go to a friend in adversity than in prosperity.
quotes.author: Chilo

quotes.quote: Friendship make prosperity more shining and lessens adversity by dividing and sharing it.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Adversity is the touchstone of friendship.
quotes.author: French Proverb

quotes.quote: Adversity is the trial of principle. Without it a man hardly knows whether he is honest or not.
quotes.author: Henry Fielding

quotes.quote: He that can heroically endure adversity will bear prosperity with equal greatness of the soul; for the mind that cannot be dejected by the former is not likely to be transported without the latter.
quotes.author: Henry Fielding

quotes.quote: In adversity remember to keep an even mind.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.quote: You will never truly know yourself or the strength of your relationships until both have been tested by adversity.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: In prosperity our friends know us; in adversity we know our friends.
quotes.author: John Churton Collins

quotes.quote: Adversity does teach who your real friends are.
quotes.author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quotes.quote: By trying we can easily learn to endure adversity -- another man's I mean.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: By trying we can easily learn to endure adversity. Another man's, I mean.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
quotes.author: Og Mandino

quotes.quote: Prosperity makes friends, adversity tries them.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: Fire is the test of gold; adversity, of strong men.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Remember that there is nothing stable in human affairs; therefore avoid undue elation in prosperity, or undue depression in adversity.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Adversity causes some men to break; others to break records.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: A man I am cross'd with adversity.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
A wretched soul, bruised with adversity,
We bid be quiet when we hear it cry;
But were we burdened with like weight of pain,
As much or more we should ourselves complain.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Let me embrace thee, sour adversity, for wise men say it is the wisest course.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
Sweet are the uses of adversity,
Which like the toad, ugly and venomous,
Wears yet a precious jewel in his head;
And this our life, exempt from public haunt,
Finds tongues in trees, books in the running brooks,
Sermons in stones, and good in everything.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Sweet are the uses of adversity, which, like a toad, though ugly and venomous, wears yet a precious jewel in its head.
I LIKE ads. It's not that we don't like ads, we just don't like ads when they are out of place.
quotes.author: Bill Barnes

quotes.quote: The very first law in advertising is to avoid the concrete promise and cultivate the delightfully vague.
quotes.author: Bill Cosby

quotes.quote: Advertising is the modern substitute for argument; its function is to make the worse appear the better.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.quote: If people aren't going to talk about your product, then it's not good enough.
quotes.author: Jeffrey Kalmikoff

quotes.quote: Half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don't know which half.
quotes.author: John Wanamaker

quotes.quote: Many a small thing has been made large by the right kind of advertising.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: You can tell the ideals of a nation by its advertisements.
quotes.author: Norman Douglas

quotes.quote: Chess is as elaborate a waste of human intelligence as you can find outside an advertising agency.
quotes.author: Raymond Chandler

quotes.quote: Advertising is a valuable economic factor because it is the cheapest way of selling goods, particularly if the goods are worthless.
quotes.author: Sinclair Lewis

quotes.quote: Advertising may be described as the science of arresting the human intelligence long enough to get money from it.
quotes.author: Stephen Leacock

quotes.quote: Advertisements... contain the only truths to be relied on in a newspaper.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: I read no newspaper now but Ritchie's, and in that chiefly the advertisements, for they contain the only truths to be relied on in a newspaper.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: What is the difference between unethical and ethical advertising? Unethical advertising uses falsehoods to deceive the public; ethical advertising uses truth to deceive the public.
quotes.author: Vilhjalmur Stefansson

quotes.quote: Never trust the advice of a man in difficulties.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.quote: It is very difficult to live among people you love and hold back from offering them advice.
quotes.author: Anne Tyler

quotes.quote: People who ask our advice almost never take it. Yet we should never refuse to give it, upon request, for it often helps us to see our own way more clearly.
quotes.author: Brendan Francis

quotes.quote: Ask advice only of your equals.
quotes.author: Danish Proverb

quotes.quote: Please give me some good advice in your next letter. I promise not to follow it.
quotes.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quotes.quote: Don't give advice. It will come back and bite you in the [butt]. Don't take anyone's advice. So, my advice to you is to be true to yourself and everything will be fine.
quotes.author: Ellen DeGeneres

quotes.quote: Write down the advice of him who loves you, though you like it not at present.
quotes.author: English Proverb

quotes.quote: Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didn't.
quotes.author: Erica Jong

quotes.quote: Good advice is something a man gives when he is too old to set a bad example.
quotes.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: I owe my success to having listened respectfully to the very best advice, and then going away and doing the exact opposite.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: Never give advice unless asked.
quotes.author: German Proverb

quotes.quote: Some people like my advice so much that they frame it upon the wall instead of using it.
quotes.author: Gordon R. Dickson

quotes.quote: There is no human problem which could not be solved if people would simply do as I advise.
quotes.author: Gore Vidal

quotes.quote: The true secret of giving advice is, after you have honestly given it, to be perfectly indifferent whether it is taken or not, and never persist in trying to set people right.
quotes.author: Hannah Whitall Smith

quotes.quote: I have found the best way to give advice to your children is to find out what they want and then advise them to do it.
quotes.author: Harry S Truman

quotes.quote: The only thing to do with good advice is pass it on. It is never any use to oneself.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Don't try to solve serious matters in the middle of the night.
quotes.author: Philip K. Dick

quotes.quote: The advice of friends must be received with a judicious reserve; we must not give ourselves up to it and follow it blindly, whether right or wrong.
quotes.author: Pierre Charron

quotes.quote: Many receive advice, few profit by it.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: Advice is very easy to give, and even easier not to follow, so I don't fool with it.
quotes.author: Sidney J. Harris

quotes.quote: It seems that bad advice that's fun will always be better known than than good advice that's dull-no matter how useless that fun advice is.
quotes.author: Solon

quotes.quote: Never take the advice of someone who has not had your kind of trouble.
quotes.author: Spanish Proverb

quotes.quote: In giving advice, seek to help, not please, your friend.
quotes.author: Wil Wheaton

quotes.quote: Never advise anyone to go to war or to marry.
Don't be a dick!
Wisdom doesn't automatically come with old age. Nothing does - except wrinkles. It's true, some wines improve with age. But only if the grapes were good in the first place.
quotes.author: Abigail Van Buren

quotes.quote: I have enjoyed greatly the second blooming... suddenly you find - at the age of 50, say - that a whole new life has opened before you.
quotes.author: Agatha Christie

quotes.quote: The deepest definition of youth is life as yet untouched by tragedy.
quotes.author: Alfred North Whitehead

quotes.quote: Growing old is no more than a bad habit which a busy man has no time to form.
quotes.author: Andre Maurois

quotes.quote: You can only perceive real beauty in a person as they get older.
quotes.author: Anouk Aimee

quotes.quote: Young people are in a condition like permanent intoxication, because youth is sweet and they are growing.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: At twenty years of age the will reigns; at thirty the wit; at forty the judgement.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Beware of the young doctor and the old barber.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: By my rambling digressions I perceive myself to be growing old.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: To me, old age is always 15 years older than I am.
quotes.author: Bernard M. Baruch

quotes.quote: Aging is not 'lost youth' but a new stage of opportunity and strength.
quotes.author: Betty Friedan

quotes.quote: There is no old age. There is, as there always was, just you.
quotes.author: Carol Matthau

quotes.quote: Always be nice to those younger than you, because they are the ones who will be writing about you.
quotes.author: Cyril Connolly

quotes.quote: The great secret that all old people share is that you really haven't changed in 70 or 80 years. Your body changes, but you don't change at all.
quotes.author: Doris Lessing

quotes.quote: The surprising thing about young fools is how many survive to become old fools.
quotes.author: Doug Larson

quotes.quote: I'm very pleased with each advancing year. It stems back to when I was forty. I was a bit upset about reaching that milestone, but an older friend consoled me. 'Don't complain about growing old - many, many people do not have that privilege.'
quotes.author: Earl Warren

quotes.quote: In spite of illness, in spite even of the archenemy sorrow, one can remain alive long past the usual date of disintegration if one is unafraid of change, insatiable in intellectual curiosity, interested in big things, and happy in small ways.
quotes.author: Edith Wharton

quotes.quote: Old age, calm, expanded, broad with the haughty breadth of the universe, old age flowing free with the delicious near-by freedom of death.
quotes.author: Edith Wharton

quotes.quote: It is a sadness of growing older that we lose our ardent appreciation of what is new and different and difficult.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quotes.quote: With age come the inner, the higher life. Who would be forever young, to dwell always in externals?
quotes.author: Ellen Glasgow

quotes.quote: Though it sounds absurd, it is true to say I felt younger at sixty than I felt at twenty.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.quote: That is the greatest fallacy, the wisdom of old men. They do not grow wise. They grow careful.
quotes.author: Evelyn Waugh

quotes.quote: Only when one has lost all curiosity about the future has one reached the age to write an autobiography.
quotes.author: Florida Scott-Maxwell

quotes.quote: I grow more intense as I age.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.quote: The longer I live the more beautiful life becomes.
quotes.author: Franklin P. Jones

quotes.quote: You're an old-timer if you can remember when setting the world on fire was a figure of speech.
quotes.author: George Burns

quotes.quote: It is kind of strange watching your personal history become costume.
quotes.author: George Burns

quotes.quote: Age to me means nothing. I can't get old; I'm working. I was old when I was twenty-one and out of work. As long as you're working, you stay young. When I'm in front of an audience, all that love and vitality sweeps over me and I forget my age.
quotes.author: George Sand

quotes.quote: I was always taught to respect my elders and I've now reached the age when I don't have anybody to respect.
It is a mistake to regard age as a downhill grade toward dissolution. The reverse is true. As one grows older, one climbs with surprising strides.
My idea of an agreeable person is a person who agrees with me.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: It is by universal misunderstanding that all agree. For if, by ill luck, people understood each other, they would never agree.
quotes.author: Charles Baudelaire

quotes.quote: Those who agree with us may not be right, but we admire their astuteness.
quotes.author: Cullen Hightower

quotes.quote: Your very silence shows you agree.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: We rarely think people have good sense unless they agree with us.
quotes.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: If men would consider not so much wherein they differ, as wherein they agree, there would be far less of uncharitableness and angry feeling.
quotes.author: Joseph Addison

quotes.quote: If two men agree on everything, you may be sure that one of them is doing the thinking.
quotes.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quotes.quote: I don't necessarily agree with everything I say.
quotes.author: Marshall McLuhan

quotes.quote: If you can find something everyone agrees on, it's wrong.
quotes.author: Mo Udall

quotes.quote: To disagree with three-fourths of the British public is one of the first requisites of sanity.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: The greatest mistake is trying to be more agreeable than you can be.
quotes.author: Walter Bagehot

quotes.quote: When two men in business always agree, one of them is unnecessary.
quotes.author: William Wrigley Jr.

quotes.quote: Ambition is putting a ladder against the sky.
quotes.author: American Proverb

quotes.quote: The universe is not required to be in perfect harmony with human ambition.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.quote: Ambition is a poor excuse for not having sense enough to be lazy.
quotes.author: Edgar Bergen

quotes.quote: The nature of society is largely determined by the direction in which talent and ambition flow-by the tilt of the social landscape.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: What seems to be generosity is often no more than disguised ambition, which overlooks a small interest in order to secure a great one.
quotes.author: Francois De La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: Most people would succeed in small things if they were not troubled with great ambitions.
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.quote: Ambition - it is the last infirmity of noble minds.
quotes.author: James M. Barrie

quotes.quote: Ambition often puts men upon doing the meanest offices; so climbing is performed in the same posture with creeping.
quotes.author: Jonathan Swift

quotes.quote: All ambitions are lawful except those that climb upward on the miseries or credulities of mankind.
quotes.author: Joseph Conrad

quotes.quote: Dreams, goals, ambitions - these are the stuff man uses for fuel.
quotes.author: L. Ron Hubbard

quotes.quote: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: He who blinded by ambition, raises himself to a position whence he cannot mount higher, must thereafter fall with the greatest loss.
quotes.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quotes.quote: A man without ambition is dead. A man with ambition but no love is dead. A man with ambition and love for his blessings here on earth is ever so alive. Having been alive, it won't be so hard in the end to lie down and rest.
quotes.author: Pearl Bailey

quotes.quote: Though ambition itself be a vice, yet it is often times the cause of virtues.
quotes.author: Quintilian

quotes.quote: Men are more often bribed by their loyalties and ambitions than by money.
quotes.author: Robert Jackson

quotes.quote: Ambition drove many men to become false; to have one thought locked in the breast, another ready on the tongue.
quotes.author: Sallust

quotes.quote: All ambitions are lawful except those which climb upward on the miseries or credulities of mankind.
quotes.author: William Congreve

quotes.quote: Ambition, the soldier's virtue, rather makes choice of loss, than gain which darkens him.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: I have no spur to prick the sides of my intent, but only vaulting ambition, which o'erleaps itself, and falls on the other.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: I hold ambition of so light a quality that is is but a shadow's shadow.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
Lowliness is young ambition's ladder,
Whereto the climber-upward turns his face;
But when he once attains the upmost round,
He then unto the ladder turns his back,
Looks in the clouds, scorning the base degrees
By which he did ascend
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Virtue is choked with foul ambition.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: In America any boy may become President and I suppose it's just one of the risks he takes.
quotes.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.

quotes.quote: There is a New America every morning when we wake up. It is upon us whether we will it or not.
quotes.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.

quotes.quote: America's greatest strength, and its greatest weakness, is our belief in second chances, our belief that we can always start over, that things can be made better.
quotes.author: Anthony Walton

quotes.quote: America is a large, friendly dog in a very small room. Every time it wags its tail, it knocks over a chair.
quotes.author: Arnold Toynbee

quotes.quote: America, we are better than these last eight years. We are a better country than this.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.quote: I know starting careers in troubled times is a challenge, but it is also a privilege. Because it's moments like these that force us to try harder, dig deeper and to discover gifts we never knew we had. To find the greatness that lies within each of us. So don't ever shy away from that endeavor. Don't stop adding to your body of work. I can promise that you will be the better for that continued effort as will be this nation that we all love.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.quote: In recent years, we've become enamored with our own past success. Lulled into complacency by the glitter of our own achievements. We've become accustomed to the title of Military Superpower, forgetting the qualities that got us there. We've become accustomed to our economic dominance in the world, forgetting that it wasn't reckless deals and get rich quick schemes that got us where we are, but hard work and smart ideas, quality products and wise investments.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.quote: That is the American story. People, just like you, following their passions, determined to meet the times on their own terms. They weren't doing it for the money. Their titles weren't fancy. But they changed the course of history and so can you.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.quote: There is nothing wrong with America that cannot be cured by what is right with America.
quotes.author: Bill Clinton

quotes.quote: America's one of the finest countries anyone ever stole.
quotes.author: Bobcat Goldthwaite

quotes.quote: There's the country of America, which you have to defend, but there's also the idea of America. America is more than just a country, it's an idea. An idea that's supposed to be contagious.
quotes.author: Bono

quotes.quote: I see America, not in the setting sun of a black night of despair ahead of us, I see America in the crimson light of a rising sun fresh from the burning, creative hand of God. I see great days ahead, great days possible to men and women of will and vision.
quotes.author: Carl Sandburg

quotes.quote: The trouble with America is that there are far too many wide-open spaces surrounded by teeth.
quotes.author: Charles Luckman

quotes.quote: America is the greatest, freest and most decent society in existence. It is an oasis of goodness in a desert of cynicism and barbarism. This country, once an experiment unique in the world, is now the last best hope for the world.
quotes.author: Dinesh D'Souza

quotes.quote: There is nothing wrong with America that the faith, love of freedom, intelligence and energy of her citizens cannot cure.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: The United States is a nation of laws: badly written and randomly enforced.
quotes.author: Frank Zappa

quotes.quote: America is therefore the land of the future, where, in the ages that lie before us, the burden of the World's History shall reveal itself.
quotes.author: Georg W. Hegel

quotes.quote: England and America are two countries separated by a common language.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: America is a young country with an old mentality.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.quote: America has never been an empire. We may be the only great power in history that had the chance, and refused � preferring greatness to power and justice to glory.
quotes.author: George W. Bush

quotes.quote: America has never been united by blood or birth or soil. We are bound by ideals that move us beyond our backgrounds, lift us above our interests and teach us what it means to be citizens.
quotes.author: George W. Bush

quotes.quote: America will never run... And we will always be grateful that liberty has found such brave defenders.
quotes.author: George W. Bush

quotes.quote: By heritage and by choice, the United States of America will make that stand.
quotes.author: George W. Bush

quotes.quote: The business of America is not business. Neither is it war. The business of america is justice and securing the blessings of liberty.
quotes.author: Gertrude Stein

quotes.quote: In the United States there is more space where nobody is than where anybody is. That is what makes America what it is.
quotes.author: Henry Ford II

quotes.quote: What's right about America is that although we have a mess of problems, we have great capacity - intellect and resources - to do some thing about them.
quotes.author: Herbert Hoover

quotes.quote: America - a great social and economic experiment, noble in motive and far-reaching in purpose.
quotes.author: Hillary Rodham Clinton

quotes.quote: I'm not going to quit. Why should I quit? This country is worth fighting for.
quotes.author: Jack Kerouac

quotes.quote: This is the story of America. Everybody's doing what they think they're supposed to do.
quotes.author: Jeffery F. Chamberlain

quotes.quote: In a country as big as the United States, you can find fifty examples of anything.
In every American there is an air of incorrigible innocence, which seems to conceal a diabolical cunning.
quotes.author: A. E. Housman

quotes.quote: Too many of us look upon Americans as dollar chasers. This is a cruel libel, even if it is reiterated thoughtlessly by the Americans themselves.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The people reign over the American political world as God rules over the universe. It is the cause and the end of all things; everything rises out of it and is absorbed back into it.
quotes.author: Alexis De Tocqueville

quotes.quote: Americans will put up with anything provided it doesn't block traffic.
quotes.author: Dan Rather

quotes.quote: I was born an American; I will live an American; I shall die an American.
quotes.author: Daniel Webster

quotes.quote: How much longer are we going to think it necessary to be ''American'' before (or in contradistinction to) being cultivated, being enlightened, being humane, and having the same intellectual discipline as other civilized countries?
quotes.author: Edith Wharton

quotes.quote: I sometimes think that the saving grace of America lies in the fact that the overwhelming majority of Americans are possessed of two great qualities- a sense of humor and a sense of proportion.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Americans never quit.
quotes.author: General Douglas Macarthur

quotes.quote: Americans adore me and will go on adoring me until I say something nice about them.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Americans are overreachers; overreaching is the most admirable of the many American excesses.
quotes.author: George F. Will

quotes.quote: Half of the American people have never read a newspaper. Half never voted for President. One hopes it is the same half.
quotes.author: Gore Vidal

quotes.quote: Nobody ever went broke underestimating the intelligence of the American public.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: The character inherent in the American people has done all that has been accomplished; and it would have done somewhat more, if the government had not sometimes got in its way.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: It is, I think, an indisputable fact that Americans are, as Americans, the most self- conscious people in the world, and the most addicted to the belief that the other nations are in a conspiracy to under-value them.
quotes.author: Henry James

quotes.quote: Americans are benevolently ignorant about Canada, while Canadians are malevolently well informed about the United States.
quotes.author: J. Bartlett Brebner

quotes.quote: George Washington had a vision for this country. Was it three days of uninterrupted shopping?
quotes.author: Jeff Melvoin

quotes.quote: The American, by nature, is optimistic. He is experimental, an inventor and a builder who builds best when called upon to build greatly.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: This nation was founded by many men of many nations and backgrounds. It was founded on the principle that all men are created equal, and that the rights of every man are diminished when the rights of one man are threatened.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: Ninety-eight percent of the adults in this country are decent, hard-working, honest Americans. It's the other lousy two percent that get all the publicity. But then--we elected them.
quotes.author: Lily Tomlin

quotes.quote: Sitting at the table doesn't make you a diner, unless you eat some of what's on that plate. Being here in America doesn't make you an American. Being born here in America doesn't make you an American.
quotes.author: Malcolm X

quotes.quote: An Englishman is a person who does things because they have been done before. An American is a person who does things because they haven't been done before.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: The people of the United States, perhaps more than any other nation in history, love to abase themselves and proclaim their unworthiness, and seem to find refreshment in doing so... That is a dark frivolity, but still frivolity.
quotes.author: Robertson Davies

quotes.quote: For the American people are a very generous people and will forgive almost any weakness, with the possible exception of stupidity.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: Eat a third and drink a third and leave the remaining third of your stomach empty. Then, when you get angry, there will be sufficient room for your rage.
quotes.author: Babylonian Talmud

quotes.quote: Anger makes you smaller, while forgiveness forces you to grow beyond what you were.
quotes.author: Cherie Carter-Scott

quotes.quote: When anger rises, think of the consequences.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: Anger makes dull men witty, but it keeps them poor.
quotes.author: Elizabeth I

quotes.quote:
Anger as soon as fed is dead-
'Tis starving makes it fat.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.quote: If you do not wish to be prone to anger, do not feed the habit; give it nothing which may tend to its increase.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: If you would cure anger, do not feed it. Say to yourself: 'I used to be angry every day; then every other day; now only every third or fourth day.' When you reach thirty days offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving to the gods.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: I have seen a peaceful expression turn to anger as fast as a whip cracks, and so the look on the face might mean less than what it seems to be.
quotes.author: Greg Evans

quotes.quote: Anger at lies lasts forever. Anger at truth can't last.
quotes.author: Harriet Lerner

quotes.quote: Anger is a signal, and one worth listening to.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.quote: Never forget what a man says to you when he is angry.
quotes.author: Joan Lunden

quotes.quote: Holding on to anger, resentment and hurt only gives you tense muscles, a headache and a sore jaw from clenching your teeth. Forgiveness gives you back the laughter and the lightness in your life.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.quote: Speak when you are angry--and you will make the best speech you'll ever regret.
quotes.author: Malcolm X

quotes.quote: Usually when people are sad, they don't do anything. They just cry over their condition. But when they get angry, they bring about a change.
quotes.author: Mario Puzo

quotes.quote: Never get angry. Never make a threat. Reason with people.
quotes.author: Maxine Waters

quotes.quote: I have a right to my anger, and I don't want anybody telling me I shouldn't be, that it's not nice to be, and that something's wrong with me because I get angry.
How many a dispute could have been deflated into a single paragraph if the disputants had dared to define their terms.
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.quote: The Argument from Intimidation is a confession of intellectual impotence.
quotes.author: Cathy Ladman

quotes.quote: My parents only had one argument in forty-five years. It lasted forty-three years.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: He who strikes the first blow admits he's lost the argument.
quotes.author: Dave Barry

quotes.quote: I can win an argument on any topic, against any opponent. People know this, and steer clear of me at parties. Often, as a sign of their great respect, they don't even invite me.
quotes.author: English Proverb

quotes.quote: Use soft words and hard arguments.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: The most perfidious way of harming a cause consists of defending it deliberately with faulty arguments.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: The thing I hate about an argument is that it always interrupts a discussion.
quotes.author: Jascha Heifetz

quotes.quote: No matter what side of the argument you are on, you always find people on your side that you wish were on the other.
quotes.author: Joseph Farrell

quotes.quote: That's the beauty of argument-if you argue correctly, you're never wrong.
quotes.author: Josh Billings

quotes.quote: If you go in for argument, take care of your temper. Your logic, if you have any, will take care of itself.
quotes.author: Louis D. Brandeis

quotes.quote: Silence is one of the hardest arguments to refute.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Behind every argument is someone's ignorance.
quotes.author: Pierre Beaumarchais

quotes.quote: Arguments are to be avoided; they are always vulgar and often convincing.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: It is not necessary to understand things in order to argue about them.
quotes.author: Saint Augustine

quotes.quote: In a heated argument we are apt to lose sight of the truth.
quotes.author: William G. McAdoo

quotes.quote: The argument is at an end.
quotes.author: William Lloyd Garrison

quotes.quote: I learned an important lesson in the art of debate. Present your argument clearly, arm yourself with cutting wit and of course, bob and weave!
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: It is impossible to defeat an ignorant man in argument.
With reasonable men I will reason; with humane men I will plea; but to tyrants I will give no quarter, nor waste arguments where they will certainly be lost.
For they are yet ear-kissing arguments.
[Abstract art is] a product of the untalented, sold by the unprincipled to the utterly bewildered.
quotes.author: Al Capp

quotes.quote: Art is the imposing of a pattern on experience, and our aesthetic enjoyment is recognition of the pattern.
quotes.author: Alfred North Whitehead

quotes.quote: Painting: The art of protecting flat surfaces from the weather and exposing them to the critic.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: Art is the desire of a man to express himself, to record the reactions of his personality to the world he lives in.
quotes.author: Amy Lowell

quotes.quote: Art is a collaboration between God and the artist, and the less the artist does the better.
quotes.author: Andre Gide

quotes.quote: Let each man exercise the art he knows.
quotes.author: Aristophanes

quotes.quote: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Art does not exist only to entertain, but also to challenge one to think, to provoke, even to disturb, in a constant search for truth.
quotes.author: Barbra Streisand

quotes.quote: I believe that if it were left to artists to choose their own labels, most would choose none.
quotes.author: Ben Shahn

quotes.quote: So you see, imagination needs moodling - long, inefficient, happy idling, dawdling and puttering.
quotes.author: Brenda Ueland

quotes.quote: I suppose no matter what I'm drawing, there will always be some sort of question in my mind about it. A work of art (even cartoon art)is never really finished; it is abandoned.
quotes.author: Brooke McEldowney

quotes.quote: I can't criticize what I don't understand. If you want to call this art, you've got the benefit of all my doubts.
quotes.author: Charles Rosin

quotes.quote: Art is born of the observation and investigation of nature.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Art forms of the past were really considered elitist. Bach did not compose for the masses, neither did Beethoven. It was always for patrons, aristocrats, and royalty. Now we have a sort of democratic version of that, which is to say that the audience is so splintered in its interests.
quotes.author: David Cronenberg

quotes.quote: The idea of a mass audience was really an invention of the Industrial Revolution.
quotes.author: David Cronenberg

quotes.quote: If you were in a burning house and there was a cat and a Rembrandt, what would you save? The cat...you would save the cat, because the cat is alive. The art is dead. It's just paint on a canvas, ink on a page. To live for art is to deny life. It's just to destroy life.
quotes.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider

quotes.quote: I merely took the energy it takes to pout and wrote some blues.
quotes.author: Duke Ellington

quotes.quote: Works of art, in my opinion, are the only objects in the material universe to possess internal order, and that is why, though I don't believe that only art matters, I do believe in Art for Art's sake.
quotes.author: E. M. Forster

quotes.quote: Another unsettling element in modern art is that common symptom of immaturity, the dread of doing what has been done before.
quotes.author: Edith Wharton

quotes.quote: Art is on the side of the oppressed. Think before you shudder at the simplistic dictum and its heretical definition of the freedom of art. For if art is freedom of the spirit, how can it exist within the oppressors?
quotes.author: Edith Wharton

quotes.quote: A painting in a museum hears more ridiculous opinions than anything else in the world.
quotes.author: Edmond de Goncourt

quotes.quote: It is all very well, when the pen flows, but then there are the dark days when imagination deserts one, and it is an effort to put anything down on paper. That little you have achieved stares at you at the end of the day, and you know the next morning you will have to scrape it down and start again.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Bowen

quotes.quote: Illusions are art, for the feeling person, and it is by art that you live, if you do.
quotes.author: Eugene Delacroix

quotes.quote: Artists who seek perfection in everything are those who cannot attain it in anything.
quotes.author: Federico Fellini

quotes.quote: I don't believe in total freedom for the artist. Left on his own, free to do anything he likes, the artist ends up doing nothing at all. If there's one thing that's dangerous for an artist, it's precisely this question of total freedom, waiting for inspiration and all the rest of it.
quotes.author: Frank Zappa

quotes.quote: Art is making something out of nothing and selling it.
quotes.author: Frida Kahlo

quotes.quote: I paint my own reality. The only thing I know is that I paint because I need to, and I paint whatever passes through my head without any other consideration.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: Art, like morality, consists of drawing the line somewhere.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Without art the crudeness of reality would make the world unbearable.
quotes.author: George Tooker

quotes.quote: Painting is an attempt to come to terms with life. There are as many solutions as there are human beings.
The worst moment for the atheist is when he is really thankful and has nobody to thank.
quotes.author: Dante Gabriel Rossetti

quotes.quote: I always admired atheists. I think it takes a lot of faith.
quotes.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider

quotes.quote: The opposite of the religious fanatic is not the fanatical atheist but the gentle cynic who cares not whether there is a god or not.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: I believe in God, only I spell it Nature.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.quote: If there were no God, there would be no Atheists.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: I have too much respect for the idea of God to make it responsible for such an absurd world.
quotes.author: Georges Duhamel

quotes.quote: I'm a born-again atheist.
quotes.author: Gore Vidal

quotes.quote: I once wanted to become an atheist, but I gave up - they have no holidays.
quotes.author: Henny Youngman

quotes.quote: Nobody talks so constantly about God as those who insist that there is no God.
quotes.author: Heywood Broun

quotes.quote: An atheist is a man who has no invisible means of support.
quotes.author: John Buchan

quotes.quote: I don't know if God exists, but it would be better for His reputation if He didn't.
quotes.author: Jules Renard

quotes.quote: I’m the world’s least happy atheist. I miss having religious faith, but trying to have it seems like trying to be in love with someone that you’re not in love with.
quotes.author: Lisa Williams

quotes.quote: I am an atheist, myself. A simple faith, but a great comfort to me, in these last days.
quotes.author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quotes.quote: I'm still an atheist, thank God.
quotes.author: Luis Bunuel

quotes.quote: It is the final proof of God's omnipotence that he need not exist in order to save us.
quotes.author: Peter De Vries

quotes.quote: When I told the people of Northern Ireland that I was an atheist, a woman in the audience stood up and said, "Yes, but is it the God of the Catholics or the God of the Protestants in whom you don't believe?"
quotes.author: Quentin Crisp

quotes.quote: Religion is about turning untested belief into unshakeable truth through the power of institutions and the passage of time.
quotes.author: Richard Dawkins

quotes.quote: We are all atheists about most of the gods that societies have ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further.
quotes.author: Richard Dawkins

quotes.quote: You've got your phenomenon on one hand. Concrete and knowable. On the other hand you've got the incomprehensible. You call it God, but to me, God or no, it remains just that, the unknowable.
quotes.author: Robin Green and Mitchell Burgess

quotes.quote: Ask a deeply religious Christian if he'd rather live next to a bearded Muslim that may or may not be plotting a terror attack, or an atheist that may or may not show him how to set up a wireless network in his house. On the scale of prejudice, atheists don't seem so bad lately.
quotes.author: Scott Adams

quotes.quote: Shake off all the fears of servile prejudices, under which weak minds are servilely crouched. Fix reason firmly in her seat, and call on her tribunal for every fact, every opinion. Question with boldness even the existence of a God; because, if there be one, he must more approve of the homage of reason than that of blindfolded fear.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent him.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: How can I believe in God when just last week I got my tongue caught in the roller of an electric typewriter?
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.quote: If it turns out that there is a God, I don't think that he's evil. But the worst that you can say about him is that basically he's an underachiever.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.quote: To you I'm an atheist; to God, I'm the Loyal Opposition.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.quote: Being assertive does not mean attacking or ignoring others feelings. It means that you are willing to hold up for yourself fairly-without attacking others.
quotes.author: Edith Sitwell

quotes.quote: Eccentricity is not, as dull people would have us believe, a form of madness. It is often a kind of innocent pride, and the man of genius and the aristocrat are frequently regarded as eccentrics because genius and aristocrat are entirely unafraid of and uninfluenced by the opinions and vagaries of the crowd.
quotes.author: Herm Albright

quotes.quote: A positive attitude may not solve all your problems, but it will annoy enough people to make it worth the effort.
quotes.author: Lisa Alther

quotes.quote: I happen to feel that the degree of a person's intelligence is directly reflected by the number of conflicting attitudes she can bring to bear on the same topic.
quotes.author: Lynn Johnston

quotes.quote: Complaining is good for you as long as you're not complaining to the person you're complaining about.
quotes.author: Martha Washington

quotes.quote: I am still determined to be cheerful and happy, in whatever situation I may be; for I have also learned from experience that the greater part of our happiness or misery depends upon our dispositions, and not upon our circumstances.
quotes.author: Patricia Neal

quotes.quote: A strong positive mental attitude will create more miracles than any wonder drug.
quotes.author: William James

quotes.quote: Human beings, by changing the inner attitudes of their minds, can change the outer aspects of their lives.
quotes.author: William James

quotes.quote: The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes of mind.
No moral system can rest solely on authority.
quotes.author: A. J. Ayer

quotes.quote: To punish me for my contempt for authority, fate made me an authority myself.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The peaceful transfer of authority is rare in history, yet common in our country. With a simple oath, we affirm old traditions and make new beginnings.
quotes.author: George W. Bush

quotes.quote: Truth is the secret of eloquence and of virtue, the basis of moral authority; it is the highest summit of art and life.
quotes.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

quotes.quote:
Show me the man who keeps his house in hand,
He's fit for public authority.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.quote: Every great advance in natural knowledge has involved the absolute rejection of authority.
quotes.author: Thomas H. Huxley

quotes.quote: Wherever there is authority, there is a natural inclination to disobedience.
quotes.author: Thomas Haliburton

quotes.quote: There is no fettering of authority.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: If you wish to know what a man is, place him in authority.
quotes.author: Yugoslav Proverb

quotes.quote: Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote:
When the bold branches
Bid farewell to rainbow leaves -
Welcome wool sweaters.
quotes.author: B. Cybrill

quotes.quote: Fall is my favorite season in Los Angeles, watching the birds change color and fall from the trees.
quotes.author: David Letterman

quotes.quote:
For man, autumn is a time of harvest, of gathering together.
For nature, it is a time of sowing, of scattering abroad.
quotes.author: Edwin Teale

quotes.quote: A few days ago I walked along the edge of the lake and was treated to the crunch and rustle of leaves with each step I made. The acoustics of this season are different and all sounds, no matter how hushed, are as crisp as autumn air.
quotes.author: Eric Sloane

quotes.quote: The leaves fall, the wind blows, and the farm country slowly changes from the summer cottons into its winter wools.
quotes.author: Henry Beston

quotes.quote: If winter is slumber and spring is birth, and summer is life, then autumn rounds out to be reflection. It's a time of year when the leaves are down and the harvest is in and the perennials are gone. Mother Earth just closed up the drapes on another year and it's time to reflect on what's come before.
quotes.author: Mitchell Burgess

quotes.quote: I cannot endure to waste anything as precious as autumn sunshine by staying in the house. So I spend almost all the daylight hours in the open air.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.quote: It was one of those perfect English autumnal days which occur more frequently in memory than in life.
quotes.author: P. D. James

quotes.quote:
There is a harmony
In autumn, and a lustre in its sky,
Which through the summer is not heard or seen,
As if it could not be, as if it had not been!
quotes.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quotes.quote: In the garden, Autumn is, indeed the crowning glory of the year, bringing us the fruition of months of thought and care and toil. And at no season, safe perhaps in Daffodil time, do we get such superb colour effects as from August to November.
quotes.author: Rose G. Kingsley

quotes.quote: Fiery colors begin their yearly conquest of the hills, propelled by the autumn winds. Fall is the artist.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
That time of year thou may'st in me behold,
When yellow leaves, or none, or few, do hang
Upon those boughs which shake against the cold,-
Bare ruin'd choirs, where late the sweet birds sang.
The best and safest thing is to keep a balance in your life, acknowledge the great powers around us and in us. If you can do that, and live that way, you are really a wise man.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: We can be sure that the greatest hope for maintaining equilibrium in the face of any situation rests within ourselves.
quotes.author: Francis J. Braceland

quotes.quote: What I dream of is an art of balance.
quotes.author: Henri Matisse

quotes.quote: So divinely is the world organized that every one of us, in our place and time, is in balance with everything else.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Order is not pressure which is imposed on society from without, but an equilibrium which is set up from within.
quotes.author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quotes.quote: I've learned that you can't have everything and do everything at the same time.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: It may make your blood boil and your mind may not be changed, but the practice of listening to opposing views is essential for effective citizenship. It is essential for our democracy.
A bank is a place that will lend you money if you can prove that you don't need it.
quotes.author: Bob Hope

quotes.quote: Drive-in banks were established so most of the cars today could see their real owners.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: A banker is a fellow who lends you his umbrella when the sun is shining, but wants it back the minute it begins to rain.
quotes.author: Paula Poundstone

quotes.quote: I don't have a bank account, because I don't know my mother's maiden name.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies. If the American people ever allow private banks to control the issue of their currency, first by inflation, then by deflation, the banks and corporations that will grow up around [the banks] will deprive the people of all property until their children wake-up homeless on the continent their fathers conquered. The issuing power should be taken from the banks and restored to the people, to whom it properly belongs.
What has a man's face to do with his character? Can a man of good character help having a disagreeable face?
quotes.author: Ann Radcliffe

quotes.quote: Think of all the beauty still left around you and be happy.
quotes.author: Anne Frank

quotes.quote: Like anyone else, there are days I feel beautiful and days I don't, and when I don't, I do something about it.
quotes.author: Cheryl Tiegs

quotes.quote: The absence of flaw in beauty is itself a flaw.
quotes.author: Havelock Ellis

quotes.quote: The words that enlighten the soul are more precious than jewels.
quotes.author: Hazrat Inayat Khan

quotes.quote: Develop interest in life as you see it; in people, things, literature, music - the world is so rich, simply throbbing with rich treasures, beautiful souls and interesting people. Forget yourself.
quotes.author: Henry Miller

quotes.quote: I'm tired of all this nonsense about beauty being only skin-deep. That's deep enough. What do you want, an adorable pancreas?
quotes.author: Jean Kerr

quotes.quote: The first question I ask myself when something doesn't seem to be beautiful is why do I think it's not beautiful. And very shortly you discover that there is no reason.
quotes.author: John Cage
