quotes.quote: The nice thing about being a celebrity is that when you bore people, they think it's their fault.
quotes.author: Henry Kissinger

quotes.quote: Living in L.A., everyone likes to mold you and change you. I don't care about fame, I don't care about being a celebrity. I know that's part of the job, but I don't feed into anyone's idea of who I should be.
quotes.author: Jessica Alba

quotes.quote: I had an epiphany a few years ago where I was out at a celebrity party and it suddenly dawned on me that I had yet to meet a celebrity who is as smart and interesting as any of my friends.
quotes.author: Moby

quotes.quote: When once a man has made celebrity necessary to his happiness, he has put it in the power of the weakest and most timorous malignity, if not to take away his satisfaction, at least to withhold it. His enemies may indulge their pride by airy negligence and gratify their malice by quiet neutrality.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: Men are not prisoners of fate, but only prisoners of their own minds.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: It's choice - not chance - that determines your destiny.
quotes.author: Jean Nidetch

quotes.quote:
Fortune can, for her pleasure, fools advance,
And toss them on the wheels of Chance.
quotes.author: Juvenal

quotes.quote: The moments that we have with friends and family, the chances that we have to make a big difference in the world or even to make a small difference to the ones we love, all those wonderful chances that life gives us, life also takes away. It can happen fast and a whole lot sooner than you think.
quotes.author: Louis Pasteur

quotes.quote: In the field of observation, chance favors only the prepared mind.
quotes.author: Ovid

quotes.quote: Chance is always powerful. Let your hook be always cast; in the pool where you least expect it, there will be a fish.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Work and acquire, and thou hast chained the wheel of Chance.
quotes.author: Thucydides

quotes.quote: The sufferings that fate inflicts on us should be borne with patience, what enemies inflict with manly courage.
quotes.author: William Jennings Bryan

quotes.quote: Destiny is no matter of chance. It is a matter of choice. It is not a thing to be waited for, it is a thing to be achieved.
They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
quotes.author: Andy Warhol

quotes.quote: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
quotes.author: Carol Burnett

quotes.quote: Change is the constant, the signal for rebirth, the egg of the phoenix.
quotes.author: Christina Baldwin

quotes.quote: The only sense that is common in the long run, is the sense of change-and we all instinctively avoid it.
quotes.author: E. B. White

quotes.quote: He who rejects change is the architect of decay. The only human institution which rejects progress is the cemetery.
quotes.author: Harold Wilson

quotes.quote: We all have big changes in our lives that are more or less a second chance.
quotes.author: Harrison Ford

quotes.quote: Things do not change; we change.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: Nothing endures but change.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.quote: It's not that some people have willpower and some don't. It's that some people are ready to change and others are not.
quotes.author: James Gordon

quotes.quote: Change has a considerable psychological impact on the human mind. To the fearful it is threatening because it means that things may get worse. To the hopeful it is encouraging because things may get better. To the confident it is inspiring because the challenge exists to make things better.
quotes.author: King Whitney Jr.

quotes.quote: We did not change as we grew older; we just became more clearly ourselves.
quotes.author: Lynn Hall

quotes.quote: The universe is change; our life is what our thoughts make it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

quotes.quote: Any transition serious enough to alter your definition of self will require not just small adjustments in your way of living and thinking but a full-on metamorphosis.
quotes.author: Martha Beck

quotes.quote: This is your time and it feels normal to you, but really, there is no normal. There's only change and resistance to it and then more change.
quotes.author: Meryl Streep

quotes.quote: The more things change, the more they remain... insane.
quotes.author: Michael Fry and T. Lewis

quotes.quote: There is nothing like returning to a place that remains unchanged to find the ways in which you yourself have altered.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
quotes.author: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.quote: Turbulence is life force. It is opportunity. Let's love turbulence and use it for change.
quotes.author: Ramsay Clark

quotes.quote: This isn't good or bad. It's just the way of things. Nothing stays the same.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote: Few will have the greatness to bend history itself; but each of us can work to change a small portion of events, and in the total of all those acts will be written the history of this generation.
quotes.author: Robert F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: Progress is a nice word. But change is its motivator and change has its enemies.
quotes.author: Robert F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: If you want change, you have to make it. If we want progress we have to drive it.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: Nothing in the world is permanent, and we're foolish when we ask anything to last, but surely we're still more foolish not to take delight in it while we have it. If change is of the essence of existence one would have thought it only sensible to make it the premise of our philosophy.
Character is like a tree and reputation like its shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Everyone has the obligation to ponder well his own specific traits of character. He must also regulate them adequately and not wonder whether someone else's traits might suit him better. The more definitely his own a man's character is, the better it fits him.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Without an acquaintance with the rules of propriety, it is impossible for the character to be established.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: Many a man's reputation would not know his character if they met on the street.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: People grow through experience if they meet life honestly and courageously. This is how character is built.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Forming characters! Whose? Our own or others? Both. And in that momentous fact lies the peril and responsibility of our existence.
quotes.author: Elihu Burritt

quotes.quote: Personality can open doors, but only character can keep them open.
quotes.author: Elmer G. Letterman

quotes.quote: I am a man of fixed and unbending principles, the first of which is to flexible at all times.
quotes.author: Francis Thompson

quotes.quote: In attempts to improve your character, know what is in your power and what is beyond it.
quotes.author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quotes.quote: A person reveals his character by nothing so clearly as the joke he resents.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.quote: Our character...is an omen of our destiny, and the more integrity we have and keep, the simpler and nobler that destiny is likely to be.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
quotes.author: Henry Clay

quotes.quote: Of all the properties which belong to honorable men, not one is so highly prized as that of character.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.quote: A man's character is his fate.
quotes.author: Hermann Hesse

quotes.quote: People with courage and character always seem sinister to the rest.
quotes.author: Isabelle Eberhardt

quotes.quote: The farther behind I leave the past, the closer I am to forging my own character.
quotes.author: James A. Froude

quotes.quote: You cannot dream yourself into a character; you must hammer and forge yourself one.
quotes.author: Japanese Proverb

quotes.quote: How easy it is for generous sentiments, high courtesy, and chivalrous courage to lose their influence beneath the chilling blight of selfishness, and to exhibit to the world a man who was great in all the minor attributes of character, but who was found wanting when it became necessary to prove how much principle is superior to policy.
quotes.author: Joan Didion

quotes.quote: When the character of a man is not clear to you, look at his friends.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Character - the willingness to accept responsibility for one's own life - is the source from which self respect springs.
quotes.author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quotes.quote: Men show their characters in nothing more clearly than in what they think laughable.
quotes.author: Marie Henri Beyle

quotes.quote: I take it as a man's duty to restrain himself.
quotes.author: Marie Leneru

quotes.quote: One can acquire everything in solitude - except character.
quotes.author: Menander

quotes.quote: To succeed is nothing, it's an accident. but to feel no doubts about oneself is something very different: it is character.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Emmons

quotes.quote: The character of a man is known from his conversations.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

quotes.quote: I could never think well of a man's intellectual or moral character, if he was habitually unfaithful to his appointments.
quotes.author: Oscar Levant

quotes.quote: The character of every act depends upon the circumstances in which it is done.
Underneath this flabby exterior is an enormous lack of character.
Too many have dispensed with generosity in order to practice charity.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: One of the serious obstacles to the improvement of our race is indiscriminate charity.
quotes.author: Andrew Carnegie

quotes.quote: The best thing to give to your enemy is forgiveness; to an opponent, tolerance; to a friend, your heart; to your child, a good example; to a father, deference; to your mother, conduct that will make her proud of you; to yourself, respect; to all men, charity.
quotes.author: Francis Maitland Balfour

quotes.quote: The living need charity more than the dead.
quotes.author: George Arnold

quotes.quote: Charity sees the need not the cause.
quotes.author: German Proverb

quotes.quote: A bone to the dog is not charity. Charity is the bone shared with the dog, when you are just as hungry as the dog.
quotes.author: Jack London

quotes.quote: In charity there is no excess.
quotes.author: Sir Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Be charitable before wealth makes thee covetous.
quotes.author: Sir Thomas Browne

quotes.quote: Charity begins at home.
quotes.author: Terence

quotes.quote: The charity that hastens to proclaim its good deeds, ceases to be charity, and is only pride and ostentation.
quotes.author: William Hutton

quotes.quote: Charm is a way of getting the answer yes without asking a clear question.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: You know what charm is: a way of getting the answer yes without having asked any clear question.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: All charming people have something to conceal, usually their total dependence on the appreciation of others.
quotes.author: Cyril Connolly

quotes.quote: Charm is the quality in others that makes us more satisfied with ourselves.
quotes.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

quotes.quote: We are born charming, fresh and spontaneous and must be civilized before we are fit to participate in society.
quotes.author: Judith Martin

quotes.quote: It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: There was a time when we expected nothing of our children but obedience, as opposed to the present, when we expect everything of them but obedience.
quotes.author: Anatole Broyard

quotes.quote: I would be the most content if my children grew up to be the kind of people who think decorating consists mostly of building enough bookshelves.
quotes.author: Anna Quindlen

quotes.quote: Grown-ups never understand anything for themselves, and it is tiresome for children to be always and forever explaining things to them.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quotes.quote: Human beings are the only creatures that allow their children to come back home.
quotes.author: Bill Cosby

quotes.quote: People who get nostalgic about childhood were obviously never children.
quotes.author: Bill Watterson

quotes.quote: If you can give your son or daughter only one gift, let it be enthusiasm.
quotes.author: Bruce Barton

quotes.quote: The first half of our lives is ruined by our parents, and the second half by our children.
quotes.author: Clarence Darrow

quotes.quote: Facing a mirror you see merely your own countenance; facing your child you finally understand how everyone else has seen you.
quotes.author: Daniel Raeburn

quotes.quote: If your parents never had children, chances are you won't, either.
quotes.author: Dick Cavett

quotes.quote: The test of the morality of a society is what it does for its children.
quotes.author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quotes.quote: The best way to keep children home is to make the home atmosphere pleasant--and let the air out of the tires.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.quote: Having a baby's sweet face so close to your own, for so long a time as it takes to nurse 'em, is a great tonic for a sad soul.
quotes.author: Fran Lebowitz

quotes.quote: We do our children no favour by keeping them near, coddling them, or showing them off to adult visitors. Not that a nursemaid does not sometimes spoil them. But the greatest favour we can do our children is to give visible example of love and esteem to our spouse. As they grow up, they may then look forward to maturity so they too can find such love.
quotes.author: Fran Lebowitz

quotes.quote: Ask your child what he wants for dinner only if he's buying.
quotes.author: Gore Vidal

quotes.quote: I must take issue with the term 'a mere child,' for it has been my invariable experience that the company of a mere child is infinitely preferable to that of a mere adult.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.quote: Never have children, only grandchildren.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.quote: That's the funny thing about havin' a kid. They come with their own set of problems; make everything else you were worried about seem kinda silly.
quotes.author: Harry S Truman

quotes.quote: Babies are cool, until you've done everything to do with 'em and you get bored. That's why T.V. shows about babies don't last more than a year.
quotes.author: John Gray

quotes.quote: A child of five would understand this. Send someone to fetch a child of five.
quotes.author: John J. Plomp

quotes.quote: My mother loved children -- she would have given anything if I had been one.
quotes.author: Juvenal

quotes.quote: I have found the best way to give advice to your children is to find out what they want and then advise them to do it.
quotes.author: King Edward VIII

quotes.quote: It is not giving children more that spoils them; it is giving them more to avoid confrontation.
quotes.author: Lawana Blackwell

quotes.quote: You know that children are growing up when they start asking questions that have answers.
quotes.author: Lawana Blackwell

quotes.quote: I am amused when goody-goodies proclaim, from the safety of their armchairs, that children are naturally prejudice-free, that they only learn to "hate" from listening to bigoted adults. Nonsense. Tolerance is a learned trait, like riding a bike or playing the piano. Those of us who actually live among children, who see them in their natural environment, know the truth: Left to their own devices, children will gang up on and abuse anyone who is even slightly different from the norm.
quotes.author: Leo J. Burke

quotes.quote: Be gentle with the young.
quotes.author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quotes.quote: The thing that impresses me the most about America is the way parents obey their children.
Outings are so much more fun when we can savor them through the children's eyes.
Youth isn't always all it's touted to be.
People who say they sleep like a baby usually don't have one.
Children might or might not be a blessing, but to create them and then fail them was surely damnation.
I never believed in Santa Claus because I knew no white dude would come into my neighborhood after dark.
quotes.author: Dick Gregory

quotes.quote: A turkey never voted for an early Christmas.
quotes.author: Irish Proverb

quotes.quote: Do give books - religious or otherwise - for Christmas. They're never fattening, seldom sinful, and permanently personal.
quotes.author: Lenore Hershey

quotes.quote: Aren't we forgeting the true meaning of Christmas? You know, the birth of Santa.
quotes.author: Matt Groening

quotes.quote: Christmas is a time when people of all religions come together to worship Jesus Christ.
quotes.author: Matt Groening

quotes.quote: I stopped believing in Santa Claus when my mother took me to see him in a department store, and he asked for my autograph.
quotes.author: Shirley Temple

quotes.quote: At Christmas play and make good cheer, For Christmas comes but once a year.
quotes.author: Thomas Tusser

quotes.quote: Civilization degrades the many to exalt the few.
quotes.author: Amos Bronson Alcott

quotes.quote: When several villages are united in a single complete community, large enough to nearly or quite self-sufficing, the state comes into existence, originating in the bare needs of life, and continuing in existence for the sake of a good life.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Underlying the whole scheme of civilization is the confidence men have in each other, confidence in their integrity, confidence in their honesty, confidence in their future.
quotes.author: Bourke Cockran

quotes.quote: We must remember that any oppression, any injustice, any hatred, is a wedge designed to attack our civilization.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: The more rapidly a civilization progresses, the sooner it dies for another to rise in its place.
quotes.author: Havelock Ellis

quotes.quote: It is better for civilization to be going down the drain than to be coming up it.
quotes.author: Henry Allen

quotes.quote: But the greatest menace to our civilization today is the conflict between giant organized systems of self-righteousness-each system only too delighted to find that the other is wicked-each only too glad that the sins give it the pretext for still deeper hatred and animosity.
quotes.author: Jane Addams

quotes.quote: Civilization is a method of living, an attitude of equal respect for all men.
quotes.author: Julian Jaynes

quotes.quote: Civilization is the art of living in towns of such size the everyone does not know everyone else.
quotes.author: Max Nordau

quotes.quote: Civilization is built on a number of ultimate principles...respect for human life, the punishment of crimes against property and persons, the equality of all good citizens before the law...or, in a word justice.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: America is the only country that went from barbarism to decadence without civilization in between.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: The end of the human race will be that it will eventually die of civilization.
quotes.author: Robert Ingersoll

quotes.quote: The true civilization is where every man gives to every other every right that he claims for himself.
quotes.author: Will Durant

quotes.quote: Civilization begins with order, grows with liberty, and dies with chaos.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: You can't say that civilization don't advance, however, for in every war they kill you in a new way.
quotes.author: William Feather

quotes.quote: One of the indictments of civilizations is that happiness and intelligence are so rarely found in the same person.
The computing field is always in need of new cliches.
quotes.author: Alan Perlis

quotes.quote: Let's have some new cliches.
quotes.author: Samuel Goldwyn

quotes.quote: Any great truth can -- and eventually will -- be expressed as a cliche -- a cliche is a sure and certain way to dilute an idea. For instance, my grandmother used to say, 'The black cat is always the last one off the fence.' I have no idea what she meant, but at one time, it was undoubtedly true.
quotes.author: Solomon Short

quotes.quote: If computers get too powerful, we can organize them into a committee -- that will do them in.
quotes.author: Bradley's Bromide

quotes.quote: A committee can make a decision that is dumber than any of its members.
quotes.author: David Coblitz

quotes.quote: Not even computers will replace committees, because committees buy computers.
quotes.author: Edward Shepherd Mead

quotes.quote: Committee--a group of men who individually can do nothing but as a group decide that nothing can be done.
quotes.author: Fred Allen

quotes.quote: There is no monument dedicated to the memory of a committee.
quotes.author: Lester J. Pourciau

quotes.quote: To get something done, a committee should consist of no more than three men, two of whom are absent.
quotes.author: Robert Copeland

quotes.quote: A committee is a cul-de-sac down which ideas are lured and then quietly strangled.
quotes.author: Sir Barnett Cocks

quotes.quote: Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age eighteen.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Stupid is forever, ignorance can be fixed.
quotes.author: Don Wood

quotes.quote: The last time anybody made a list of the top hundred character attributes of New Yorkers, common sense snuck in at number 79.
quotes.author: Douglas Adams

quotes.quote: Everybody gets so much information all day long that they lose their common sense.
quotes.author: Gertrude Stein

quotes.quote: [Common sense] is the best sense I know of.
quotes.author: Lord Chesterfield

quotes.quote: The freethinking of one age is the common sense of the next.
quotes.author: Matthew Arnold

quotes.quote: Nowadays most people die of a sort of creeping common sense, and discover when it is too late that the only things one never regrets are one's mistakes.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Nothing astonishes men so much as common sense and plain dealing.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: If an idea's worth having once, it's worth having twice.
quotes.author: Tom Stoppard

quotes.quote: Good communication is as stimulating as black coffee and just as hard to sleep after.
quotes.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quotes.quote: Every improvement in communication makes the bore more terrible.
quotes.author: Frank Moore Colby

quotes.quote: The constant free flow of communication amount us-enabling the free interchange of ideas-forms the very bloodstream of our nation. It keeps the mind and body of our democracy eternally vital, eternally young.
quotes.author: Judith Martin

quotes.quote: Let us make a special effort to stop communicating with each other, so we can have some conversation.
quotes.author: Tom Lehrer

quotes.quote: I wish people who have trouble communicating would just shut up.
quotes.author: William Butler Yeats

quotes.quote: Think like a wise man but communicate in the language of the people.
Communism doesn't work because people like to own stuff.
quotes.author: Frank Zappa

quotes.quote: Under capitalism, man exploits man. Under communism, it's just the opposite.
quotes.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quotes.quote: Communism is like one big phone company.
quotes.author: Lenny Bruce

quotes.quote: Communism is like prohibition, it's a good idea but it won't work.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: The best political community is formed by citizens of the middle class.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Isn't everyone a part of everyone else?
quotes.author: Budd Schulberg

quotes.quote: First it is necessary to stand on your own two feet. But the minute a man finds himself in that position, the next thing he should do is reach out his arms.
quotes.author: Kristin Hunter

quotes.quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.
quotes.author: Margaret Mead

quotes.quote: The universal brotherhood of man is our most precious possession.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: But the life that no longer trust another human being and no longer forms ties to the political community is not a human life any longer.
quotes.author: Martha Nussbaum

quotes.quote: God creates men, but they choose each other.
quotes.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quotes.quote: Incompetents invariably make trouble for people other than themselves.
quotes.author: Larry McMurtry

quotes.quote: Competence, like truth, beauty and contact lenses, is in the eye of the beholder.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.quote: Equal opportunity means everyone will have a fair chance at being incompetent.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.quote: Everyone rises to their level of incompetence.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.quote: The incompetent with nothing to do can still make a mess of it.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.quote: The computing field is always in need of new cliches.
quotes.author: Alan Perlis

quotes.quote: Computers make it easier to do a lot of things, but most of the things they make it easier to do don't need to be done.
quotes.author: Andy Rooney

quotes.quote: The great thing about a computer notebook is that no matter how much you stuff into it, it doesn't get bigger or heavier.
quotes.author: Bill Gates

quotes.quote: If computers get too powerful, we can organize them into a committee -- that will do them in.
quotes.author: Bradley's Bromide

quotes.quote: Why is it drug addicts and computer afficionados are both called users?
quotes.author: Clifford Stoll

quotes.quote: Home computers are being called upon to perform many new functions, including the consumption of homework formerly eaten by the dog.
quotes.author: Doug Larson

quotes.quote: Computer Science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
quotes.author: E. W. Dijkstra

quotes.quote: The question of whether a computer can think is no more interesting than the question of whether a submarine can swim.
quotes.author: E. W. Dijkstra

quotes.quote: Not even computers will replace committees, because committees buy computers.
quotes.author: Edward Shepherd Mead

quotes.quote: To err is human, but to really foul things up requires a computer.
quotes.author: Farmers' Almanac

quotes.quote: Compromise used to mean that half a loaf was better than no bread. Among modern statesmen it really seems to mean that half a loaf is better than a whole loaf.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: I do not fear computers. I fear the lack of them.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: Part of the inhumanity of the computer is that, once it is competently programmed and working smoothly, it is completely honest.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: Computers can figure out all kinds of problems, except the things in the world that just don't add up.
quotes.author: James Magary

quotes.quote: Imagine if every Thursday your shoes exploded if you tied them the usual way. This happens to us all the time with computers, and nobody thinks of complaining.
quotes.author: Jef Raskin

quotes.quote: The most overlooked advantage to owning a computer is that if they foul up there's no law against wacking them around a little.
quotes.author: Joe Martin

quotes.quote: One would think that if you're anonymous, you'd do anything you want, but groups have their own sense of community and what we can do.
quotes.author: John Allen

quotes.quote: In all large corporations, there is a pervasive fear that someone, somewhere is having fun with a computer on company time. Networks help alleviate that fear.
quotes.author: John C. Dvorak

quotes.quote: There is no reason for any individual to have a computer in his home.
quotes.author: Ken Olsen

quotes.quote: The most likely way for the world to be destroyed, most experts agree, is by accident. That's where we come in; we're computer professionals. We cause accidents.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Borenstein

quotes.quote: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.quote: The computer is a moron.
quotes.author: Peter Drucker

quotes.quote: If you put tomfoolery into a computer, nothing comes out of it but tomfoolery. But this tomfoolery, having passed through a very expensive machine, is somehow ennobled and no-one dares criticize it.
quotes.author: Pierre Gallois

quotes.quote: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the Universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the Universe is winning.
quotes.author: Rick Cook

quotes.quote: To err is human--and to blame it on a computer is even more so.
quotes.author: Robert Orben

quotes.quote: If the automobile had followed the same development cycle as the computer, a Rolls-Royce would today cost $100, get a million miles per gallon, and explode once a year, killing everyone inside.
quotes.author: Robert X. Cringely

quotes.quote: I think computer viruses should count as life. I think it says something about human nature that the only form of life we have created so far is purely destructive. We've created life in our own image.
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

quotes.quote: All programmers are playwrights and all computers are lousy actors.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: In a few minutes a computer can make a mistake so great that it would have taken many men many months to equal it.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Where a calculator on the ENIAC is equipped with 18,000 vacuum tubes and weighs 30 tons, computers in the future may have only 1,000 vaccuum tubes and perhaps weigh 1.5 tons.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Self-conceit may lead to self-destruction.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.quote: The smaller the mind the greater the conceit.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.quote: When they discover the center of the universe, a lot of people will be disappointed to discover they are not it.
