quotes.quote: And so faith is closing your eyes and following the breath of your soul down to the bottom of life, where existence and nonexistence have merged into irrelevance. All that matters is the little part you play in the vast drama.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote: God, I don�t have great faith, but I can be faithful. My belief in you may be seasonal, but my faithfulness will not. I will follow in the way of Christ. I will act as though my life and the lives of others matter. I will love. I have no greater gift to offer than my life. Take it.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote: The universe seems wondrous to me, with or without God. It has powerful lines and uncompromising ways. Patience and time sit like sages on the planets, strong and impersonal. There is a stark beauty to all of this.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote: We think having faith means being convinced God exists in the same way we are convinced a chair exists. People who cannot be completely convinced of God�s existence think faith is impossible for them. Not so. People who doubt can have great faith because faith is something you do, not something you think. In fact, the greater your doubt the more heroic your faith.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote: What I am actually saying is that we need to be willing to let our intuition guide us, and then be willing to follow that guidance directly and fearlessly.
quotes.author: Shakti Gawain

quotes.quote: To believe in God or in a guiding force because someone tells you to is the height of stupidity. We are given senses to receive our information within. With our own eyes we see, and with our own skin we feel. With our intelligence, it is intended that we understand. But each person must puzzle it out for himself or herself.
quotes.author: Sophy Burnham

quotes.quote: Faith is, at one and the same time, absolutely necessary and altogether impossible.
quotes.author: Stanislaw Lem

quotes.quote: Desire, ask, believe, receive.
quotes.author: Stella Terrill Mann

quotes.quote: Whatever God's dream about man may be, it seems certain it cannot come true unless man cooperates.
quotes.author: Stella Terrill Mann

quotes.quote: If you think you can win, you can win. Faith is necessary to victory.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.quote: He wears his faith but as the fashion of his hat.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: I respect faith, but doubt is what gets you an education.
quotes.author: Wilson Mizner

quotes.quote: Never suffer youth to be an excuse for inadequacy, nor age and fame to be an excuse for indolence.
quotes.author: Benjamin Haydon

quotes.quote: He who pursues fame at the risk of losing his self is not a scholar.
quotes.author: Chuang-tzu

quotes.quote: You can't choose what you're famous for in life.
quotes.author: Dave Kellett

quotes.quote: To have had fame, even very minor fame, and to have lost it, got older and maybe put on a little weight is a kind of living death.
quotes.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: The glory of great men should always be measured by the means they have used to acquire it.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: If you're holding out for universal popularity, I'm afraid you will be in this cabin for a very long time.
quotes.author: Jessica Alba

quotes.quote: Living in L.A., everyone likes to mold you and change you. I don't care about fame, I don't care about being a celebrity. I know that's part of the job, but I don't feed into anyone's idea of who I should be.
quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.quote: If you're a misfit within a group of misfits, does that mean you're actually popular and normal?
quotes.author: Salma Hayek

quotes.quote: Glory is fleeting, but obscurity is forever.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.quote: I think the promise of fame and what it holds to you as a child and dreaming of it is not what it is. What it is, I'm not complaining about, but it's just different than the reality you dreamed.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.quote: It's going to come true like you knew it, but it's not going to feel like you think.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: I'm a bit of an abstract figure that people can project their fantasies on; it's pretty much what we all are, otherwise we wouldn't be stars, and people wouldn't be interested. But people project things on you that have nothing to do with what you really are, or they see a little something and then exaggerate it. And you can't really control that.
Famous I don't know about. It's hard to be famous and alive. I just want to play music every day and hear someone say, 'Thanks, that was great, here's some money, same time tomorrow, okay?'
Popularity? It is glory's small change.

Glory is like a circle in the water,
Which never ceaseth to enlarge itself,
Till by broad spreading it disperses to naught.
It is dismal coming home, when there is nobody to welcome one!
quotes.author: Ann Radcliffe

quotes.quote: I can't think of anything to write about except families. They are a metaphor for every other part of society.
quotes.author: Anna Quindlen

quotes.quote: They say that blood is thicker than water. Maybe that's why we battle our own with more energy and gusto than we would ever expend on strangers.
quotes.author: David Assael

quotes.quote: Caregiver: that word should weigh more than others on a page, sag it down a bit and wrinkle it, because the simple-sounding job frazzles as it consumes and depletes. Not that it's only gloomy. Caregiving offers many fringe benefits, including the sheer sensory delight of nourishing and grooming, sharing, and playing. There's something uniquely fulfilling about being a lodestar, feeling so deeply needed, and it's fun finding creative ways to gladden a loved one's life. But caregiving does buttonhole you; you're stitched in one place.
quotes.author: Diane Ackerman

quotes.quote: We al have family disfunction. It's why we're successful, to fill that hole.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Having a baby's sweet face so close to your own, for so long a time as it takes to nurse 'em, is a great tonic for a sad soul.
quotes.author: George Burns

quotes.quote: Losing a baby is not a thing that you could ever get used to.
quotes.author: Jane Howard

quotes.quote: If you cannot get rid of the family skeleton, you may as well make it dance.
quotes.author: Jeff Foxworthy

quotes.quote: Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.quote: Call it a clan, call it a network, call it a tribe, call it a family. Whatever you call it, whoever you are, you need one.
quotes.author: Ogden Nash

quotes.quote: If you ever start feeling like you have the goofiest, craziest, most dysfunctional family in the world, all you have to do is go to a state fair. Because five minutes at the fair, you'll be going, 'you know, we're alright. We are dang near royalty.'
quotes.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone

quotes.quote: Happy families are all alike; every unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
quotes.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone

quotes.quote: A family is a unit composed not only of children but of men, women, an occasional animal, and the common cold.
No matter where you live, brothers are brothers and sisters are sisters. The bonds that keep family close are the same no matter where you are.
Family isn't about whose blood you have. It's about who you care about.
I think people that have a brother or sister don't realize how lucky they are. Sure, they fight a lot, but to know that there's always somebody there, somebody that's family.
There's never a new fashion but it's old.
quotes.author: Geoffrey Chaucer

quotes.quote: A fashion is nothing but an induced epidemic.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: I base my fashion taste on what doesn't itch.
quotes.author: Gilda Radner

quotes.quote: Every generation laughs at the old fashions, but follows religiously the new.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: I once had a sparrow alight upon my shoulder for a moment, while I was hoeing in a village garden, and I felt that I was more distinguished by that circumstance that I should have been by any epaulet I could have worn.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: I cannot and will not cut my conscience to fit this year's fashions.
quotes.author: Lillian Hellman

quotes.quote: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Fashion is something that goes in one year and out the other.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: The average American can get into the kingdom of heaven much more easily than he can get into the Boulevard St. Germain.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: What a deformed thief this fashion is.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: There is no fate that cannot be surmounted by scorn.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: To punish me for my contempt for authority, fate made me an authority myself.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: If you can't change your fate, change your attitude.
quotes.author: Amy Tan

quotes.quote: Men are not prisoners of fate, but only prisoners of their own minds.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: I do not believe in a fate that falls on all men however they act; but I do believe in a fate that falls on them unless they act.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act; but I do believe in a fate that falls on them unless they act.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: A man's character is his fate.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.quote: The fates have given mankind a patient soul.
quotes.author: Homer

quotes.quote: Talent and intelligence never yet inoculated anyone against the caprice of the fates.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: Fate chooses your relations, you choose your friends.
quotes.author: Jacques Delille

quotes.quote: Man is his own star and the soul that can render an honest and perfect man commands all light, all influence, all fate.
quotes.author: John Fletcher

quotes.quote: That consciousness is everything and that all things begin with a thought. That we are responsible for our own fate, we reap what we sow, we get what we give, we pull in what we put out. I know these things for sure.
quotes.author: Madonna

quotes.quote: Maybe our mistakes are what make our fate. Without them, what would shape our lives? Perhaps, if we never veered off course, we wouldn't fall in love or have babies or be who we are.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Whatever limits us, we call Fate.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Fate rules the affairs of mankind with no recognizable order.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: While the fates permit, live happily; life speeds on with hurried step, and with winged days the wheel of the headlong year is turned.
quotes.author: Vincent van Gogh

quotes.quote: I am not an adventurer by choice but by fate.
quotes.author: William McFee

quotes.quote: If fate means you to lose, give him a good fight anyhow.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Men at some time are the masters of their fates: The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars, but in ourselves, that we are underlings.
When one can hear people moving, one does not so much mind, about one's fears.
quotes.author: Ann Radcliffe

quotes.quote: When the mind has once begun to yield to the weakness of superstition, trifles impress it with the force of conviction.
quotes.author: Ann Radcliffe

quotes.quote: Fear is the main source of superstition, and one of the main sources of cruelty. To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Courage is fear that has said its prayers.
quotes.author: Dorothy Bernard

quotes.quote: Remember that fear always lurks behind perfectionism. Confronting your fears and allowing yourself the right to be human can, paradoxically, make you a far happier and more productive person.
quotes.author: Dr. David M. Burns

quotes.quote: No passion so effectually robs the mind of all its powers of acting and reasoning as fear.
quotes.author: Edmund Burke

quotes.quote:
One need not be a chamber to be haunted;
One need not be a house;
The brain has corridors surpassing
Material place.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.quote: It is when power is wedded to chronic fear that it becomes formidable.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: You can discover what your enemy fears most by observing the means he uses to frighten you.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: If you forgo your plan, you also have to forgo fear.
quotes.author: Farrah Gray

quotes.quote: In life we don�t get what we want, we get in life what we are. If we want more we have to be able to be more, in order to be more you have to face rejection.
quotes.author: Ferdinand Foch

quotes.quote: None but a coward dares to boast that he has never known fear.
quotes.author: Frances Moore Lappe

quotes.quote: Even the fear of death is nothing compared to the fear of not having lived authentically and fully.
quotes.author: Frances Moore Lappe

quotes.quote: I've grown certain that the root of all fear is that we've been forced to deny who we are.
quotes.author: Francis Quarles

quotes.quote: Let the fear of danger be a spur to prevent it; he that fears not, gives advantage to the danger.
quotes.author: George Carlin

quotes.quote: There are nights when the wolves are silent and only the moon howls.
quotes.author: George Sewell

quotes.quote: Fear is the tax that conscience pays to guilt.
quotes.author: Jean Paul Richter

quotes.quote: Fear plays an interesting role in our lives. How dare we let it motivate us? How dare we let it into our decision making; into our livelihoods; into our relationships? It's funny isn't it? We take a day a year to dress up, in costume and celebrate fear.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: Fear sometimes stops you from doing stupid things. But it can also stop you from doing creative or exciting or experimental things. It can cloud your judgment of others, and lead to all kinds of evil. The control and understanding of our personal fears is one of the most important undertakings in our life.
quotes.author: Marie Ebner von Eschenbach

quotes.quote: A timid person is frightened before a danger, a coward during the time, and a courageous person afterward.
quotes.author: Marilyn Ferguson

quotes.quote: Let us never negotiate out of fear. But let us never fear to negotiate.
quotes.author: Michael Pritchard

quotes.quote: Fear not those who argue but those who dodge.
quotes.author: Peter McWilliams

quotes.quote: Fear is a question: What are you afraid of, and why? Just as the seed of health is in illness, because illness contains information, your fears are a treasure house of self-knowledge if you explore them.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: Fear is that little darkroom where negatives are developed.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.quote: To use fear as the friend it is, we must retrain and reprogram ourselves...We must persistently and convincingly tell ourselves that the fear is here--with its gift of energy and heightened awareness--so we can do our best and learn the most in the new situation.
quotes.author: Susan Jeffers

quotes.quote: The fear of death is more to be dreaded than death itself.

Almost everything: all external expectations, all pride all fear of embarrassment or failure. These tings just fall away in the face of death, leaving only what is truly important. Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose.
Feel the fear and do it anyway.
Everyone has certain fears, certain things that one cannot abide.
"Fearless" is living in spite of those things that scare you to death.

It's amazing how pervasive food is. Every second commercial is for food. Every second TV episode takes place around a meal. In the city, you can't go ten feet without seeing or smelling a restaurant. There are 20 foot high hamburgers up on billboards. I am acutely aware of food, and its omnipresence is astounding.
quotes.author: Adam Scott

quotes.quote: Eat breakfast like a king, lunch like a prince, and dinner like a pauper.
quotes.author: Adelle Davis

quotes.quote: We are indeed much more than what we eat, but what we eat can nevertheless help us to be much more than what we are.
quotes.author: Adelle Davis

quotes.quote: Nothing will benefit human health and increase the chances for survival of life on Earth as much as the evolution to a vegetarian diet.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Eating is always a decision, nobody forces your hand to pick up food and put it into your mouth.
quotes.author: Alice May Brock

quotes.quote: Fat is a barrier, a bellicose statement to others that, to some, justifies hostility in kind. The world says to the fat person, "Your fatness is an affront to me, so we have the right to treat you as offensively as you appear." Fat is not merely viewed as another type of tissue, but as a diagnostic sign, a personal statement, and a measure of personality. Too little fat and we see you as being antisocial, fearful and sexless. Too much fat and we see you as slothful, stupid, and sexually hung up.
quotes.author: Anthelme Brillat-Savarin

quotes.quote: Fat people, it is commonly held, should be punished because they offend our aesthetic sensibilities. They take up too much space on subways, buses, airplanes, and elevators. They consume more than they contribute to society. They become ill and need to be taken care of, or they die early and their families are left unsupported. The only way fat people can gain some acceptance and forgiveness for their crime of overeating is to at least try, or look like they are trying, to lose weight. They must never eat an ice cream cone in public, never be seen eating a normal sized portion of non-diet food!
quotes.author: Calvin Trillin

quotes.quote: Tomatoes and oregano make it Italian; wine and tarragon make it French. Sour cream makes it Russian; lemon and cinnamon make it Greek. Soy sauce makes it Chinese; garlic makes it good.
quotes.author: Calvin Trillin

quotes.quote: Tell me what you eat, and I will tell you what you are.
quotes.author: Cyra McFadden

quotes.quote: Health food makes me sick.
quotes.author: Eike von Repkow

quotes.quote: The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: I no longer prepare food or drink with more than one ingredient.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Eating is really one of your indoor sports. You play three times a day, and it's well worth while to make the game as pleasant as possible.
quotes.author: Fran Lebowitz

quotes.quote: My ability to tolerate shame, to compartmentalize it, to swallow it, increased right along with my belt size. it came with the territory of being heavy. Obese people have a lifetime of experience with shame.
quotes.author: Fran Lebowitz

quotes.quote: The people who can most successfully lose weight and maintain a healthy life style are foodies. When it comes to healthy eating, people who know how to cook and make ingredients taste good have a distinct advantage over those who can't.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: He who comes first, eats first. [Familiar as: First come first served.]
quotes.author: Geoffrey Neighor

quotes.quote: Bear in mind that you should conduct yourself in life as at a feast.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Preach not to others what they should eat, but eat as becomes you, and be silent.
quotes.author: George Dennison Prentice

quotes.quote: I have never cared much for fish - it floats in the belly as much as in the pond.
quotes.author: Henry Bromel

quotes.quote: If the divine creator has taken pains to give us delicious and exquisite things to eat, the least we can do is prepare them well and serve them with ceremony.
quotes.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quotes.quote: Food is an important part of a balanced diet.
My favorite animal is steak.
Music with dinner is an insult both to the cook and the violinist.

Just as animal research tells us that gluttony and sloth are side effects of a drive to accumulate body fat, it also says that eating in moderation and being physically active (literally, having the energy to exercise) are not evidence of moral rectitude. Rather, they're the metabolic benefits of a body that's programmed to remain lean.
We don't get fat because we overeat; we overeat because we're getting fat.
Good food ends with good talk.
There is no love sincerer than the love of food.
What some call health, if purchased by perpetual anxiety about diet, isn't much better than tedious disease.
It's important to begin a search on a full stomach.
If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world.
Forgive many things in others; nothing in yourself.
quotes.author: Ausonius

quotes.quote: Anger makes you smaller, while forgiveness forces you to grow beyond what you were.
quotes.author: Cherie Carter-Scott

quotes.quote: If you haven't forgiven yourself something, how can you forgive others?
quotes.author: Dolores Huerta

quotes.quote: To err is human; to forgive, infrequent.
quotes.author: Franklin P. Adams

quotes.quote: 'Tis the most tender part of love, each other to forgive.
quotes.author: John Sheffield

quotes.quote: There is no revenge so complete as forgiveness.
quotes.author: Josh Billings

quotes.quote: Forgiveness is almost a selfish act because of its immense benefits to the one who forgives.
quotes.author: Lawana Blackwell

quotes.quote: The hatred you're carrying is a live coal in your heart - far more damaging to yourself than to them.
quotes.author: Lawana Blackwell

quotes.quote: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: Life is an adventure in forgiveness.
quotes.author: Norman Cousins

quotes.quote: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Forgiveness does not always lead to a healed relationship. Some people are not capable of love, and it might be wise to let them go along with your anger. Wish them well, and let them go their way.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote: Forgiveness is the healing of wounds caused by another. You choose to let go of a past wrong and no longer be hurt by it. Forgiveness is a strong move to make, like turning your shoulders sideways to walk quickly on a crowded sidewalk. It's your move.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote: It really doesn't matter if the person who hurt you deserves to be forgiven. Forgiveness is a gift you give yourself. You have things to do and you want to move on.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote: No one forgives with more grace and love than a child.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote: It is easier to get forgiveness than permission.
quotes.author: Stuart's Law of Retroaction

quotes.quote: The stupid neither forgive nor forget; the naive forgive and forget; the wise forgive but do not forget.
quotes.author: Thomas Szasz

quotes.quote: A woman can forgive a man for the harm he does her...but she can never forgive him for the sacrifices he makes on her account.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.quote: Pray you now, forget and forgive.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Calamities are of two kinds: misfortunes to ourselves, and good fortune to others.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: We should manage our fortunes as we do our health - enjoy it when good, be patient when it is bad, and never apply violent remedies except in an extreme necessity.
quotes.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: Behind every great fortune there is a crime.
quotes.author: Honore de Balzac

quotes.quote: Many men can make a fortune but very few can build a family.
quotes.author: J. S. Bryan

quotes.quote:
Fortune can, for her pleasure, fools advance,
And toss them on the wheels of Chance.
quotes.author: Juvenal

quotes.quote: Depend not on fortune, but on conduct.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: Nature magically suits a man to his fortunes, by making them the fruit of his character.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Every man is the architect of his own fortune.
quotes.author: Sallust

quotes.quote: Of all human ills, greatest is fortune's wayward tyranny.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.quote: Fortune does not change men, it unmasks them.
quotes.author: Suzanne Necker

quotes.quote: Fortune helps the brave.
quotes.author: Terence

quotes.quote: Fortune favors the brave.
quotes.author: Virgil

quotes.quote: Henceforth I ask not good fortune. I myself am good fortune.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.quote: My definition of a free society is a society where it is safe to be unpopular.
quotes.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.

quotes.quote: Freedom is just Chaos, with better lighting.
quotes.author: Alan Dean Foster

quotes.quote: Everything that is really great and inspiring is created by the individual who can labor in freedom.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The basis of a democratic state is liberty.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Because you are in control of your life. Don't ever forget that. You are what you are because of the conscious and subconscious choices you have made.
quotes.author: Barbara Hall

quotes.quote: Those who would give up essential liberty to purchase a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: If you want to be free, there is but one way; it is to guarantee an equally full measure of liberty to all your neighbors. There is no other.
quotes.author: Carl Schurz

quotes.quote: When we lose the right to be different, we lose the privilege to be free.
quotes.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider

quotes.quote: We hold in our hands, the most precious gift of all: Freedom. The freedom to express our art. Our love. The freedom to be who we want to be. We are not going to give that freedom away and no one shall take it from us!
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Only the educated are free.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: In the truest sense, freedom cannot be bestowed; it must be achieved.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Liberty means responsibility. That is why most men dread it.
quotes.author: Justice Anthony Kennedy

quotes.quote: The only freedom which deserves the name, is that of pursuing our own good in our own way, so long as we do not attempt to deprive others of theirs, or impede their efforts to obtain it.
quotes.author: Lawana Blackwell

quotes.quote: The First Amendment is often inconvenient. But that is besides the point. Inconvenience does not absolve the government of its obligation to tolerate speech.
quotes.author: Lenin

quotes.quote: Patterning your life around other's opinions is nothing more than slavery.
quotes.author: Lord Acton

quotes.quote: While the State exists, there can be no freedom. When there is freedom there will be no State.
quotes.author: Malcolm X

quotes.quote: Liberty is not a means to a higher political end. It is itself the highest political end.
quotes.author: Malcolm X

quotes.quote: Nobody can give you freedom. Nobody can give you equality or justice or anything. If you're a man, you take it.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: You can't separate peace from freedom because no one can be at peace unless he has his freedom.
quotes.author: Maxwell Anderson

quotes.quote: It is by the goodness of God that in our country we have those three unspeakably precious things: freedom of speech, freedom of conscience, and the prudence never to practice either of them.
quotes.author: Patricia Sampson

quotes.quote: This liberty will look easy by and by when nobody dies to get it.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.quote: Self-reliance is the only road to true freedom, and being one's own person is its ultimate reward.
quotes.author: Soren Kierkegaard

quotes.quote: To know what you prefer instead of humbly saying Amen to what the world tells you you ought to prefer, is to have kept your soul alive.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.quote: A man's worst difficulties begin when he is able to do as he likes.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.quote: I would rather be exposed to the inconveniences attending too much liberty than to those attending too small a degree of it.
We fight not to enslave, but to set a country free, and to make room upon the earth for honest men to live in.
The love of liberty is the love of others; the love of power is the love of ourselves.

He who has a thousand friends has not a friend to spare,
And he who has one enemy will meet him everywhere.
quotes.author: Ali ibn-Abi-Talib

quotes.quote: Misfortune shows those who are not really friends.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Without friends no one would choose to live, though he had all other goods.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: A good friend can tell you what is the matter with you in a minute. He may not seem such a good friend after telling.
quotes.author: Arthur Brisbane

quotes.quote: The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.quote: Friendship make prosperity more shining and lessens adversity by dividing and sharing it.

quotes.quote: Humor is our way of defending ourselves from life's absurdities by thinking absurdly about them.
quotes.author: Mel Brooks

quotes.quote: Humor is the great thing, the saving thing. The minute it crops up, all our irritations and resentments slip away and a sunny spirit takes their place.
quotes.author: Peter Ustinov

quotes.quote: Humor is a rubber sword - it allows you to make a point without drawing blood.
quotes.author: Pico Iyer

quotes.quote: Humor is just another defense against the universe.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you walk into an open sewer and die.
quotes.author: Robert Benchley

quotes.quote: Comedy is simply a funny way of being serious.
quotes.author: Salma Hayek

quotes.quote: Comedy is nothing more than tragedy deferred.
Wit makes its own welcome, and levels all distinctions. No dignity, no learning, no force of character, can make any stand against good wit.
Defining and analyzing humor is a pastime of humorless people.
Life is tough, and if you have the ability to laugh at it you have the ability to enjoy it.
I'm an idealist. I don't know where I'm going, but I'm on my way.
quotes.author: Carl Sandburg

quotes.quote: Idealism is what precedes experience; cynicism is what follows.
quotes.author: David T. Wolf

quotes.quote: An idealist is one who, on noticing that a rose smells better than a cabbage, concludes that it will also make better soup.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: An idealist is a person who helps other people to be prosperous.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: When they come downstairs from their Ivory Towers, Idealists are very apt to walk straight into the gutter.
quotes.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quotes.quote: Cynics regarded everybody as equally corrupt... Idealists regarded everybody as equally corrupt, except themselves.
quotes.author: Robert Anton Wilson

quotes.quote: He can compress the most words into the smallest ideas of any man I ever met.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: The vitality of thought is in adventure. Ideas won't keep. Something must be done about them.
quotes.author: Alfred North Whitehead

quotes.quote: It is by acts and not by ideas that people live.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.quote: Ideals are like stars: you will not succeed in touching them with your hands, but like the seafaring man on the ocean desert of waters, you choose them as your guides, and following them, you reach your destiny.
quotes.author: Carl Schurz

quotes.quote: There are only two kinds of scholars; those who love ideas and those who hate them.
quotes.author: Emile Chartier

quotes.quote: An idea is salvation by imagination.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.quote: Everyone is a genius at least once a year. The real geniuses simply have their bright ideas closer together.
quotes.author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quotes.quote: I said to myself, I have things in my head that are not like what anyone has taught me - shapes and ideas so near to me - so natural to my way of being and thinking that it hasn't occurred to me to put them down. I decided to start anew, to strip away what I had been taught.
quotes.author: Georgia O'Keeffe

quotes.quote: Any man who afflicts the human race with ideas must be prepare to see them misunderstood.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: To die for an idea; it is unquestionably noble. But how much nobler it would be if men died for ideas that were true!
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: Every composer knows the anguish and despair occasioned by forgetting ideas which one had no time to write down.
quotes.author: Hector Berlioz

quotes.quote: College isn't the place to go for ideas.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: This is my answer to the gap between ideas and action - I will write it out.
quotes.author: Hortense Calisher

quotes.quote: Don't worry about people stealing an idea. If it's original, you will have to ram it down their throats.
quotes.author: Howard Aiken

quotes.quote: Good ideas are not adopted automatically. They must be driven into practice with courageous patience.
quotes.author: Hyman Rickover

quotes.quote: So many new ideas are at first strange and horrible, though ultimately valuable that a very heavy responsibility rests upon those who would prevent their dissemination.
quotes.author: J. B. S. Haldane

quotes.quote: Do something. If it doesn't work, do something else. No idea is too crazy.
quotes.author: Jim Hightower

quotes.quote: When ideas fail, words come in very handy.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: I can't understand why people are frightened of new ideas. I'm frightened of the old ones.
quotes.author: John Cage

quotes.quote: Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them, and pretty soon you have a dozen.
quotes.author: John Steinbeck

quotes.quote: A handsome parson is fit for nothing but ti put ideas into the young woman's heads.
quotes.author: Ken Hakuta

quotes.quote: Lack of money is no obstacle. Lack of an idea is an obstacle.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.quote: Man's mind, once stretched by a new idea, never regains its original dimensions.
quotes.author: P. B. Medawar

quotes.quote: The human mind treats a new idea the same way the body treats a strange protein; it rejects it.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: All opening moves were the same, like in chess. You don't have to come up with anything new, there's no point, because you're both after the same thing anyway. The game soon finds its own way and it's only at that point that you need a strategy.
quotes.author: Samuel Goldwyn

quotes.quote: The key to every man is his thought.... He can only be reformed by showing him a new idea which commands his own.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: I had a monumental idea this morning, but I didn't like it.
quotes.author: Sir Barnett Cocks

quotes.quote: The best ideas are common property.
quotes.author: Sir Frederick G. Banting

quotes.quote: A committee is a cul-de-sac down which ideas are lured and then quietly strangled.
No one has ever had an idea in a dress suit.
I believe in the forgiveness of sin and the redemption of ignorance.
quotes.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.

quotes.quote: A person is never happy except at the price of some ignorance.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.quote: Ignorance never settles a question.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: To be conscious that you are ignorant is a great step to knowledge.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: Consistency requires you to be as ignorant today as you were a year ago.
quotes.author: Bernard Berenson

quotes.quote: A little learning is a dangerous thing but a lot of ignorance is just as bad.
quotes.author: Bob Edwards

quotes.quote: Ignorance is the night of the mind, but a night without moon and star.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: Stupid is forever, ignorance can be fixed.
quotes.author: Don Wood

quotes.quote: It is no good to try to stop knowledge from going forward. Ignorance is never better than knowledge.
quotes.author: Enrico Fermi

quotes.quote: I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him.
quotes.author: Galileo Galilei

quotes.quote: Ignorance gives one a large range of probabilities.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: It is better to confess ignorance than provide it.
quotes.author: Homer Hickam

quotes.quote: Ignorance of certain subjects is a great part of wisdom.
quotes.author: Hugo De Groot

quotes.quote: If knowledge can create problems, it is not through ignorance that we can solve them.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: My whole career can be summed up with 'Ignorance is bliss.' When you do not know better, you do not really worry about failing.
quotes.author: Jeff Foxworthy

quotes.quote: It is impossible to make people understand their ignorance; for it requires knowledge to perceive it and therefore he that can perceive it hath it not.
quotes.author: Jeremy Taylor

quotes.quote: Nothing is worse than active ignorance.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Ignorance and inconsideration are the two great causes of the ruin of mankind.
quotes.author: John Tillotson

quotes.quote: Against logic there is no armor like ignorance.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.quote: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence; then success is sure.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Nothing in all the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.quote: We allow our ignorance to prevail upon us and make us think we can survive alone, alone in patches, alone in groups, alone in races, even alone in genders.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.quote: It's innocence when it charms us, ignorance when it doesn't.
quotes.author: Mignon McLaughlin

quotes.quote: Ignorance, the root and the stem of every evil.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: Better be ignorant of a matter than half know it.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: There are many things of which a wise man might wish to be ignorant.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Ignorance is not innocence but sin.
quotes.author: Robert Browning

quotes.quote: Nothing is so good for an ignorant man as silence; and if he was sensible of this he would not be ignorant.
quotes.author: Saadi

quotes.quote: It is worse still to be ignorant of your ignorance.
quotes.author: Saint Jerome

quotes.quote: The greater the ignorance the greater the dogmatism.
quotes.author: Sir William Osler

quotes.quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge...
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Memory feeds imagination.
quotes.author: Amy Tan

quotes.quote: So you see, imagination needs moodling - long, inefficient, happy idling, dawdling and puttering.
quotes.author: Brenda Ueland

quotes.quote: Our imagination is the only limit to what we can hope to have in the future.
quotes.author: Charles F. Kettering

quotes.quote: An idea is salvation by imagination.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.quote: Imagination is the beginning of creation. You imagine what you desire, you will what you imagine and at last you create what you will.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Choosing to live in narrow spaces leads to form of mental agoraphobia and that brings its own terrors. I think the willfully unimaginative see more monsters, they are often more afraid. What is more, those who choose not to empathize enable real monsters. For without ever committing an act of outright evil ourselves, we collude through our own apathy.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: Imagination is not only the uniquely human capacity to envision that which is not, and, therefore, the foundation of all invention and innovation. In its arguably most transformative and relevetory capacity, it is the power that enables us to empathize with humans whose experiences we have never shared.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all the power we need inside ourselves already. We have the power to imagine better.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: There is nothing more dreadful than imagination without taste.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Imagination is the one weapon in the war against reality.
quotes.author: Jules de Gaultier

quotes.quote: You cannot depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Everything you can imagine is real.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.quote: There is only one admirable form of the imagination: the imagination that is so intense that it creates a new reality, that it makes things happen.
quotes.author: Sean O'Faolain

quotes.quote: Skill without imagination is craftsmanship and gives us many useful objects such as wickerwork picnic baskets. Imagination without skill gives us modern art.
quotes.author: Tom Stoppard

quotes.quote: The average man, who does not know what to do with his life, wants another one which will last forever.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.quote: The only thing wrong with immortality is that it tends to go on forever.
quotes.author: Herb Caen

quotes.quote: If all else fails, immortality can always be assured by spectacular error.
quotes.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quotes.quote: Ten thousand fools proclaim themselves into obscurity, while one wise man forgets himself into immortality.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.quote: Seek not, my soul, the life of the immortals; but enjoy to the full the resources that are within thy reach.
quotes.author: Pindar

quotes.quote: The soul of man is immortal and imperishable.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: Immortality. I notice that as soon as writers broach this question they begin to quote. I hate quotation. Tell me what you know.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: The first condition of immortality is death.
quotes.author: Stanislaw J. Lec

quotes.quote: Millions long for immortality who don't know what to do with themselves on a rainy Sunday afternoon.
quotes.author: Susan Ertz

quotes.quote:
I have
Immortal longings in me.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: I don't want to achieve immortality through my work... I want to achieve it through not dying.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.quote: Inspiration may be a form of superconsciousness, or perhaps of subconsciousness - I wouldn't know. But I am sure it is the antithesis of self- consciousness.
quotes.author: Aaron Copland

quotes.quote: We should be taught not to wait for inspiration to start a thing. Action always generates inspiration. Inspiration seldom generates action.
quotes.author: Frank Tibolt

quotes.quote: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
quotes.author: Jack London

quotes.quote: Inspiration is wonderful when it happens, but the writer must develop an approach for the rest of the time... The wait is simply too long.
quotes.author: Leonard Bernstein

quotes.quote: I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled [poets] to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Genius is one per cent inspiration, ninety-nine per cent perspiration.
quotes.author: Thomas A. Edison

quotes.quote: Genius is one percent inspiration, ninety-nine percent perspiration.
quotes.author: Thomas A. Edison

quotes.quote: If a man is offered a fact which goes against his instincts, he will scrutinize it closely, and unless the evidence is overwhelming, he will refuse to believe it. If, on the other hand, he is offered something which affords a reason for acting in accordance to his instincts, he will accept it even on the slightest evidence. The origin of myths is explained in this way.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: The wise are instructed by reason; ordinary minds by experience; the stupid, by necessity; and brutes by instinct.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: It is only by following your deepest instinct that you can lead a rich life, and if you let your fear of consequence prevent you from following your deepest instinct, then your life will be safe, expedient and thin.
quotes.author: Katharine Butler Hathaway

quotes.quote: There can be as much value in the blink of an eye as in months of rational analysis.
quotes.author: Malcolm Gladwell

quotes.quote: Truly successful decision making relies on a balance between deliberate and instinctive thinking.
quotes.author: Malcolm Gladwell

quotes.quote: Creativity comes from trust. Trust your instincts.
quotes.author: Rita Mae Brown

quotes.quote: I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled [poets] to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Though the vicious can sometimes pour affliction upon the good, their power is transient and their punishment certain; and that innocence, though oppressed by injustice, shall, supported by patience, finally triumph over misfortune!
quotes.author: Ann Radcliffe

quotes.quote: What are riches - grandeur - health itself, to the luxury of a pure conscience, the health of the soul; - and what the sufferings of poverty, disappointment, despair - to the anguish of an afflicted one!
quotes.author: Ann Radcliffe

quotes.quote: Our character...is an omen of our destiny, and the more integrity we have and keep, the simpler and nobler that destiny is likely to be.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.quote: In silence man can most readily preserve his integrity.
quotes.author: Meister Eckhart

quotes.quote: Real integrity is doing the right thing, knowing that nobody's going to know whether you did it or not.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: Integrity combined with faithfulness is a powerful force and worthy of great respect.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote: Integrity without knowledge is weak and useless, and knowledge without integrity is dangerous and dreadful.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: I ran the wrong kind of business, but I did it with integrity.
quotes.author: Sydney Biddle Barrows

quotes.quote: Great spirits have always found violent opposition from mediocrities.  The latter cannot understand it when a man does not thoughtlessly submit to hereditary prejudices, but honestly and courageously uses his intelligence and fulfills the duty to express the results of his thought in clear form.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: It has yet to be proven that intelligence has any survival value.
quotes.author: Arthur C. Clarke

quotes.quote: Men fear thought as they fear nothing else on earth -- more than ruin -- more even than death.... Thought is subversive and revolutionary, destructive and terrible, thought is merciless to privilege, established institutions, and comfortable habit. Thought looks into the pit of hell and is not afraid. Thought is great and swift and free, the light of the world, and the chief glory of man.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: So far as I can remember, there is not one word in the Gospels in praise of intelligence.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Sometimes I think the surest sign that intelligent life exists elsewhere in the universe is that none of it has tried to contact us.
quotes.author: Bill Watterson

quotes.quote: There is nobody so irritating as somebody with less intelligence and more sense than we have.
quotes.author: Don Herold

quotes.quote: The test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in the mind at the same time, and still retain the ability to function.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.quote: It is not worth an intelligent man's time to be in the majority. By definition, there are already enough people to do that.
quotes.author: G. H. Hardy

quotes.quote: One man that has a mind and knows it can always beat ten men who haven't and don't.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Readers are plentiful; thinkers are rare.
quotes.author: Harriet Martineau

quotes.quote: Truly great madness cannot be achieved without significant intelligence.
quotes.author: Henrik Tikkanen

quotes.quote: There is no such thing as an underestimate of average intelligence.
quotes.author: Henry Adams

quotes.quote: You don't have to be a genius when you're surrounded by morons.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.quote: An intelligence test sometimes shows a man how smart he would have been not to have taken it.
quotes.author: Lisa Alther

quotes.quote: I happen to feel that the degree of a person's intelligence is directly reflected by the number of conflicting attitudes she can bring to bear on the same topic.
quotes.author: Mary Pettibone Poole

quotes.quote: To repeat what others have said, requires education; to challenge it, requires brains.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Beware when the great God lets loose a thinker on this planet.
quotes.author: Robert J. Shiller

quotes.quote: The ability to focus attention on important things is a defining characteristic of intelligence.
quotes.author: Theodore Roethke

quotes.quote: A mind too active is no mind at all.
quotes.author: Woodrow Wilson

quotes.quote: I not only use all the brains that I have, but all that I can borrow.
When I took office, only high energy physicists had ever heard of what is called the Worldwide Web.... Now even my cat has its own page.
quotes.author: Bill Clinton

quotes.quote: It shouldn't be too much of a surprise that the Internet has evolved into a force strong enough to reflect the greatest hopes and fears of those who use it. After all, it was designed to withstand nuclear war, not just the puny huffs and puffs of politicians and religious fanatics.
quotes.author: Denise Caruso

quotes.quote: The Internet is like alcohol in some sense. It accentuates what you would do anyway. If you want to be a loner, you can be more alone. If you want to connect, it makes it easier to connect.
quotes.author: Esther Dyson

quotes.quote: My favorite thing about the Internet is that you get to go into the private world of real creeps without having to smell them.
quotes.author: Penn Jillette

quotes.quote: On the Internet, nobody knows you're a dog.
quotes.author: Peter Steiner

quotes.quote: We've heard that a million monkeys at a million keyboards could produce the complete works of Shakespeare; now, thanks to the Internet, we know that is not true.
quotes.author: Robert Wilensky

quotes.quote: If you ever start to feel too good about yourself, they have this thing called the Internet, and you can find a lot of people there who don't like you.
quotes.author: William Gibson

quotes.quote: The 'Net is a waste of time, and that's exactly what's right about it.
I don't think necessity is the mother of invention - invention, in my opinion, arises directly from idleness, possibly also from laziness. To save oneself trouble.
quotes.author: Agatha Christie

quotes.quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
quotes.author: Alan Kay

quotes.quote: An inventor is simply a fellow who doesn't take his education too seriously.
quotes.author: Charles F. Kettering

quotes.quote: We are more ready to try the untried when what we do is inconsequential.  Hence the fact that many inventions had their birth as toys.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: Getting caught is the mother of invention.
quotes.author: Robert Byrne

quotes.quote: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.
quotes.author: Thomas A. Edison

quotes.quote: Invention is the mother of necessity.
quotes.author: Thorstein Veblen

quotes.quote: It is in the character of very few men to honor without envy a friend who has prospered.
quotes.author: Aeschylus

quotes.quote: Our envy of others devours us most of all.
quotes.author: Alexander Solzhenitsyn

quotes.quote: Such is the inconsistency of real love, that it is always awake to suspicion, however unreasonable; always requiring new assurances from the object of its interest.
quotes.author: Ann Radcliffe

quotes.quote: Do not envy a sinner; you don't know what disaster awaits him.
quotes.author: Bible

quotes.quote: Jealousy is all the fun you think they had.
quotes.author: Erica Jong

quotes.quote: Moral indignation is jealousy with a halo.
quotes.author: H. G. Wells

quotes.quote: It is better to be envied than pitied.
quotes.author: Herodotus

quotes.quote: Envy can be a positive motivator. Let it inspire you to work harder for what you want.
quotes.author: Robert Bringle

quotes.quote: They envy the distinction I have won; let them therefore, envy my toils, my honesty, and the methods by which I gained it.
quotes.author: Sallust

quotes.quote: Envy is the ulcer of the soul.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote:
O, beware, my lord, of jealousy!
It is the green-eyed monster which doth mock
The meat it feeds on.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: People everywhere confuse what they read in newspapers with news.
quotes.author: A. J. Liebling

quotes.quote: To read a newspaper is to refrain from reading something worthwhile.  The first discipline of education must therefore be to refuse resolutely to feed the mind with canned chatter.
quotes.author: Aleister Crowley

quotes.quote: Trying to be a first-rate reporter on the average American newspaper is like trying to play Bach's 'St. Matthew's Passion' on a ukulele.
quotes.author: Bagdikian's Observation

quotes.quote: Trying to determine what is going on in the world by reading newspapers is like trying to tell the time by watching the second hand of a clock.
quotes.author: Ben Hecht

quotes.quote: Literature is the art of writing something that will be read twice; journalism what will be read once.
quotes.author: Cyril Connolly

quotes.quote: USA Today has come out with a new survey - apparently, three out of every four people make up 75% of the population.
quotes.author: David Letterman

quotes.quote: Editor: a person employed by a newspaper, whose business it is to separate the wheat from the chaff, and to see that the chaff is printed.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: Rock journalism is people who can't write interviewing people who can't talk for people who can't read.
quotes.author: Frank Zappa

quotes.quote: Journalism largely consists of saying 'Lord Jones is Dead' to people who never knew that Lord Jones was alive.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: Half of the American people have never read a newspaper. Half never voted for President. One hopes it is the same half.
quotes.author: Gore Vidal

quotes.quote: All successful newspapers are ceaselessly querulous and bellicose. They never defend anyone or anything if they can help it; if the job is forced on them, they tackle it by denouncing someone or something else.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: A newspaper consists of just the same number of words, whether there be any news in it or not.
quotes.author: Henry Fielding

quotes.quote: It's amazing that the amount of news that happens in the world every day always just exactly fits the newspaper.
quotes.author: Jerry Seinfeld

quotes.quote: Rage is the only quality which has kept me, or anybody I have ever studied, writing columns for newspapers.
quotes.author: Jimmy Breslin

quotes.quote: You must have a room, or a certain hour or so a day, where you don't know what was in the newspapers that morning... a place where you can simply experience and bring forth what you are and what you might be.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.quote: Once a newspaper touches a story, the facts are lost forever, even to the protagonists.
quotes.author: Norman Mailer

quotes.quote:
But what is the difference between literature and journalism?
...Journalism is unreadable and literature is not read. That is all.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Every journalist has a novel in him, which is an excellent place for it.
quotes.author: Russel Lynes

quotes.quote: Newspapermen learn to call a murderer 'an alleged murderer' and the King of England 'the alleged King of England' to avoid libel suits.
quotes.author: Stephen Leacock

quotes.quote: Advertisements... contain the only truths to be relied on in a newspaper.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: I do not take a single newspaper, nor read one a month, and I feel myself infinitely the happier for it.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: I read no newspaper now but Ritchie's, and in that chiefly the advertisements, for they contain the only truths to be relied on in a newspaper.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: The man who reads nothing at all is better educated than the man who reads nothing but newspapers.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: The only joy in the world is to begin.
quotes.author: Cesare Pavese

quotes.quote: This is the best kind of voyeurism, hearing joy from your neighbors.
quotes.author: Chuck Sigars

quotes.quote: Give not over thy soul to sorrow; and afflict not thyself in thy own counsel. Gladness of heart is the life of man and the joyfulness of man is length of days.
quotes.author: Ecclesiastes

quotes.quote: Do not judge men by mere appearances; for the light laughter that bubbles on the lip often mantles over the depths of sadness, and the serious look may be the sober veil that covers a divine peace and joy.
quotes.author: Edward Chapin

quotes.quote: Short is the joy that guilty pleasure brings.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: During [these] periods of relaxation after concentrated intellectual activity, the intuitive mind seems to take over and can produce the sudden clarifying insights which give so much joy and delight.
quotes.author: Fritjof Capra

quotes.quote: This is the true joy in life, the being used for a purpose recognized by yourself as a mighty one; the being thoroughly worn out before you are thrown on the scrap heap; the being a force of Nature instead of a feverish selfish little clod of ailments and grievances complaining that the world will not devote itself to making you happy.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: We could never learn to be brave and patient, if there were only joy in the world.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: I feel like a tiny bird with a big song!
quotes.author: Jerry Van Amerongen

quotes.quote: I've grown to realize the joy that comes from little victories is preferable to the fun that comes from ease and the pursuit of pleasure.
quotes.author: Lawana Blackwell

quotes.quote: I cannot believe that the inscrutable universe turns on an axis of suffering; surely the strange beauty of the world must somewhere rest on pure joy!
quotes.author: Louise Bogan

quotes.quote: Grief can take care of itself, but to get the full value of a joy you must have somebody to divide it with.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: May your walls know joy; May every room hold laughter and every window open to great possibility.
quotes.author: Maryanne Radmacher-Hershey

quotes.quote: The most profound joy has more of gravity than of gaiety in it.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.quote: Joy is prayer - Joy is strength - Joy is love - Joy is a net of love by which you can catch souls.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.quote: The joy of a spirit is the measure of its power.
quotes.author: Ninon de Lenclos

quotes.quote: I define joy as a sustained sense of well-being and internal peace - a connection to what matters.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: There is an alchemy in sorrow. It can be transmuted into wisdom, which, if it does not bring joy, can yet bring happiness.
quotes.author: Pearl Buck

quotes.quote: Winning is important to me, but what brings me real joy is the experience of being fully engaged in whatever I'm doing.
quotes.author: Phil Jackson

quotes.quote: Joy is not in things; it is in us.
quotes.author: Richard Wagner

quotes.quote: Learning to live in the present moment is part of the path of joy.
quotes.author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

quotes.quote:
My mind to me a kingdom is,
Such present joys therein I find,
That it excels all other bliss.
quotes.author: Sir Edward Dyer

quotes.quote: Real joy comes not from ease or riches or from the praise of men, but from doing something worthwhile.
quotes.author: Sir Wilfred Grenfell

quotes.quote: There is no greater joy nor greater reward than to make a fundamental difference in someone's life.
quotes.author: Sister Mary Rose McGeady

quotes.quote: When you jump for joy, beware that no one moves the ground from beneath your feet.
quotes.author: Stanislaw J. Lec

quotes.quote:
Cease, every joy, to glimmer on my mind,
But leave---oh! leave the light of Hope behind.
quotes.author: Thomas Campbell

quotes.quote: Things won are done; joy's soul lies in the doing.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: I have always found that mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Courage is of no value unless accompanied by justice; yet if all men became just, there would be no need for courage.
quotes.author: Agesilaus the Second

quotes.quote: The sword of justice has no scabbard.
quotes.author: Antione De Riveral

quotes.quote: It is in justice that the ordering of society is centered.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Justice does not come from the outside. It comes from inner peace.
quotes.author: Barbara Hall

quotes.quote: In the state of nature, indeed, all men are born equal, but they cannot continue in this equality. Society makes them lose it, and they recover it only by the protection of the laws.
quotes.author: Domitus Ulpian

quotes.quote: Justice is the constant and perpetual will to allot to every man his due.
quotes.author: Earl Warren

quotes.quote: It is the spirit and not the form of law that keeps justice alive.
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.quote: Justice is a contract of expediency, entered upon to prevent men harming or being harmed.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.quote: Military justice is to justice what military music is to music.
quotes.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

quotes.quote: Liberty, equality - bad principles! The only true principle for humanity is justice; and justice to the feeble is protection and kindness.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: Under a government which imprisons unjustly, the true place for a just man is also a prison.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.quote: If it were not for injustice, men would not know justice.
quotes.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quotes.quote: Many that live deserve death. And some die that deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then be not too eager to deal out death in the name of justice, fearing for your own safety. Even the wise cannot see all ends.
quotes.author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quotes.quote: Gossip and reputation make sure that what comes around-a person who is cruel will find that the others are cruel hack to him, and a person who is kind will find others are kind in return. Gossip paired with reciprocity allow karma to work here on earth, not in the next life.
quotes.author: Malcolm X

quotes.quote: The greatest justice in life is that your vision and looks tend to go simultaneously.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.quote: The dead cannot cry out for justice; it is a duty of the living to do so for them.
quotes.author: Pope Pius XI

quotes.quote: Nobody can give you freedom. Nobody can give you equality or justice or anything. If you're a man, you take it.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
quotes.author: William Gladstone

quotes.quote: Justice requires that to lawfully constituted Authority there be given that respect and obedience which is its due; that the laws which are made shall be in wise conformity with the common good; and that, as a matter of conscience all men shall render obedience to these laws.
Justice consists not in being neutral between right and wrong, but in finding out the right and upholding it, wherever found, against the wrong.
Justice delayed, is justice denied.
No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.quote: The ideals which have lighted my way, and time after time have given me new courage to face life cheerfully, have been Kindness, Beauty, and Truth. The trite subjects of human efforts, possessions, outward success, luxury have always seemed to me contemptible.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: There are no thanks for a kindness, which has been delayed.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Compassion is the basis of all morality.
quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.quote: There is no duty more obligatory than the repayment of kindness.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Forget injuries, never forget kindnesses.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: Recompense injury with justice, and recompense kindness with kindness.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: I expect to pass through this world but once; any good thing therefore that I can do, or any kindness that I can show to any fellow creature, let me do it now; let me not defer or neglect it, for I shall not pass this way again.
quotes.author: Ettiene De Grellet

quotes.quote: Guard well within yourself that treasure, kindness. Know how to give without hesitation, how to lose without regret, how to acquire without meanness.
quotes.author: George Sand

quotes.quote: Sometimes when we are generous in small, barely detectable ways it can change someone else's life forever.
quotes.author: Margaret Cho

quotes.quote: I have always depended on the kindness of strangers.
quotes.author: Tennessee Williams

quotes.quote: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
quotes.author: The Dalai Lama

quotes.quote:
Yet do I fear thy nature;
It is too full o' the milk of human kindness.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
That best portion of a good man's life,
His little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and of love.
quotes.author: William Wordsworth

quotes.quote: If we value the pursuit of knowledge, we must be free to follow wherever that search may lead us. The free mind is not a barking dog, to be tethered on a ten-foot chain.
quotes.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.

quotes.quote: If we value the pursuit of knowledge, we must be free to follow wherever that search may lead us. The free mind is no barking dog to be tethered on a ten-foot chain.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: All men by nature desire knowledge.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: To be conscious that you are ignorant is a great step to knowledge.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: If a man empties his purse into his head no one can take it away from him. An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: There is much pleasure to be gained from useless knowledge.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: When you know a thing, to hold that you know it; and when you do not know a thing, to allow that you do not know it - this is knowledge.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.quote: Convinced myself, I seek not to convince.
quotes.author: Enrico Fermi

quotes.quote: It is no good to try to stop knowledge from going forward. Ignorance is never better than knowledge.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.quote: None of us is as smart as all of us.
quotes.author: Frank Herbert

quotes.quote: We have an opportunity for everyone in the world to have access to all the world's information. This has never before been possible. Why is ubiquitous information so profound? It's a tremendous equalizer. Information is power.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: We have come out of the time when obedience, the acceptance of discipline, intelligent courage, and resolution were most important, into that more difficult time when it is a man's duty to understand his world rather than to simply fight for it.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: The beginning of knowledge is the discovery of something we do not understand.
quotes.author: Jonathan Swift

quotes.quote: If knowledge can create problems, it is not through ignorance that we can solve them.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: His priority did not seem to be to teach them what he knew, but rather to impress upon them that nothing, not even... knowledge, was foolproof.
quotes.author: Lao-tzu

quotes.quote: When a true genius appears in this world you may know him by this sign, that the dines are all in confederacy against him.
quotes.author: Margaret Fuller

quotes.quote: Perplexity is the beginning of knowledge.

quotes.quote: People are difficult to govern because they have too much knowledge.

quotes.quote: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles at it.

quotes.quote: To be absolutely certain about something, one must know everything or nothing about it.
quotes.author: Richard Feynman

quotes.quote: Knowledge and timber shouldn't be much used till they are seasoned.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: I was born not knowing and have had only a little time to change that here and there.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: You can know the name of a bird in all the languages of the world, but when you're finished, you'll know absolutely nothing whatever about the bird... So let's look at the bird and see what it's doing -- that's what counts. I learned very early the difference between knowing the name of something and knowing something.
quotes.author: Sir Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Knowledge is of two kinds. We know a subject ourselves, or we know where we can find information on it.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Mankind have a great aversion to intellectual labor; but even supposing knowledge to be easily attainable, more people would be content to be ignorant than would take even a little trouble to acquire it.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Rules are just helpful guidelines for stupid people who can't make up their own minds.
Knowledge is power.
The only good is knowledge and the only evil is ignorance.
There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.
We have too many high sounding words, and too few actions that correspond with them.
quotes.author: Abigail Adams

quotes.quote: He can compress the most words into the smallest ideas of any man I ever met.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Words calculated to catch everyone may catch no one.
quotes.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.

quotes.quote: Words are the physicians of the mind diseased.
quotes.author: Aeschylus

quotes.quote: Language is the source of misunderstandings.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quotes.quote: Let thy speech be short, comprehending much in a few words.
quotes.author: Aprocrypha

quotes.quote: High thoughts must have high language.
quotes.author: Aristophanes

quotes.quote: Grasp the subject, the words will follow.
quotes.author: Cato the Elder

quotes.quote: Use soft words and hard arguments.
quotes.author: English Proverb

quotes.quote: The great enemy of clear language is insincerity. When there is a gap between one's real and one's declared aims, one turns as it were instinctively to long words and exhausted idioms, like a cuttlefish spurting out ink.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.quote: A man thinks that by mouthing hard words he understands hard things.

quotes.quote: For me, words are a form of action, capable of influencing change.
quotes.author: Ingrid Bengis

quotes.quote: When ideas fail, words come in very handy.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Deeds, not words shall speak me.

quotes.quote: Words ought to be a little wild for they are the assaults of thought on the unthinking.
quotes.author: John Maynard Keynes

quotes.quote: The great thing about human language is that it prevents us from sticking to the matter at hand.
quotes.author: Lewis Thomas

quotes.quote: Man invented language to satisfy his deep need to complain.
quotes.author: Lily Tomlin

quotes.quote: We have really everything in common with America nowadays except, of course, language.

quotes.quote: Words have a longer life than deeds.
quotes.author: Pindar

quotes.quote: Language exerts hidden power, like a moon on the tides.
quotes.author: Rita Mae Brown

quotes.quote: Drawing on my fine command of the English language, I said nothing.
quotes.author: Robert Benchley

quotes.quote: No one has a finer command of language than the person who keeps his mouth shut.
quotes.author: Sam Rayburn

quotes.quote: Do not accustom yourself to use big words for little matters.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: Works of imagination should be written in very plain language; the more purely imaginative they are the more necessary it is to be plain.
quotes.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quotes.quote: Broadly speaking, the short words are the best, and the old words best of all.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Think like a wise man but communicate in the language of the people.
quotes.author: William Butler Yeats

quotes.quote: Speak properly, and in as few words as you can, but always plainly; for the end of speech is not ostentation, but to be understood.
quotes.author: William Penn

quotes.quote:
I understand a fury in your words,
But not the words.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
My words fly up, my thoughts remain below:
Words without thoughts never to heaven go.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: They have been at a great feast of languages, and stolen the scraps.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: We cannot really love anybody with whom we never laugh.
quotes.author: Agnes Repplier

quotes.quote: He deserves Paradise who makes his companions laugh.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: We laugh a lot. That's for sure. Sure beats the alternative, doesn't it?
quotes.author: Betty White

quotes.quote: The more you find out about the world, the more opportunities there are to laugh at it.
quotes.author: Bill Nye

quotes.quote: Laughter gives us distance. It allows us to step back from an event, deal with it and then move on.

quotes.quote: Total absence of humor renders life impossible.

quotes.quote: Laughter is by definition healthy.
quotes.author: Doris Lessing

quotes.quote: The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.
quotes.author: e e cummings

quotes.quote: If you don't learn to laugh at trouble, you won't have anything to laugh at when you're old.
quotes.author: Edgar Watson Howe

quotes.quote: Laugh at yourself first, before anyone else can.

quotes.quote: You cannot be mad at somebody who makes you laugh - it's as simple as that.
quotes.author: Jay Leno

quotes.quote: If we couldn't laugh, we would all go insane.
quotes.author: Jimmy Buffett

quotes.quote: In this life he laughs longest who laughs last.
quotes.author: John Masefield

quotes.quote: Man is distinguished from all other creatures by the faculty of laughter.
quotes.author: Joseph Addison

quotes.quote: One doesn't have a sense of humor. It has you.
quotes.author: Larry Gelbart

quotes.quote: Always laugh when you can. It is cheap medicine.
quotes.author: Lord Byron

quotes.quote: The human race has one really effective weapon, and that is laughter.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: He who laughs, lasts!
quotes.author: Mary Pettibone Poole

quotes.quote: You don't stop laughing because you grow old. You grow old because you stop laughing.
quotes.author: Michael Pritchard

quotes.quote: Laughter is inner jogging.
quotes.author: Norman Cousins

quotes.quote: I was irrevocably betrothed to laughter, the sound of which has always seemed to me to be the most civilized music in the world.
quotes.author: Peter Ustinov

quotes.quote: You can't deny laughter; when it comes, it plops down in your favorite chair and stays as long as it wants.

quotes.quote: Beware of too much laughter, for it deadens the mind and produces oblivion.

quotes.quote: Laughter is the closest distance between two people.

quotes.quote: Among those whom I like or admire, I can find no common denominator, but among those whom I love, I can: all of them make me laugh.

quotes.quote: Let me not be understood as saying that there are no bad laws, nor that grievances may not arise for the redress of which no legal provisions have been made. quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Laws alone can not secure freedom of expression; in order that every man present his views without penalty there must be spirit of tolerance in the entire population.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Good laws have their origins in bad morals.

quotes.quote: The law, in its majestic equality, forbids the rich as well as the poor to sleep under bridges, to beg in the streets, and to steal bread.

quotes.quote: Where you find the laws most numerous, there you will find also the greatest injustice.
quotes.author: Arcesilaus

quotes.quote: Law is order in liberty, and without order liberty is social chaos.

quotes.quote: Even when laws have been written down, they ought not always to remain unaltered.

quotes.quote: I have gained this by philosophy: that I do without being commanded what others do only from fear of the law.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Law is mind without reason.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Law is order, and good law is good order.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: When men are pure, laws are useless; when men are corrupt, laws are broken.
