quotes.quote: A law is something which must have a moral basis, so that there is an inner compelling force for every citizen to obey.
quotes.author: Chaim Weizmann

quotes.quote: In the state of nature...all men are born equal, but they cannot continue in this equality. Society makes them lose it, and they recover it only by the protection of the law.
quotes.author: Charles de Montesquieu

quotes.quote: Law stands mute in the midst of arms.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: The people's good is the highest law.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: The strictest law often causes the most serious wrong.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote:
The welfare of the people is the ultimate law.
(Salus Populi Suprema Est Lex)
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: It is found by experience that admirable laws and right precedents among the good have their origin in the misdeeds of others.
quotes.author: Cornelius Tacitus

quotes.quote: It is the spirit and not the form of law that keeps justice alive.
quotes.author: Earl Warren

quotes.quote: Fragile as reason is and limited as law is as the institutionalised medium of reason, that's all we have between us and the tyranny of mere will and the cruelty of unbridled, undisciplined feelings.
quotes.author: Felix Frankfurter

quotes.quote: The United States is a nation of laws: badly written and randomly enforced.
quotes.author: Frank Zappa

quotes.quote: What power has law where only money rules.

quotes.quote: The problem with any unwritten law is that you don't know where to go to erase it.
quotes.author: Glaser and Way

quotes.quote: A judge is a law student who marks his own examination papers.

quotes.quote: The trouble with fighting for human freedom is that one spends most of one's time defending scoundrels. For it is against scoundrels that oppressive laws are first aimed, and oppression must be stopped at the beginning if it is to be stopped at all.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: It was the boast of Augustus that he found Rome of brick and left it of marble. But how much nobler will be the sovereign's boast when he shall have it to say that he found law... a sealed book and left it a living letter; found it the patrimony of the rich and left it the inheritance of the poor; found it the two-edged sword of craft and oppression and left it the staff of honesty and the shield of innocence.
quotes.author: Henry Brougham

quotes.quote: The law is not so much carved in stone as it is written in water, flowing in and out with the tide.

quotes.quote: Ignorance of the law excuses no man: Not that all men know the law, but because 'tis an excuse every man will plead, and no man can tell how to refute him.
quotes.author: John Selden

quotes.quote:
The more laws and order are made prominent,
The more thieves and robbers there will be.
quotes.author: Lao-tzu

quotes.quote: I submit that an individual who breaks a law that conscience tells him is unjust, and who willingly accepts the penalty of imprisonment in order to arouse the conscience of the community over its injustice, is in reality expressing the highest respect for the law.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.quote: I don't think necessity is the mother of invention - invention, in my opinion, arises directly from idleness, possibly also from laziness. To save oneself trouble.
quotes.author: Agatha Christie

quotes.quote: Ambition is a poor excuse for not having sense enough to be lazy.
quotes.author: Edgar Bergen

quotes.quote: Idleness is not doing nothing. Idleness is being free to do anything.
quotes.author: Floyd Dell

quotes.quote: Idleness and lack of occupation tend - nay are dragged - towards evil.
quotes.author: Hippocrates

quotes.quote: Failure is not the only punishment for laziness; there is also the success of others.
quotes.author: Jules Renard

quotes.quote: Laziness is nothing more than the habit of resting before you get tired.
quotes.author: Jules Renard

quotes.quote: Indolence is a delightful but distressing state; we must be doing something to be happy.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: There is no pleasure in having nothing to do; the fun is in having lots to do and not doing it.
quotes.author: Mary Wilson Little

quotes.quote: That indolent but agreeable condition of doing nothing.

quotes.quote: Far from idleness being the root of all evil, it is rather the only true good.
quotes.author: Soren Kierkegaard

quotes.quote: Never be entirely idle; but either be reading, or writing, or praying or meditating or endeavoring something for the public good.
quotes.author: Thomas a Kempis

quotes.quote: He that is busy is tempted by but one devil; he that is idle, by a legion.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.quote: Determine never to be idle...It is wonderful how much may be done if we are always doing.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: What luck for rulers that men do not think.
quotes.author: Adolf Hitler

quotes.quote: The first duty of a leader is to make himself be loved without courting love. To be loved without 'playing up' to anyone - even to himself.
quotes.author: Andre Malraux

quotes.quote: The key to being a good manager is keeping the people who hate me away from those who are still undecided.
quotes.author: Casey Stengel

quotes.quote: Self-regulation will always be a challenge, but if somebody's going to be in charge, it might as well be me.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: A sense of humor is part of the art of leadership, of getting along with people, of getting things done.
quotes.author: Evenius

quotes.quote: The crowd gives the leader new strength.
quotes.author: George Goethals

quotes.quote: Faith in the ability of a leader is of slight service unless it be united with faith in his justice.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: Leadership and learning are indispensable to each other.
quotes.author: Lee Iacocca

quotes.quote: We will make them think it's their idea. That's how all great leaders fool people.
quotes.author: Peter Drucker

quotes.quote: Management is nothing more than motivating other people.
So much of what we call management consists in making it difficult for people to work.
Learning is not attained by chance, it must be sought for with ardor and attended to with diligence.
quotes.author: Abigail Adams

quotes.quote: Learning without thought is labor lost; thought without learning is perilous.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: That is what learning is. You suddenly understand something you've understood all your life, but in a new way.
quotes.author: Doris Lessing

quotes.quote: Only the curious will learn and only the resolute overcome the obstacles to learning. The quest quotient has always excited me more than the intelligence quotient.
quotes.author: Eugene S. Wilson

quotes.quote:
Whoso neglects learning in his youth,
Loses the past and is dead for the future.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: Whoever ceases to be a student has never been a student.
quotes.author: George Iles

quotes.quote: The wisest mind has something yet to learn.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.quote: Much learning does not teach understanding.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.quote: Never seem more learned than the people you are with. Wear your learning like a pocket watch and keep it hidden. Do not pull it out to count the hours, but give the time when you are asked.
quotes.author: Lord Chesterfield

quotes.quote: We learn by example and by direct experience because there are real limits to the adequacy of verbal instruction.
quotes.author: Malcolm Gladwell

quotes.quote: What is important is to keep learning, to enjoy challenge, and to tolerate ambiguity. In the end there are no certain answers.
quotes.author: Martina Horner

quotes.quote: Whenever you are asked if you can do a job, tell 'em, 'Certainly I can!' Then get busy and find out how to do it.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Learning is not compulsory... neither is survival.
quotes.author: W. Edwards Deming

quotes.quote: You learn more quickly under the guidance of experienced teachers. You waste a lot of time going down blind alleys if you have no one to lead you.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: Abraham Lincoln and Millard Fillmore had the same title. They were both presidents of the United States, but their tenure in office and their legacy could not be more different.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.quote: Let us develop the resources of our land, call forth our powers, build up its institutions, promote all its great interests, and see whether we also, in our day and generation, may not perform something worthy to be remembered.
quotes.author: Daniel Webster

quotes.quote: When you have told anyone you have left him a legacy the only decent thing to do is to die at once.
quotes.author: Samuel Butler

quotes.quote: No legacy is so rich as honesty.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Liberals are very broadminded: they are always willing to give careful consideration to both sides of the same side.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: I am a Conservative to preserve all that is good in our constitution, a Radical to remove all that is bad. I seek to preserve property and to respect order, and I equally decry the appeal to the passions of the many or the prejudices of the few.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: The most radical revolutionary will become a conservative the day after the revolution.
quotes.author: Hannah Arendt

quotes.quote: The radical of one century is the conservative of the next. The radical invents the views. When he has worn them out the conservative adopts them.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: When you are right you cannot be too radical; when you are wrong, you cannot be too conservative.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.quote: It only takes 20 years for a liberal to become a conservative without changing a single idea.
quotes.author: Robert Anton Wilson

quotes.quote: A liberal is a man too broadminded to take his own side in a quarrel.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.quote:
I never dared to be radical when young
For fear it would make me conservative when old.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.quote: A liberal is a person whose interests aren't at stake at the moment.
quotes.author: Willis Player

quotes.quote: Liars when they speak the truth are not believed.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Sometimes the lies you tell are less frightening than the loneliness you might feel if you stopped telling them.
quotes.author: Clare Booth Luce

quotes.quote: Lying increases the creative faculties, expands the ego, and lessens the frictions of social contacts.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Repetition does not transform a lie into a truth.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: The visionary lies to himself, the liar only to others.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: All men are frauds. The only difference between them is that some admit it. I myself deny it.
quotes.author: Jerome K. Jerome

quotes.quote: It is always the best policy to speak the truth--unless, of course, you are an exceptionally good liar.
quotes.author: Lenin

quotes.quote: A lie told often enough becomes the truth.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: A lie can travel halfway around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: The history of our race, and each individual's experience, are sown thick with evidence that a truth is not hard to kill and that a lie told well is immortal.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: Lies are like children: they're hard work, but it's worth it because the future depends on them.
quotes.author: Quintilian

quotes.quote: False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: A liar should have a good memory.
quotes.author: Sallust

quotes.quote: Truth is beautiful, without doubt; but so are lies.
quotes.author: Samuel Butler

quotes.quote: Ambition drove many men to become false; to have one thought locked in the breast, another ready on the tongue.
quotes.author: Samuel Butler

quotes.quote: Any fool can tell the truth, but it requires a man of some sense to know how to lie well.
quotes.author: Sir Walter Scott

quotes.quote: The best liar is he who makes the smallest amount of lying go the longest way.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.quote:
Oh what a tangled web we weave,
When first we practise to deceive!

Truly, to tell lies is not honorable;
but when the truth entails tremendous ruin,
To speak dishonorably is pardonable.
Life isn't simple. But the beauty of it is, you can always start over. It'll get easier.
quotes.author: Barbara Hall

quotes.quote: Life is indeed difficult, partly because of the real difficulties we must overcome in order to survive, and partly because of our own innate desire to always do better, to overcome new challenges, to self-actualize. Happiness is experienced largely in striving towards a goal, not in having attained things, because our nature is always to want to go on to the next endeavor.
quotes.author: Ben Stein

quotes.quote: You're alive. Do something. The directive in life, the moral imperative was so uncomplicated. It could be expressed in single words, not complete sentences. It sounded like this: Look. Listen. Choose. Act.
quotes.author: Boris Pasternak

quotes.quote: The first step to getting the things you want out of life is this: Decide what you want.
quotes.author: Brendan Gill

quotes.quote: Man is born to live, not to prepare for life.
quotes.author: Christopher Morley

quotes.quote: Not a shred of evidence exists in favor of the idea that life is serious.
quotes.author: Condoleeza Rice

quotes.quote: Life is a foreign language; all men mispronounce it.
quotes.author: Diane Ackerman

quotes.quote: Life is full of surprises and and serendipity. Being open to unexpected turns in the road is an important part of success. If you try to plan every step, you may miss those wonderful twists and turns. Just find your next adventure-do it well, enjoy it-and then, not now, think about what comes next.
quotes.author: Dick Werthimer

quotes.quote: In matters of self-control as we shall see again and again, speed kills. But a little friction really can save lives.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.quote: When we exercise self-control on a given occasion, we win for ourselves a little credibility we can rely on the next time around. Pretty soon we develop a reputation to ourselves that we want badly to uphold. With each test that we meet, our resolve gains momentum, fueled by the fear that we may succumb and establish a damaging precedent for our own weakness.
quotes.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quotes.quote: Life is a thing that mutates without warning, not always in enviable ways. All part of the improbable adventure of being alive, of being a brainy biped with giant dreams on a crazy blue planet.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: The purpose of life is to fight maturity.
quotes.author: Ellen DeGeneres

quotes.quote:
Oh, life is a glorious cycle of song,
A medley of extemporanea;
And love is a thing that can never go wrong;
And I am Marie of Romania.
quotes.author: Fran Lebowitz

quotes.quote: It's not true that life is one damn thing after another; it is one damn thing over and over.
quotes.author: Henry J. Tillman

quotes.quote: Life is just one damned thing after another.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: Life is like one big Mardi Gras. But instead of showing your boobs, show people your brain, and if they like what they'll, you'll have more beads than you know what to do with.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: Life is something that happens when you can't get to sleep.
quotes.author: James M. Barrie

quotes.quote: Life is something that everyone should try at least once.
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.quote: Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It's the transition that's troublesome.
quotes.author: Norman Thomas

quotes.quote: Life is difficult and complicated and beyond anyone's total control, and the humility to know that will enable you to survive its vicissitudes.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.quote: Life is a long lesson in humility.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.

In real life, however, you don't react to what someone did; you react only to what you think she did, and the gap between action and perception is bridged by the art of impression management. If life itself is but what you deem it, then why not focus your efforts on persuading others to believe that you are a virtuous and trustworthy cooperator?
The lessons this life has planted in my heart pertain more to caring than crops, more to Golden Rule than gold, more to the proper choice than to the popular choice.
Nature has invented reproduction as a mechanism for life to move forward. As a life force that passes right through us and makes us a link in the evolution of life.
Life is fickle; the fair man doesn't invariably win.
The secret of a good life is to have the right loyalties and hold them in the right scale of values.
Life is a fatal complaint, and an eminently contagious one.
Difficulties come when you don't pay attention to life's whisper. Life always whispers to you first, but if you ignore the whisper, sooner or later you'll get a scream.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: In the right light, at the right time, everything is extraordinary.
quotes.author: Aaron Rose

quotes.quote: You can't have a light without a dark to stick it in.
quotes.author: Arlo Guthrie

quotes.quote: In the beginning there was nothing. God said, 'Let there be light!' And there was light. There was still nothing, but you could see it a whole lot better.
quotes.author: Ellen DeGeneres

quotes.quote: There are two kinds of light--the glow that illuminates, and the glare that obscures.
quotes.author: James Thurber

quotes.quote: What I give form to in daylight is only one per cent of what I have seen in darkness.
quotes.author: M. C. Escher

quotes.quote: Let your light shine. Shine within you so that it can shine on someone else. Let your light shine.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: Any one who has common sense will remember that the bewilderments of the eyes are of two kinds, and arise from two causes, either from coming out of the light or from going into the light, which is true of the mind's eye, quite as much as of the bodily eye; and he who remembers this when he sees any one whose vision is perplexed and weak, will not be too ready to laugh; he will first ask whether that soul of man has come out of the brighter light, and is unable to see because unaccustomed to the dark, or having turned from darkness to the day is dazzled by excess of light.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: We burn daylight.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: There are people who, instead of listening to what is being said to them, are already listening to what they are going to say themselves.
quotes.author: Albert Guinon

quotes.quote: No man ever listened himself out of a job.
quotes.author: Calvin Coolidge

quotes.quote: Make sure you have finished speaking before your audience has finished listening.
quotes.author: Dorothy Sarnoff

quotes.quote: When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.quote: To listen closely and reply well is the highest perfection we are able to attain in the art of conversation.
quotes.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: Be a good listener. Your ears will never get you in trouble.
quotes.author: Frank Tyger

quotes.quote: Listen. Do not have an opinion while you listen because frankly, your opinion doesn't hold much water outside of Your Universe. Just listen. Listen until their brain has been twisted like a dripping towel and what they have to say is all over the floor.
quotes.author: Hugh Elliott

quotes.quote: A good listener is a good talker with a sore throat.
quotes.author: Katharine Whitehorn

quotes.quote: A good listener is usually thinking about something else.
quotes.author: Kin Hubbard

quotes.quote: Maybe I wanted to hear it so badly that my ears betrayed my mind in order to secure my heart.
quotes.author: Margaret Cho

quotes.quote: No one really listens to anyone else, and if you try it for a while you'll see why.
quotes.author: Mignon McLaughlin

quotes.quote: Everybody lies, but it doesn't matter because nobody listens.
quotes.author: Nick Diamos

quotes.quote: It is the province of knowledge to speak and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.quote: Know how to listen, and you will profit even from those who talk badly.
quotes.author: Plutarch

quotes.quote: As I get older, I've learned to listen to people rather than accuse them of things.
quotes.author: Po Bronson

quotes.quote: My parents taught me how to listen to everybody before I made up my own mind. When you listen, you learn. You absorb like a sponge-and your life becomes so much better than when you are just trying to be listened to all the time.
quotes.author: Wilson Mizner

quotes.quote: A good listener is not only popular everywhere, but after a while he gets to know something.
Pray that your loneliness may spur you into finding something to live for, great enough to die for.
quotes.author: Dag Hammarskjold

quotes.quote: When you close your doors, and make darkness within, remember never to say that you are alone, for you are not alone; nay, God is within, and your genius is within. And what need have they of light to see what you are doing?
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: To be an adult is to be alone.
quotes.author: Jean Rostand

quotes.quote: People drain me, even the closest of friends, and I find loneliness to be the best state in the union to live in.
quotes.author: Margaret Cho

quotes.quote: The worst loneliness is not to be comfortable with yourself.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Inside myself is a place where I live all alone and that's where you renew your springs that never dry up.
quotes.author: Pearl Buck

quotes.quote: They are never alone that are accompanied with noble thoughts.
quotes.author: Sir Philip Sidney

quotes.quote: To be alone is to be different, to be different is to be alone.
quotes.author: Suzanne Gordon

quotes.quote: No matter how lonely you get or how many birth announcements you receive, the trick is not to get frightened. There's nothing wrong with being alone.
quotes.author: Wendy Wasserstein

quotes.quote: Never pretend to a love which you do not actually feel, for love is not ours to command.
quotes.author: Alan Watts

quotes.quote: Such is the inconsistency of real love, that it is always awake to suspicion, however unreasonable; always requiring new assurances from the object of its interest.
quotes.author: Ann Radcliffe

quotes.quote: To love deeply in one direction makes us more loving in all others.
quotes.author: Anne-Sophie Swetchine

quotes.quote: Perhaps the feelings that we experience when we are in love represent a normal state. Being in love shows a person who he should be.
quotes.author: Anton Chekhov

quotes.quote: To fear love is to fear life, and those who fear life are already three parts dead.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Love is not enough. It must be the foundation, the cornerstone - but not the complete structure. It is much too pliable, too yielding.
quotes.author: Bette Davis

quotes.quote: Clarity of mind means clarity of passion, too; this is why a great and clear mind loves ardently and sees distinctly what it loves.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.quote: The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.quote: Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.
quotes.author: Charles M. Schulz

quotes.quote: There's an evolutionary imperative why we give a crap about our family and friends. And there's an evolutionary imperative why we don't give a crap about anybody else. If we loved all people indiscriminately, we couldn't function.
quotes.author: David Viscott

quotes.quote: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
quotes.author: Diane Ackerman

quotes.quote: Couples are jigsaw puzzles that hang together by touching in just enough points. They're never total fits or misfits.
quotes.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider

quotes.quote: There's a lot to be said for self-delusionment when it comes to matters of the heart.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.quote:
Oh, life is a glorious cycle of song,
A medley of extemporanea;
And love is a thing that can never go wrong;
And I am Marie of Romania.
quotes.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quotes.quote: One's first love is always perfect until one meets one's second love.
quotes.author: Erica Jong

quotes.quote: All love that has not friendship for its base, is like a mansion built upon sand.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: Love is everything it's cracked up to be�It really is worth fighting for, being brave for, risking everything for.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: People are such great mysteries. Just when we think we have understood them, a wonderful new aspect shows in them.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: When love is in excess it brings a man no honor nor worthiness.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.
quotes.author: Henry Bromel

quotes.quote: What else is love but understanding and rejoicing in the fact that another person lives, acts, and experiences otherwise than we do�?
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: They wouldn't call it falling in love if you didn't get hurt sometimes, but you just pick yourself up and move on.
quotes.author: Hugh Elliott

quotes.quote: Love is the triumph of imagination over intelligence.
quotes.author: Ice T

quotes.quote: Sometimes when you look back on a situation, you realize it wasn't all you thought it was. A beautiful girl walked into your life. You fell in love. Or did you? Maybe it was only a childish infatuation, or maybe just a brief moment of vanity.
quotes.author: Iris Murdoch

quotes.quote: There is no remedy for love but to love more.
quotes.author: Iris Murdoch

quotes.quote: Just because you love someone doesn't mean you have to be involved with them. Love is not a bandage to cover wounds.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: Passion makes the world go round. Love just makes it a safer place.
Love is the difficult realization that something other than oneself is real.
We can only learn to love by loving.
When you have seen as much of life as I have, you will not underestimate the power of obsessive love.
People always call it luck when you've acted more sensibly than they have.
quotes.author: Anne Tyler

quotes.quote: The only thing that overcomes hard luck is hard work.
quotes.author: Harry Golden

quotes.quote: A pound of pluck is worth a ton of luck.
quotes.author: James A. Garfield

quotes.quote: We must believe in luck. For how else can we explain the success of those we don't like?
quotes.author: Jean Cocteau

quotes.quote: True luck consists not in holding the best of the cards at the table; luckiest is he who knows just when to rise and go home.
quotes.author: John Hay

quotes.quote: Luck is what you have left over after you give 100 percent.
quotes.author: Langston Coleman

quotes.quote: Shallow men believe in luck. Strong men believe in cause and effect.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: I'm a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work the more I have of it.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Every man has three characters-that which he exhibits, that which he has, and that which he thinks he has.
quotes.author: Andre Gide

quotes.quote: So long as we live among men, let us cherish humanity.
quotes.author: Andrew Jackson

quotes.quote: One man with courage makes a majority.
quotes.author: Andy and Larry Wachowski

quotes.quote: To deny our own impulses is to deny the very thing that makes us human.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: It has been said that man is a rational animal. All my life I have been searching for evidence which could support this.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.quote: I have discovered that all human evil comes from this, man's being unable to sit still in a room.
quotes.author: Homer

quotes.quote: What mattered was not what happens to you, but how you handle it. Self-command is required to overcome the dangerous misinformation of our emotions, and because for the most part the self is the only thing that we can command. We have no control, ultimately, over what people do or think. What we can influence is our understanding of these circumstances and how we respond to them.
quotes.author: Joseph Baretti

quotes.quote: The fates have given mankind a patient soul.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: I hate mankind, for I think myself one of the best of them, and I know how bad I am.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: It was enough to make a body ashamed of the human race.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Man is the Only Animal that Blushes. Or needs to.
quotes.author: Samuel Butler

quotes.quote: A curious part of the human psyche is that the moment that a person presumed to be in danger is discovered to be safe, everyone's anxiety turns into anger.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: I think that God in creating Man somewhat overestimated his ability.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.quote: Man is the only animal that laughs and has a state legislature.
quotes.author: Woodrow Wilson

quotes.quote: As I know more of mankind I expect less of them, and am ready now to call a man a good man upon easier terms than I was formerly.
The world is my country, all mankind are my brethren, and to do good is my religion.
People are not an interruption of our business. People are our business.
In the last analysis, my fellow country men, as we in America would be the first to claim, a people are responsible for the acts of their government.
The conception of two people living together for twenty-five years without having a cross word suggests a lack of spirit only to be admired in sheep.
quotes.author: Alan Patrick Herbert

quotes.quote: A successful marriage is an edifice that must be rebuilt every day.
quotes.author: Andre Maurois

quotes.quote: All married couples should learn the art of battle as they should learn the art of making love. Good battle is objective and honest - never vicious or cruel. Good battle is healthy and constructive, and brings to a marriage the principle of equal partnership.
quotes.author: Ann Landers

quotes.quote: A simple enough pleasure, surely, to have breakfast alone with one's husband, but how seldom married people in the midst of life achieve it.
quotes.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quotes.quote: I used to believe that marriage would diminish me, reduce my options. That you had to be someone less to live with someone else when, of course, you have to be someone more.
quotes.author: Candice Bergen

quotes.quote: All marriages are mixed marriages.
quotes.author: Chantal Saperstein

quotes.quote: There's only one way to have a happy marriage and as soon as I learn what it is I'll get married again.
quotes.author: Clint Eastwood

quotes.quote: A great marriage is not when the 'perfect couple' comes together. It is when an imperfect couple learns to enjoy their differences.
quotes.author: Dave Meurer

quotes.quote: Though we marry as adults, we don't marry adults. We marry children who have grown up and still rejoice in being children, especially if we're creative.
quotes.author: Diane Ackerman

quotes.quote: Marriage. It's like a cultural hand-rail. It links folks to the past and guides them to the future.
quotes.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider

quotes.quote: I wonder, among all the tangles of this mortal coil, which one contains tighter knots to undo, and consequently suggests more tugging, and pain, and diversified elements of misery, than the marriage tie.
quotes.author: Edith Wharton

quotes.quote: What is right for one couple is wrong for another. I would say that there are many more important factors to a happy marriage.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: When a man is ready to marry, he is often not too particular about the lady.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: Man's best possession is a sympathetic wife.
quotes.author: Helen Rowland

quotes.quote: Never say that marriage has more of joy than pain.
quotes.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quotes.quote: One man's folly is another man's wife.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: Nearly all marriages, even happy ones, are mistakes: in the sense that almost certainly (in a more perfect world, or even with a little more care in this very imperfect one) both partners might be found more suitable mates. But the real soul-mate is the one you are actually married to.
quotes.author: John Scalzi

quotes.quote: I pay very little regard...to what any young person says on the subject of marriage. If they profess a disinclination for it, I only set it down that they have not yet seen the right person.
quotes.author: Kathleen Norris

quotes.quote: My marriage had its ups and downs like anyone's, but when it came down to it, I knew it was solid. I miss that sort of security, and that sort of connection with someone.
quotes.author: Lawana Blackwell

quotes.quote: Intimacy is what makes a marriage, not a ceremony, not a piece of paper from the state.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.quote: If there was strife and contention in the home, very little else in life could compensate for it.
quotes.author: Mickey Rooney

quotes.quote: Marriage is a great institution, but I'm not ready for an institution yet.
quotes.author: Mignon McLaughlin

quotes.quote: Don't waste too much time trying' to be a better man, ' cause you ain't never gonna be one without a good woman.
quotes.author: Muhammad Ali

quotes.quote: Always get married early in the morning. That way, if it doesn't work out, you haven't wasted a whole day.
quotes.author: Nick Faldo

quotes.quote: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person.
quotes.author: Ovid

quotes.quote: My toughest fight was with my first wife.
quotes.author: Paul Tournier

quotes.quote: We were happily married for eight months. Unfortunately, we were married for four and a half years.
quotes.author: Pearl Buck

quotes.quote: If you would marry suitably, marry your equal.
That is what marriage really means: helping one another to reach the full status of being persons, responsible and autonomous beings who do not run away from life.
A good marriage is one which allows for change and growth in the individuals and in the way they express their love.
As far as the laws of mathematics refer to reality, they are not certain; and as far as they are certain, they do not refer to reality.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Do not worry about your difficulties in Mathematics. I can assure you mine are still greater.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Mathematics may be defined as the subject in which we never know what we are talking about, nor whether what we are saying is true.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Mathematics, rightly viewed, possesses not only truth, but supreme beauty - a beauty cold and austere, like that of sculpture.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Mathematics is the queen of the sciences.
quotes.author: Carl Friedrich Gauss

quotes.quote: I went off to college planning to major in math or philosophy-- of course, both those ideas are really the same idea.
quotes.author: Frank Wilczek

quotes.quote: In mathematics you don't understand things. You just get used to them.
quotes.author: Johann von Neumann

quotes.quote: I have hardly ever known a mathematician who was capable of reasoning.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: Proof is the idol before whom the pure mathematician tortures himself.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Eddington

quotes.quote: The mathematics is not there till we put it there.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Eddington

quotes.quote: We used to think that if we knew one, we knew two, because one and one are two. We are finding that we must learn a great deal more about 'and'.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Eddington

quotes.quote: If scientific reasoning were limited to the logical processes of arithmetic, we should not get very far in our understanding of the physical world. One might as well attempt to grasp the game of poker entirely by the use of the mathematics of probability.
quotes.author: Vannevar Bush

quotes.quote: What I look forward to is continued immaturity followed by death.
quotes.author: Dave Barry

quotes.quote: The purpose of life is to fight maturity.
quotes.author: Dick Werthimer

quotes.quote: There's no point in being grown up if you can't be childish sometimes.
quotes.author: Doctor Who

quotes.quote: By the time I'd grown up, I naturally supposed that I'd be grown up.
quotes.author: Eve Babitz

quotes.quote: To be mature means to face, and not evade, every fresh crisis that comes.
quotes.author: Fritz Kunkel

quotes.quote: Every human being on this earth is born with a tragedy, and it isn't original sin. He's born with the tragedy that he has to grow up. That he has to leave the nest, the security, and go out to do battle. He has to lose everything that is lovely and fight for a new loveliness of his own making, and it's a tragedy. A lot of people don't have the courage to do it.
quotes.author: Helen Hayes

quotes.quote: Maturity is only a short break in adolescence.
quotes.author: Jules Feiffer

quotes.quote: My Father taught me how to be a man � and not by instilling in me a sense of machismo or an agenda of dominance. He taught me that a real man doesn�t take, he gives; he doesn�t use force, he uses logic; doesn�t play the role of trouble-maker, but rather, trouble-shooter; and most importantly, a real man is defined by what�s in his heart, not his pants.
quotes.author: Kevin Smith

quotes.quote: Age is no guarantee of maturity.
quotes.author: Lawana Blackwell

quotes.quote: Adulthood isn't an award they'll give you for being a good child. You can waste... years, trying to get someone to give that respect to you, as though it were a sort of promotion or raise in pay. If only you do enough, if only you are good enough. No. You have to just... take it. Give it to yourself, I suppose. Say, I'm sorry you feel like that and walk away. But that's hard.
quotes.author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quotes.quote: When we were children, we used to think that when we were grown-up we would no longer be vulnerable. But to grow up is to accept vulnerability... To be alive is to be vulnerable.
quotes.author: Madeleine L'Engle

quotes.quote: One has a greater sense of intellectual degradation after an interview with a doctor than from any human experience.
quotes.author: Alice James

quotes.quote: Let's not kid ourselves. Whatever we diagnose, most patients, if they don't die, get well by themselves. Our job is mainly to try to make them feel better; do no harm.
quotes.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider

quotes.quote: Half of the modern drugs could well be thrown out of the window, except that the birds might eat them.
quotes.author: Dr. Martin Henry Fischer

quotes.quote: Don't live in a town where there are no doctors.
quotes.author: Jewish Proverb

quotes.quote: [Medicine is] a collection of uncertain prescriptions the results of which, taken collectively, are more fatal than useful to mankind.
quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.quote: Orthodox medicine has not found an answer to your complaint. However, luckily for you, I happen to be a quack.
quotes.author: Richter cartoon caption

quotes.quote: One of the first duties of the physician is to educate the masses not to take medicine.
quotes.author: Sir William Osler

quotes.quote: The desire to take medicine is perhaps the greatest feature which distinguishes man from animals.
quotes.author: Sir William Osler

quotes.quote: Formerly, when religion was strong and science weak, men mistook magic for medicine; now, when science is strong and religion weak, men mistake medicine for magic.

quotes.quote: The art of medicine consists in amusing the patient while nature cures the disease.

quotes.quote: [Memory is] a man's real possession...In nothing else is he rich, in nothing else is he poor.
quotes.author: Alexander Smith

quotes.quote: Own only what you can carry with you; know language, know countries, know people. Let your memory be your travel bag.
quotes.author: Alexander Solzhenitsyn

quotes.quote: Memory feeds imagination.
quotes.author: Amy Tan

quotes.quote: The memory should be specially taxed in youth, since it is then that it is strongest and most tenacious. But in choosing the things that should be committed to memory the utmost care and forethought must be exercised; as lessons well learnt in youth are never forgotten.

quotes.quote: Creditors have better memories than debtors.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: The palest ink is better than the best memory.

quotes.quote: We can remember minutely and precisely only the things which never really happened to us.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: Why is it that our memory is good enough to retain the least triviality that happens to us, and yet not good enough to recollect how often we have told it to the same person?

quotes.quote: One must have a good memory to be able to keep the promises one makes.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: There is not any memory with less satisfaction than the memory of some temptation we resisted.
quotes.author: James Branch Cabell

quotes.quote: If any one faculty of our nature may be called more wonderful than the rest, I do think it is memory. There seems something more speakingly incomprehensible in the powers, the failures, the inequalities of memory, than in any other of our intelligences. The memory is sometimes so retentive, so serviceable, so obedient; at others, so bewildered and so weak; and at others again, so tyrannic, so beyond control! We are, to be sure, a miracle every way; but our powers of recollecting and of forgetting do seem peculiarly past finding out.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: Nothing is so admirable in politics as a short memory.
quotes.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quotes.quote: It's a poor sort of memory that only works backward.
quotes.author: Lewis Carroll

quotes.quote: When I was younger, I could remember anything, whether it had happened or not.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: He who is not very strong in memory should not meddle with lying.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.quote: Nothing fixes a thing so intensely in the memory as the wish to forget it.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.quote: It was one of those perfect English autumnal days which occur more frequently in memory than in life.
quotes.author: P. D. James

quotes.quote: You can fall ill with just a memory.
quotes.author: Rachel Carson

quotes.quote: For the sense of smell, almost more than any other, has the power to recall memories and it is a pity that you use it so little.
quotes.author: Tryon Edwards

quotes.quote: Memories can be sad, but sometimes they can also save you.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: The secret of a good memory is attention, and attention to a subject depends upon our interest in it. We rarely forget that which has made a deep impression on our minds.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: I would forget it fain; But, O, it presses to my memory, like damned guilty deeds to a sinners mind.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Though yet of Hamlet our dear brother's death the memory be green.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
When to the sessions of sweet silent thought
I summon up remembrance of things past,
I sigh the lack of many things I sought,
And with old woes new wail my dear time's waste.

When wasteful war shall statues overturn,
And broils root out the work of masonry,
Nor Mars his sword nor wars quick fire shall burn
The living record of your memory.

quotes.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider

quotes.quote: I'm just a person trapped inside a woman's body.
quotes.author: Elayne Boosler

quotes.quote: How close the sexes sometimes come to one another. It is as much a matter of behaviour and the spere in which they move that separates the masculine part of humanity from the feminine.

quotes.quote: Women upset everything. When you let them into your life, you find that the woman is driving at one thing and you're driving at another.

quotes.quote: Misogynist: A man who hates women as much as women hate one another.
quotes.author: James Thurber

quotes.quote: I hate women because they always know where things are.
quotes.author: Jilly Cooper

quotes.quote: The male is a domestic animal which, if treated with firmness, can be trained to do most things.
quotes.author: Joseph L. Mankiewicz

quotes.quote: Funny business, a woman's career: the things you drop on the way up the ladder so you can move faster. You forget you'll need them again when you get back to being a woman. It's one career all females have in common, whether we like it or not: being a woman. Sooner or later, we've got to work at it, no matter how many other careers we've had or wanted.
quotes.author: Lawana Blackwell

quotes.quote: For all their strength, men were sometimes like little children.
quotes.author: Margaret Fuller

quotes.quote: Male and female represent the two sides of the great radical dualism. But in fact they are perpetually passing into one another. Fluid hardens to solid, solid rushes to fluid. There is no wholly masculine man, no purely feminine woman.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.quote: When I think of talking, it is of course with a woman. For talking at its best being an inspiration, it wants a corresponding divine quality of receptiveness, and where will you find this but in a woman?
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: If women are expected to do the same work as men, we must teach them the same things.
quotes.author: Plutarch

quotes.quote: When the candles are out all women are fair.
quotes.author: Robin Morgan

quotes.quote: Don't accept rides from strange men, and remember that all men are strange.
quotes.author: Scott Adams

quotes.quote: Men live in a fantasy world. I know this because I am one, and I actually receive my mail there.
quotes.author: Susan Sontag

quotes.quote: What is most beautiful in virile men is something feminine; what is most beautiful in feminine women is something masculine.
quotes.author: Timothy Leary

quotes.quote: Women who seek to be equal with men lack ambition.
quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

quotes.quote: For most of history, Anonymous was a woman.
quotes.author: William Congreve

quotes.quote:
Heaven has no rage like love to hatred turned,
Nor hell a fury like a woman scorned.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: A woman impudent and mannish grown is not more loathed than an effeminate man in time of action.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
A woman mov'd is like a fountain troubled, muddy,
ill-seeming, thick, bereft of beauty.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Age cannot wither her, nor custom stale her infinite variety.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
Art thou a man? thy form cries out thou art:
Thy tears are womanish; thy wild acts denote
The unreasonable fury of a beast:
Unseemly woman in a seeming man!
Or ill-beseeming beast in seeming both!
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Frailty, thy name is woman!
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Give me that man that is not passion's slave, and I will wear him in my hearts core.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Have you not heard it said full oft, a woman's nay doth stand for naught.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
He is the half part of a blessed man,
Left to be finished by such as she;
And she a fair divided excellence,
Whose fulness of perfection lies in him.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: His life was gentle, and the elements so mix'd in him that Nature might stand up and say to all the world 'This was a man!'
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: How ever do we praise ourselves, our fancies are more giddy and uniform, more longing, wavering, sooner lost and worn, than women's are.
I have always found that mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote:
Cowards are cruel, but the brave
Love mercy, and delight to save.
quotes.author: John Gay

quotes.quote: We shall show mercy, but we shall not ask for it.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Nothing emboldens sin so much as mercy.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Sweet mercy is nobility's true badge.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
The quality of mercy is not strain'd,
It droppeth as the gentle rain from heaven
Upon the place beneath. It is twice blest:
It blesseth him that gives and him that takes.
'T is mightiest in the mightiest: it becomes
The throned monarch better than his crown;
His sceptre shows the force of temporal power,
The attribute to awe and majesty,
Wherein doth sit the dread and fear of kings;
But mercy is above this sceptred sway,
It is enthroned in the hearts of kings,
It is an attribute to God himself;
And earthly power doth then show likest God's,
When mercy seasons justice. Therefore, Jew,
Though justice be thy plea, consider this,
That in the course of justice none of us
Should see salvation: we do pray for mercy;
And that same prayer doth teach us all to render
The deeds of mercy.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Mistakes are a part of being human. Appreciate your mistakes for what they are: precious life lessons that can only be learned the hard way. Unless it's a fatal mistake, which, at least, others can learn from.
quotes.author: Al Franken

quotes.author: Alvin Toffler

quotes.quote: Great services are not canceled by one act or by one single error.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: An expert is a person who avoids small error as he sweeps on to the grand fallacy.
quotes.author: Benjamin Stolberg

quotes.quote: Wise men profit more from fools than fools from wise men; for the wise men shun the mistakes of fools, but fools do not imitate the successes of the wise.
quotes.author: Cato the Elder

quotes.quote: We must not say every mistake is a foolish one.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Be not ashamed of mistakes and thus make them crimes.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: Laughing at our mistakes can lengthen our own life. Laughing at someone else's can shorten it.

quotes.quote: We're all capable of mistakes, but I do not care to enlighten you on the mistakes we may or may not have made.
quotes.author: Dan Quayle

quotes.quote: No one who cannot rejoice in the discovery of his own mistakes deserves to be called a scholar.
quotes.author: Donald Foster

quotes.quote: Assert your right to make a few mistakes. If people can't accept your imperfections, that's their fault.

quotes.quote: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: Experience is that marvelous thing that enables you to recognize a mistake when you make it again.
quotes.author: Franklin P. Jones

quotes.quote: It's always helpful to learn from your mistakes because then your mistakes seem worthwhile.
quotes.author: Garry Marshall

quotes.quote: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: While one person hesitates because he feels inferior, the other is busy making mistakes and becoming superior.
quotes.author: Henry C. Link

quotes.quote: She had an unequalled gift... of squeezing big mistakes into small opportunities.
quotes.author: Henry James

quotes.quote: When you make a mistake, don't look back at it long. Take the reason of the thing into your mind and then look forward. Mistakes are lessons of wisdom. The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.
quotes.author: Hugh White

quotes.quote: I have learned throughout my life as a composer chiefly through my mistakes and pursuits of false assumptions, not by my exposure to founts of wisdom and knowledge.
quotes.author: Igor Stravinsky

quotes.quote: Any man whose errors take ten years to correct is quite a man.
quotes.author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

quotes.quote: Experience teaches slowly and at the cost of mistakes.
quotes.author: James A. Froude

quotes.quote: Mistakes are the portals of discovery.
quotes.author: James Joyce

quotes.quote: If all else fails, immortality can always be assured by spectacular error.
quotes.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quotes.quote: Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: There are sadistic scientists who hurry to hunt down errors instead of establishing the truth.
quotes.author: Marie Curie

quotes.quote: If you have made mistakes, even serious ones, there is always another chance for you. What we call failure is not the falling down but the staying down.
quotes.author: Mary Pickford

quotes.quote: If I had my life to live over... I'd dare to make more mistakes next time.
quotes.author: Nadine Stair

quotes.quote: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.
quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.quote: An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field.

quotes.quote: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.

quotes.quote: Too many of us look upon Americans as dollar chasers. This is a cruel libel, even if it is reiterated thoughtlessly by the Americans themselves.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Poverty cannot deprive us of many consolations. It cannot rob us of the affection we have for each other, or degrade us in our own opinion, of in that of any person, whose opinion we ought to value.
quotes.author: Ann Radcliffe

quotes.quote: There is some magic in wealth, which can thus make persons pay their court to it, when it does not even benefit themselves. How strange it is, that a fool or knave, with riches, should be treated with more respect by the world, than a good man, or a wise man in poverty!
quotes.author: Ann Radcliffe

quotes.quote: I feel good about taking things to Goodwill and actually, I do like shopping at Goodwill. It's so cheap that it feels like a library where I am just checking things out for awhile until I decide to take them back.
quotes.author: April Foiles

quotes.quote: If you would be wealthy, think of saving as well as getting.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Who is rich? He that is content. Who is that? Nobody.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Riches may enable us to confer favours, but to confer them with propriety and grace requires a something that riches cannot give.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.quote: Annual income twenty pounds, annual expenditure nineteen six, result happiness. Annual income twenty pounds, annual expenditure twenty pound ought and six, result misery.

quotes.quote: If all the rich people in the world divided up their money among themselves there wouldn't be enough to go around.
quotes.author: Christina Stead

quotes.quote: Endless money forms the sinews of war.

quotes.quote: If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to.

quotes.quote: Money is the sinew of love as well as war.

quotes.quote: I'm living so far beyond my income that we may almost be said to be living apart.
quotes.author: e e cummings

quotes.quote: The only way not to think about money is to have a great deal of it.

quotes.quote: Save a little money each month and at the end of the year you'll be surprised at how little you have.

quotes.quote: My problem lies in reconciling my gross habits with my net income.

quotes.quote: The mint makes it first, it is up to you to make it last.

quotes.quote: The rich are the scum of the earth in every country.

quotes.quote: Lack of money is the root of all evil.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: One must be poor to know the luxury of giving.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: Money frees you from doing things you dislike. Since I dislike doing nearly everything, money is handy.

quotes.quote: The chief value of money lies in the fact that one lives in a world in which it is overestimated.

quotes.quote: Make money, money by fair means if you can, if not, but any means money.

quotes.quote: No moral system can rest solely on authority.

quotes.quote: Ethics, too, are nothing but reverence for life. That is what gives me the fundamental principle of morality, namely, that good consists in maintaining, promoting, and enhancing life, and that destroying, injuring, and limiting life are evil.

quotes.quote: Good laws have their origins in bad morals.

quotes.quote: Compassion is the basis of all morality.

quotes.quote: The people who are regarded as moral luminaries are those who forego ordinary pleasures themselves and find compensation in interfering with the pleasures of others.

quotes.quote: We have, in fact, two kinds of morality side by side: one which we preach but do not practice, and another which we practice but seldom preach.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: There is no moral precept that does not have something inconvenient about it.
quotes.author: Denis Diderot

quotes.quote: Morality is herd instinct in the individual.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: I say that a man must be certain of his morality for the simple reason that he has to suffer for it.

quotes.quote: An Englishman thinks he is moral when he is only uncomfortable.

quotes.quote: The difference between a moral man and a man of honor is that the latter regrets a discreditable act, even when it has worked and he has not been caught.

quotes.quote: Truth is the secret of eloquence and of virtue, the basis of moral authority; it is the highest summit of art and life.
quotes.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

quotes.quote: Aim above morality. Be not simply good; be good for something.

quotes.quote: Do not be too moral. You may cheat yourself out of much life. Aim above morality. Be not simply good; be good for something.

quotes.quote: Never let your sense of morals get in the way of doing what's right.

quotes.quote: History is a voice forever sounding across the centuries the laws of right and wrong. Opinions alter, manners change, creeds rise and fall, but the moral law is written on the tablets of eternity.
quotes.author: James A. Forude

quotes.quote: Taste is not only a part and index of morality, it is the only morality. The first, and last, and closest trial question to any living creature is "What do you like?" Tell me what you like, I'll tell you what you are.

quotes.quote: Scandal is great entertainment because it allows people to feel contempt, a moral emotion that gives feeling of moral superiority while asking nothing in return.

quotes.quote: The higher the buildings, the lower the morals.

quotes.quote: Morality, like art, means drawing a line someplace.

quotes.quote: Scandal is gossip made tedious by morality.

quotes.quote: The ability to see beauty is the beginning of our moral sensibility. What we believe is beautiful we will not wantonly destroy.

quotes.quote: I believe that in this generation those with the courage to enter the conflict will find themselves with companions in every corner of the world.

quotes.quote: If your morals make you dreary, depend on it , they are wrong.

quotes.quote: Perfection of moral virtue does not wholly take away the passions, but regulates them.

quotes.quote: The soul is the captain and ruler of the life of morals.

quotes.quote: 'Wrong' is one of those concepts that depends on witnesses.

quotes.quote: All sects are different, because they come from men; morality is everywhere the same, because it comes from God.

quotes.author: Aaron Copland

quotes.quote: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.

quotes.quote: [T]here's no bad day that can't be overcome by listening to a barbershop quartet; this is just truth, plain and simple.

quotes.quote: But then there's a moment like tonight, a profound and transcendent experience, the feeling as if a door has opened, and it's all because of that instrument, that incredible, magical instrument.
quotes.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider

quotes.quote: Opera is when a guy gets stabbed in the back and, instead of bleeding, he sings.
quotes.author: Ed Gardner

quotes.quote: Wagner's music is better than it sounds.
quotes.author: Edgar Wilson Nye

quotes.quote: My personal hobbies are reading, listening to music, and silence.
quotes.author: Edith Sitwell

quotes.quote: I don't know anything about music. In my line you don't have to.

quotes.quote: Only sick music makes money today.

quotes.quote: Music with dinner is an insult both to the cook and the violinist.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: Hell is full of musical amateurs.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Hell is full of musical amateurs: music is the brandy of the damned.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: I think I should have no other mortal wants, if I could always have plenty of music. It seems to infuse strength into my limbs and ideas into my brain. Life seems to go on without effort, when I am filled with music.

quotes.quote: There is no feeling, except the extremes of fear and grief, that does not find relief in music.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: Music is essentially useless, as life is.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.quote: Music is essentially useless, as life is: but both have an ideal extension which lends utility to its conditions.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.quote: Military justice is to justice what military music is to music.

quotes.quote: Among all men on the earth bards have a share of honor and reverence, because the muse has taught them songs and loves the race of bards.
quotes.author: Homer

quotes.quote: My music is best understood by children and animals.
quotes.author: Igor Stravinsky

quotes.quote: Ah, music. A magic beyond all we do here!
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: I think everyone should have a Beatles phase in their life. I think it's part of growing up in the Western world.
quotes.author: Jadelr and Cristina Cordova

quotes.quote: Music like religion, unconditionally brings in its train all the moral virtues to the heart it enters, even though that heart is not in the least worthy.

quotes.quote: I hate music, especially when it's played.
quotes.author: Jimmy Durante

quotes.quote: If you develop an ear for sounds that are musical it is like developing an ego. You begin to refuse sounds that are not musical and that way cut yourself off from a good deal of experience.

quotes.quote: Music is the only language in which you cannot say a mean or sarcastic thing.

quotes.quote: Classical music is the kind we keep thinking will turn into a tune.

quotes.quote: Music is a discipline, and a mistress of order and good manners, she makes the people milder and gentler, more moral and more reasonable.

quotes.quote: My heart, which is so full to overflowing, has often been solaced and refreshed by music when sick and weary.

quotes.quote: Take a music bath once or twice a week for a few seasons, and you will find that it is to the soul what the water bath is to the body.

quotes.quote: The refreshing pleasure from the first view of nature, after the pain of illness, and the confinement of a sick-chamber, is above the conceptions, as well as the descriptions, of those in health.

quotes.quote: Nature is just enough; but men and women must comprehend and accept her suggestions.

quotes.quote: In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous.

quotes.quote: Nature does nothing uselessly.

quotes.quote: The materials of wealth are in the earth, in the seas, and in their natural and unaided productions.

quotes.quote: I would feel more optimistic about a bright future for man if he spent less time proving that he can outwit Nature and more time tasting her sweetness and respecting her seniority.
quotes.author: E. B. White

quotes.quote: Mountains inspire awe in any human person who has a soul. They remind us of our frailty, our unimportance, of the briefness of our span upon this earth. They touch the heavens, and sail serenely at an altitude beyond even the imaginings of a mere mortal.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.quote: I believe in God, only I spell it Nature.
quotes.author: H. G. Wells

quotes.quote: Adapt or perish, now as ever, is nature's inexorable imperative.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.quote: Nature is wont to hide herself.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: One cannot fix one's eyes on the commonest natural production without finding food for a rambling fancy.
quotes.author: Scott Westerfeld

quotes.quote: It's amazing how quickly nature consumes human places after we turn our backs on them. Life is a hungry thing.
quotes.author: Tennessee Williams

quotes.quote: A vacuum is a hell of a lot better than some of the stuff that nature replaces it with.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.quote: After you have exhausted what there is in business, politics, conviviality, and so on - have found that none of these finally satisfy, or permanently wear - what remains? Nature remains.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.quote: You must not know too much or be too precise or scientific about birds and trees and flowers and watercraft; a certain free-margin, and even vagueness - ignorance, credulity - helps your enjoyment of these things.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Nature does require her times of preservation.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
Where the bee sucks, there suck I:
In a cowslip's bell I lie;
There I couch when owls do cry.
On the bat's back I do fly
After summer merrily.
Merrily, merrily shall I live now
Under the blossom that hangs on the bough.
quotes.author: Zeno

quotes.quote: The goal of life is living in agreement with nature.
Not even the gods fight against necessity.
quotes.author: Simonides

quotes.quote: Necessity has no law.
quotes.author: William Langland

quotes.quote: Necessity is the plea for every infringement of human freedom. It is the argument of tyrants; it is the creed of slaves.
quotes.author: William Pitt

quotes.quote: Noble life demands a noble architecture for noble uses of noble men. Lack of culture means what it has always meant: ignoble civilization and therefore imminent downfall.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.quote: It is nobler to declare oneself wrong than to insist on being right - especially when one is right.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: I too shall lie in the dust when I am dead, but now let me win noble renown.
quotes.author: Homer

quotes.quote: Whenever a man does a thoroughly stupid thing, it is always from the noblest motives.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Life ought to be a struggle of desire toward adventures whose nobility will fertilize the soul.
quotes.author: Rebecca West

quotes.quote: They are never alone that are accompanied with noble thoughts.
quotes.author: Sir Philip Sidney

quotes.quote: Put more trust in nobility of character than in an oath.
quotes.author: Solon

quotes.quote: The truth is that there is nothing noble in being superior to somebody else. The only real nobility is in being superior to your former self.
quotes.author: Whitney Young

quotes.quote: No one can build his security upon the nobleness of another person.
quotes.author: Willa Cather

quotes.quote: Sweet mercy is nobility's true badge.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: When men exercise their reason coolly and freely on a variety of distinct questions, they inevitably fall into different opinions on some of them. When they are governed by a common passion, their opinions, if they are to be called, will be the same.
quotes.author: Alexander Hamilton

quotes.quote: It is not advisable, James, to venture unsolicited opinions. You should spare yourself the embarrassing discovery of their exact value to your listener.
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.quote: Every man has a right to his opinion, but no man has a right to be wrong in his facts.
quotes.author: Bernard M. Baruch

quotes.quote: I think we ought always to entertain our opinions with some measure of doubt. I shouldn't wish people dogmatically to believe any philosophy, not even mine.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: The opinions that are held with passion are always those for which no good ground exists; indeed the passion is the measure of the holders lack of rational conviction. Opinions in politics and religion are almost always held passionately.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: I'm not sure I want popular opinion on my side -- I've noticed those with the most opinions often have the fewest facts.
quotes.author: Bethania McKenstry

quotes.quote: Fight for your opinions, but do not believe that they contain the whole truth, or the only truth.
quotes.author: Charles A. Dana

quotes.quote: The recipe for perpetual ignorance is: be satisfied with your opinions and content with your knowledge.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: The moment we begin to fear the opinions of others and hesitate to tell the truth that is in us, and from motives of policy are silent when we should speak, the divine floods of light and life no longer flow into our souls.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quotes.quote: There is probably an element of malice in our readiness to overestimate people - we are, as it were, laying up for ourselves the pleasure of later cutting them down to size.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: Opinions founded on prejudice are always sustained with the greatest of violence.
quotes.author: Francis Jeffrey

quotes.quote: It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: Don't judge a man by his opinions, but what his opinions have made of him.
quotes.author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quotes.quote: Nothing is more conducive to peace of mind than not having any opinions at all.
quotes.author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quotes.quote: I have opinions of my own -- strong opinions -- but I don't always agree with them.
quotes.author: George Bush

quotes.quote: This imputation of inconsistency is one to which every sound politician and every honest thinker must sooner or later subject himself. The foolish and the dead alone never change their opinion.
quotes.author: John Milton

quotes.quote: Where there is much desire to learn, there of necessity will be much arguing, much writing, many opinions; for opinions in good men is but knowledge in the making.
quotes.author: Katherine Mansfield

quotes.quote: Risk! Risk anything! Care no more for the opinions of others, for those voices. Do the hardest thing on earth for you. Act for yourself. Face the truth.
quotes.author: Lawana Blackwell

quotes.quote: Patterning your life around other's opinions is nothing more than slavery.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: I am not one of those who in expressing opinions confine themselves to facts.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Our opinions do not really blossom into fruition until we have expressed them to someone else.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Sane and intelligent human beings are like all other human beings, and carefully and cautiously and diligently conceal their private real opinions from the world and give out fictitious ones in their stead for general consumption.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: It is much easier to break the rules when one s surrounded by strangers. One does not know any of them, so one cannot really care for their opinion.
quotes.author: Senator Patrick Leahy

quotes.quote: You are young, my son, and, as the years go by, time will change and even reverse many of your present opinions. Refrain therefore awhile from setting yourself up as a judge of the highest matters.
quotes.author: Thomas H. Huxley

quotes.quote: You get fifteen democrats in a room, and you get twenty opinions.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: There is no greater mistake than the hasty conclusion that opinions are worthless because they are badly argued.
quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

quotes.quote: Every difference of opinion is not a difference of principle.
quotes.author: Walter Pater

quotes.quote: Literature is strewn with the wreckage of men who have minded beyond reason the opinions of others.
What we have to do is to be forever curiously testing new opinions and courting new impressions.
Next to knowing when to seize an opportunity, the most important thing in life is to know when to forego an advantage.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: Seize opportunity by the beard, for it is bald behind.
quotes.author: Bulgarian Proverb

quotes.quote: Small opportunities are often the beginning of great enterprises.
quotes.author: Demosthenes

quotes.quote: You have to recognize when the right place and the right time fuse and take advantage of that opportunity. There are plenty of opportunities out there. You can't sit back and wait.
quotes.author: Ellen Metcalf

quotes.quote: There is no security on this earth, there is only opportunity.
quotes.author: General Douglas MacArthur

quotes.quote: Trouble is only opportunity in work clothes.
quotes.author: Henry J. Kaiser

quotes.quote: She had an unequalled gift... of squeezing big mistakes into small opportunities.
quotes.author: Henry James

quotes.quote: Too many people are thinking of security instead of opportunity. They seem more afraid of life than death.
quotes.author: James F. Byrnes

quotes.quote: The Chinese use two brush strokes to write the word 'crisis.' One brush stroke stands for danger; the other for opportunity. In a crisis, be aware of the danger - but recognize the opportunity.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: We are continually faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as insoluble problems.
quotes.author: John W. Gardner

quotes.quote: Equal opportunity means everyone will have a fair chance at being incompetent.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.quote: You create your opportunities by asking for them.
quotes.author: Patty Hansen

quotes.quote: While we stop to think, we often miss our opportunity.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: No great man ever complains of want of opportunity.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.
quotes.author: Sir Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
quotes.author: Thomas A. Edison

quotes.quote: THERE ARE NO MISTAKES, only opportunities.
quotes.author: Walt Kelly

quotes.quote: We are confronted with insurmountable opportunities.
Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.
quotes.author: Colin Powell

quotes.quote: The place where optimism most flourishes is the lunatic asylum.
quotes.author: Havelock Ellis

quotes.quote: The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds; and the pessimist fears this is true.
quotes.author: James Branch Cabell

quotes.quote: The reason we all like to think so well of others is that we are all afraid for ourselves. The basis of optimism is sheer terror.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: I find nothing more depressing than optimism.
quotes.author: Paul Fussell

quotes.quote: The point of living and of being an optimist, is to be foolish enough to believe the best is yet to come.
quotes.author: Peter Ustinov

quotes.quote: Many an optimist has become rich by buying out a pessimist.
quotes.author: Robert G. Allen

quotes.quote: For myself I am an optimist - it does not seem to be much use being anything else.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: An optimist is the human personification of spring.
quotes.author: Susan J. Bissonette

quotes.quote: Painting: The art of protecting flat surfaces from the weather and exposing them to the critic.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: A painting in a museum hears more ridiculous opinions than anything else in the world.
quotes.author: Edmond de Goncourt

quotes.quote: Painting is an attempt to come to terms with life. There are as many solutions as there are human beings.
quotes.author: George Tooker

quotes.quote: Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.quote: The painting has a life of its own. I try to let it come through.
quotes.author: Jackson Pollock

quotes.quote: It's not your painting anymore. It stopped being your painting the moment that you finished it.
quotes.author: Jeff Melvoin

quotes.quote: Every time I paint a portrait I lose a friend.
quotes.author: John Singer Sargent

quotes.quote: A man paints with his brains and not with his hands.
quotes.author: Michelangelo Buonarroti

quotes.quote: I say that good painters imitated nature; but that bad ones vomited it.
quotes.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quotes.quote: Painting is just another way of keeping a diary.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.quote: There are painters who transform the sun to a yellow spot, but there are others who with the help of their art and their intelligence, transform a yellow spot into the sun.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.quote: Painting is silent poetry, and poetry is painting with the gift of speech.
quotes.author: Simonides

quotes.quote: Each painting has its own way of evolving...When the painting is finished, the subject reaveals itself.
quotes.author: William Baziotes

quotes.quote: How simple a thing it seems to me that to know ourselves as we are, we must know our mothers' names.
quotes.author: Alice Walker

quotes.quote: The world is full of women blindsided by the unceasing demands of motherhood, still flabbergasted by how a job can be terrific and torturous.
quotes.author: Anna Quindlen

quotes.quote: Sometimes the laughter in mothering is the recognition of the ironies and absurdities. Sometime, though, it's just pure, unthinking delight.
quotes.author: Barbara Schapiro

quotes.quote: Sooner or later we all quote our mothers.
quotes.author: Bern Williams
