quotes.quote: The place of the father in the modern suburban family is a very small one, particularly if he plays golf.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found.
quotes.author: Calvin Trillin

quotes.quote: My parents only had one argument in forty-five years. It lasted forty-three years.
quotes.author: Cathy Ladman

quotes.quote: By the time a man realizes that maybe his father was right, he usually has a son who thinks he's wrong.
quotes.author: Charles Wadsworth

quotes.quote: Your parents, they give you your life, but then they try to give you their life.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.quote: The first half of our lives is ruined by our parents, and the second half by our children.
quotes.author: Clarence Darrow

quotes.quote: There's something unnatural about a woman finding babies or, more specifically, conversation about babies, boring. They'll think she's bitter, jealous, lonely. But she's also bored of everybody telling her how lucky she is, what with all that sleep and all that freedom and spare time, the ability to go on dates or head off to Paris at a moments notice. It sounds like they're consoling her, and she resents this and feels patronized by it.
quotes.author: Dick Cavett

quotes.quote: If your parents never had children, chances are you won't, either.
quotes.author: Dorothy C. Fisher

quotes.quote: A mother is not a person to lean on but a person to make leaning unnecessary.
quotes.author: Elain Heffner

quotes.quote: The art of mothering is to teach the art of living to children.
quotes.author: Ellen Goodman

quotes.quote: The central struggle of parenthood is to let our hopes for our children outweigh our fears.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: Having a baby's sweet face so close to your own, for so long a time as it takes to nurse 'em, is a great tonic for a sad soul.
quotes.author: H. R. Schaffer

quotes.quote: Losing a baby is not a thing that you could ever get used to.
quotes.author: Heather Armstrong

quotes.quote: The gods visit the sins of the fathers upon the children.
quotes.author: Heather Armstrong

quotes.quote: There is�nothing to suggest that mothering cannot be shared by several people.
quotes.author: Homer

quotes.quote: That�s sort of a clich� about parents. We all believe that our children are the most beautiful children in the world. But the thing is, what no one really talks about is the fact that we all really believe it.
quotes.author: Jill Churchill

quotes.quote: This is part of the essence of motherhood, watching your kid grow into her own person and not being able to do anything about it. Otherwise children would be nothing more than pets.
quotes.author: King Edward VIII

quotes.quote: For rarely are sons similar to their fathers: most are worse, and a few are better than their fathers.
quotes.author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quotes.quote: The most important thing she'd learned over the years was that there was no way to be a perfect mother and a million ways to be a good one.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: It's interesting, on your second day of existence, to realize that your father is going to blame all the future failures of his life on you.
quotes.author: Ogden Nash

quotes.quote: It does not always follow that good men are good fathers.
The thing that impresses me the most about America is the way parents obey their children.
Some men just aren't cut out for paternity. Better they should realize it before and not after they become responsible for a son.
My mother had a great deal of trouble with me, but I think she enjoyed it.
Parents are never as bad as kids think they are.
Parents were invented to make children happy by giving them something to ignore.
The happiness of a man in this life does not consist in the absence but in the mastery of his passions.
quotes.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quotes.quote: My passions were all gathered together like fingers that made a fist. Drive is considered aggression today; I knew it then as purpose.
quotes.author: Bette Davis

quotes.quote: He only employs his passion who can make no use of his reason.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot.
quotes.author: D. H. Lawrence

quotes.quote: Only passions, great passions, can elevate the soul to great things.
quotes.author: Denis Diderot

quotes.quote: The worst sin - perhaps the only sin - passion can commit, is to be joyless.
quotes.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quotes.quote: Judgement, not passion should prevail.
quotes.author: Epicharmus

quotes.quote: Nothing great in the world has been accomplished without passion.
quotes.author: Georg Wilhelm

quotes.quote: Passion makes the world go round. Love just makes it a safer place.
quotes.author: Ice T

quotes.quote: Blaze with the fire that is never extinguished.
quotes.author: Luisa Sigea

quotes.quote: Waste no more time talking about great souls and how they should be. Become one yourself!
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

quotes.quote: When the habitually even-tempered suddenly fly into a passion, that explosion is apt to be more impressive than the outburst of the most violent amongst us.
quotes.author: Margery Allingham

quotes.quote: I had learnt to seek intensity�more of life, a concentrated sense of life.
quotes.author: Nina Berberova

quotes.quote: Do the one thing you think you cannot do. Fail at it. Try again. Do better the second time. The only people who never tumble are those who never mount the high wire. This is your moment. Own it.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: I believe that one of life's greatest risks is never daring to risk.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: You will need to find your passion. Don't give up on finding it because then all you're doing is waiting for the Reaper.
quotes.author: Rebecca West

quotes.quote: You will not find your passion in things and you will not find your passion in money. The more things and the more money you have, the more you will look around and use that as the metric and there will be someone with more.
quotes.author: Robert Sternberg

quotes.quote: Your pasion must come from the things that fuel you from the inside. Honors and awards are nice things, but only to the extent that they regard the real respect from your peers.
quotes.author: Salma Hayek

quotes.quote: It's the soul's duty to be loyal to its own desires. It must abandon itself to its master passion.
quotes.author: Saul Bellow

quotes.quote: Passion is the quickest to develop, and the quickest to fade. Intimacy develops more slowly, and commitment more gradually still.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The biggest thing [Frida] brought into my life was this peacefulness. I still get passionate about things, but my passion is not so scattered and it's not needy. It's a lot more powerful because it comes with this groundedness and peacefulness. That it's about the process, not about the results.
quotes.author: Stanley Kunitz

quotes.quote: There was a disturbance in my heart, a voice that spoke there and said, I want, I want, I want! It happened every afternoon, and when I tried to suppress it it got even stronger.
quotes.author: Sue Halpern

quotes.quote: It is easier to exclude harmful passions than to rule them, and to deny them admittance than to control them after they have been admitted.
What makes the engine go? Desire, desire, desire.
Passion kept one fully in the present, so that time became a series of mutually exclusive 'nows.'

Learn the art of patience. Apply discipline to your thoughts when they become anxious over the outcome of a goal. Impatience breeds anxiety, fear, discouragement and failure. Patience creates confidence, decisiveness, and a rational outlook, which eventually leads to success.
quotes.author: Brian Adams

quotes.quote: Patience is the greatest of all virtues.
quotes.author: Cato the Elder

quotes.quote: A handful of patience is worth more than a bushel of brains.
quotes.author: Dutch Proverb

quotes.quote: Our patience will achieve more than our force.
quotes.author: Edmund Burke

quotes.quote: It is very strange that the years teach us patience - that the shorter our time, the greater our capacity for waiting.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Taylor

quotes.quote: There art two cardinal sins from which all others spring: Impatience and Laziness.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.quote: Patience has its limits. Take it too far, and it's cowardice.
quotes.author: George Jackson

quotes.quote: We could never learn to be brave and patient, if there were only joy in the world.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: The fates have given mankind a patient soul.
quotes.author: Homer

quotes.quote: If I have ever made any valuable discoveries, it has been owing more to patient attention, than to any other talent.
quotes.author: Isaac Newton

quotes.quote: Patience serves as a protection against wrongs as clothes do against cold. For if you put on more clothes as the cold increases, it will have no power to hurt you. So in like manner you must grow in patience when you meet with great wrongs, and they will then be powerless to vex your mind.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.quote: I am extraordinarily patient, provided I get my own way in the end.
quotes.author: Margaret Thatcher

quotes.quote: There will be a time when loud-mouthed, incompetent people seem to be getting the best of you. When that happens, you only have to be patient and wait for them to self destruct. It never fails.
quotes.author: Richard Rybolt

quotes.quote: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
quotes.author: Saint Augustine

quotes.quote: Have patience with all things, but chiefly have patience with yourself. Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections but instantly set about remedying them - every day begin the task anew.
quotes.author: Saint Francis de Sales

quotes.quote: You must first have a lot of patience to learn to have patience.
quotes.author: Stanislaw J. Lec

quotes.quote: Patience is the best remedy for every trouble.
quotes.author: Titus Maccius Plautus

quotes.quote: Have courage for the great sorrows of life and patience for the small ones; and when you have laboriously accomplished your daily task, go to sleep in peace. God is awake.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.quote: A high hope for a low heaven: God grant us patience!
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: A very little thief of occasion will rob you of a great deal of patience.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Had it pleas'd heaven to try me with affliction... I should have found in some place of my soul a drop of patience.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: How poor are they that have not patience! What wound did ever heal but by degrees?
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: How poor are they who have not patience! What wound did ever heal but by degrees.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: I do oppose my patience to his fury, and am arm'd to suffer with a quietness of spirit, the very tyranny and rage of his.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Patience is sottish, and impatience does become a dog that's mad.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Though patience be a tired mare, yet she will plod.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Upon the heat and flame of thy distemper sprinkle cool patience.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: True patriotism sometimes requires of men to act exactly contrary, at one period, to that which it does at another, and the motive which impels themthe desire to do rightis precisely the same.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Patriotism is the willingness to kill and be killed for trivial reasons.
quotes.author: Daniel Webster

quotes.quote: The contest, for ages, has been to rescue Liberty from the grasp of executive power.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: "My country, right or wrong," is a thing that no patriot would think of saying except in a desperate case. It is like saying, "My mother, drunk or sober."
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Liberty also means responsibility. That is why most men dread it.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Patriotism is your conviction that this country is superior to all other countries because you were born in it.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: You'll never have a quiet world till you knock the patriotism out of the human race.
quotes.author: George Jean Nathan

quotes.quote: Patriotism is often an arbitrary veneration of real estate above principles.
quotes.author: George S. Patton

quotes.quote: Don't be a fool and die for your country. Let the other sonofabitch die for his.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: Whenever you hear a man speak of his love for his country, it is a sign that he expects to be paid for it.
quotes.author: Homer

quotes.quote: It is not unseemly for a man to die fighting in defense of his country.
quotes.author: Homer

quotes.quote: The single best augury is to fight for one's country.
quotes.author: Indira Gandhi

quotes.quote: We would rather starve than sell our national honor.
quotes.author: John Adams

quotes.quote: Our obligations to our country never cease but with our lives.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: And so, my fellow americans: ask not what your country can do for you - ask what you can do for your country. My fellow citizens of the world: ask not what America will do for you, but what together we can do for the freedom of man.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: Let every nation know, whether it wishes us well or ill, that we shall pay any price, bear any burden, meet any hardship, support any friend, oppose any foe to assure the survival and the success of liberty.
quotes.author: Joseph Addison

quotes.quote:
How beautiful is death, when earn'd by virtue!
Who would not be that youth? What pity is it
That we can die but once to serve our country!
quotes.author: Malcolm X

quotes.quote: You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it.
quotes.author: Nathan Hale

quotes.quote: I only regret that I have but one life to lose for my country.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: When a whole nation is roaring Patriotism at the top of its voice, I am fain to explore the cleanness of its hands and purity of its heart.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: Patriotism is the last refuge of a scoundrel.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: When I am abroad, I always make it a rule never to criticize or attack the government of my own country. I make up for lost time when I come home.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: I would rather be exposed to the inconveniencies attending too much liberty than those attending too small a degree of it.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: It behoves every man who values liberty of conscience for himself, to resist invasions of it in the case of others; or their case may, by change of circumstances, become his own.
quotes.author: Woodrow Wilson

quotes.quote: The flag is the embodiment, not of sentiment, but of history.
quotes.author: Woodrow Wilson

quotes.quote: The history of liberty is the history of resistance. The history of liberty is a history of the limitation of governmental power, not the increase of it.
We shall find peace. We shall hear the angels, we shall see the sky sparkling with diamonds.
quotes.author: Anton Chekhov

quotes.quote: We make war that we may live in peace.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Peace is not an absence of war, it is a virtue, a state of mind, a disposition for benevolence, confidence, justice.
quotes.author: Baruch Spinoza

quotes.quote: For peace is not mere absence of war, but is a virtue that springs from the force of character.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: At present the peace of the world has been preserved, not by statesmen, but by capitalists.
quotes.author: Carlos Santana

quotes.quote: Peace has never come from dropping bombs. Real peace comes from enlightenment and educating people to behave more in a divine manner.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: The name of peace is sweet, and the thing itself is beneficial, but there is a great difference between peace and servitude. Peace is freedom in tranquillity, servitude is the worst of all evils, to be resisted not only by war, but even by death.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: I like to believe that people in the long run are going to do more to promote peace than our governments. Indeed, I think that people want peace so much that one of these days governments had better get out of the way and let them have it.
quotes.author: Flavius Vegetius Renatus

quotes.quote: Yes, God and the politicians willing, the United States can declare peace upon the world, and win it.
quotes.author: George C. Marshall

quotes.quote: Let him who desires peace prepare for war.
quotes.author: Hermocrates of Syracuse

quotes.quote: If man does find the solution for world peace it will be the most revolutionary reversal of his record we have ever known.
quotes.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quotes.quote: Has not peace honours and glories of her own unattended by the dangers of war?
quotes.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quotes.quote: Peace is not a relationship of nations. It is a condition of mind brought about by a serenity of soul. Peace is not merely the absence of war. It is also a state of mind. Lasting peace can come only to peaceful people.
quotes.author: Malcolm X

quotes.quote: The only alternative to coexistence is codestruction.
quotes.author: Moshe Dayan

quotes.quote: You can't separate peace from freedom because no one can be at peace unless he has his freedom.
quotes.author: Peter McWilliams

quotes.quote: If you want to make peace, you don't talk to your friends. You talk to your enemies.
quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.quote: If you want peace, stop fighting. If you want peace of mind, stop fighting with your thoughts.
quotes.author: Thomas a Kempis

quotes.quote: Every day we do things, we are things that have to do with peace. If we are aware of our life..., our way of looking at things, we will know how to make peace right in the moment, we are alive.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: First keep the peace within yourself, then you can also bring peace to others.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Peace with all nations, and the right which that gives us with respect to all nations, are our object.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: That peace, safety, and concord may be the portion of our native land, and be long enjoyed by our fellow-citizens, is the most ardent wish of my heart, and if I can be instrumental in procuring or preserving them, I shall think I have not lived in vain.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: One cannot find peace in work or in pleasure, in the world or in a convent, but only in one's soul.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Tao. Some of us look for the Way in opium and some in God, some of us in whiskey and some in love. It is all the same Way and it leads nowhither.
quotes.author: Woodrow Wilson

quotes.quote: Peace is an unstable equilibrium, which can be preserved only by acknowledged supremacy or equal power.
The peace of heaven is theirs that lift their swords, in such a just and charitable war.
Only a peace between equals can last. Only a peace the very principle of which is equality and a common participation in a common benefit.
I never expect to see a perfect work from imperfect man.
quotes.author: Alexander Hamilton

quotes.quote: The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself.
quotes.author: Anna Quindlen

quotes.quote: Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quotes.quote: Perfection is a road, not a destination. Every time I live, I get an education.
quotes.author: Burk Hudson

quotes.quote: Aim for success, not perfection. Never give up your right to be wrong, because then you will lose the ability to learn new things and move forward with your life.
quotes.author: Dr. David M. Burns

quotes.quote: Assert your right to make a few mistakes. If people can't accept your imperfections, that's their fault.
quotes.author: Dr. David M. Burns

quotes.quote: Remember that fear always lurks behind perfectionism. Confronting your fears and allowing yourself the right to be human can, paradoxically, make you a far happier and more productive person.
quotes.author: Dr. David M. Burns

quotes.quote: Artists who seek perfection in everything are those who cannot attain it in anything.
quotes.author: Eugene Delacroix

quotes.quote: I do think imperfection's underrated.
quotes.author: Herbert Spencer

quotes.quote: No one can be perfectly free till all are free; no one can be perfectly moral till all are moral; no one can be perfectly happy till all are happy.
quotes.author: John Eliot, Ph.D.

quotes.quote: Perfectionism is simply putting a limit on your future. When you have an idea of perfect in your mind, you open the door to constantly comparing what you have now with what you want. That type of self criticism is significantly deterring.
quotes.author: John Eliot, Ph.D.

quotes.quote: The idea of perfect closes your mind to new standards.. When you drive hard toward one ideal, you miss opportunities and paths, not to mention hurting your confidence. Believe in your potential and then go out and explore it; don�t limit it.
quotes.author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quotes.quote: I don't confuse greatness with perfection. To be great anyhow is�the higher achievement.
quotes.author: Michael J. Fox

quotes.quote: I am careful not to confuse excellence with perfection. Excellence, I can reach for; perfection is God's business.
quotes.author: Michelle Burford

quotes.quote: [M]aybe the most any of us can expect of ourselves isn't perfection but progress.
quotes.author: Saint Francis de Sales

quotes.quote: To demand perfection is a sure way to be disappointed in everybody, for you will be bound to think ill of others.
quotes.author: Salvador Dali

quotes.quote: Have patience with all things, but chiefly have patience with yourself. Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections but instantly set about remedying them - every day begin the task anew.
quotes.author: Samuel McChord Crothers

quotes.quote: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.
Try as hard as we may for perfection, the net result of our labors is an amazing variety of imperfectness. We are surprised at our own versatility in being able to fail in so many different ways.
If you'd like to be good at something, the first thing to out the window is the notion of perfection.
You have to let people see what you wrote. It will never be perfect, but perfect is overrated. Perfect is boring.
We are all imperfect. We cannot expect perfect government.
By perseverance the snail reached the ark.
quotes.author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

quotes.quote: I think a hero is an ordinary individual who finds strength to persevere and endure in spite of overwhelming obstacles.
quotes.author: Christopher Reeve

quotes.quote: The difference between perseverance and obstinacy is that one comes from a strong will; and the other from a strong won't.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.quote: You have to keep plugging away. We are all growing. There is no shortcut. You have to put time into it to build an audience
quotes.author: John Gruber

quotes.quote: Courage and perseverance have a magical talisman, before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish into air.
quotes.author: John Quincy Adams

quotes.quote: If you wish success in life, make perseverance your bosom friend, experience your wise counselor, caution your elder brother and hope your guardian genius.
quotes.author: Joseph Addison

quotes.quote: Victory belongs to the most persevering.
quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.quote: Perseverance is more prevailing than violence; and many things which cannot be overcome when they are together, yield themselves up when taken little by little.
quotes.author: Plutarch

quotes.quote: Few things are impossible to diligence and skill. Great works are performed not by strength, but perseverance.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: Energy and persistence conquer all things.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Nothing in the world can take the place of Persistence.  Talent will not; nothing is more common than unsuccessful men with talent.  Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb.  Education will not; the world is full of educated derelicts.  Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent. The slogan 'Press On' has solved and always will solve the problems of the human race.
quotes.author: Calvin Coolidge

quotes.quote: You must keep sending work out; you must never let a manuscript do nothing but eat its head off in a drawer. You send that work out again and again, while you're working on another one. If you have talent, you will receive some measure of success - but only if you persist.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: That which we persist in doing becomes easier, not that the task itself has become easier, but that our ability to perform it has improved.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: We are made to persist. That's how we find out who we are.
quotes.author: Tobias Wolff

quotes.quote: If a dog jumps in your lap, it is because he is fond of you; but if a cat does the same thing, it is because your lap is warmer.
quotes.author: Alfred North Whitehead

quotes.quote: We call them dumb animals, and so they are, for they cannot tell us how they feel, but they do not suffer less because they have no words.
quotes.author: Anna Sewell

quotes.quote: I loathe people who keep dogs. They are cowards who haven't got the guts to bite people themselves.
quotes.author: August Strindberg

quotes.quote: Yesterday I was a dog. Today I'm a dog. Tomorrow I'll probably still be a dog. Sigh! There's so little hope for advancement.
quotes.author: Charles M. Schulz

quotes.quote: It's funny how dogs and cats know the inside of folks better than other folks do, isn't it?
quotes.author: Eleanor H. Porter

quotes.quote: If you are a dog and your owner suggests that you wear a sweater, suggest that he wear a tail.
quotes.author: Fran Lebowitz

quotes.quote: No animal should ever jump up on the dining-room furniture unless absolutely certain that he can hold his own in the conversation.
quotes.author: Fran Lebowitz

quotes.quote: Animals are such agreeable friends - they ask no questions, they pass no criticisms.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: Cats regard people as warmblooded furniture.
quotes.author: Jacquelyn Mitchard

quotes.quote: Cats are smarter than dogs. You can't get eight cats to pull a sled through snow.
quotes.author: Jeff Valdez

quotes.quote: Old age means realizing you will never own all the dogs you wanted to.
quotes.author: Joe Gores

quotes.quote: My dog is worried about the economy because Alpo is up to 99 cents a can. That's almost $7.00 in dog money.
quotes.author: Joe Weinstein

quotes.quote: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous, he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and a man.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: We are alone, absolutely alone on this chance planet: and, amid all the forms of life that surround us, not one, excepting the dog, has made an alliance with us.
quotes.author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quotes.quote: A door is what a dog is perpetually on the wrong side of.
quotes.author: Ogden Nash

quotes.quote: On the Internet, nobody knows you're a dog.
quotes.author: Peter Steiner

quotes.quote: I wonder if other dogs think poodles are members of a weird religious cult.
quotes.author: Rita Rudner

quotes.quote: A boy can learn a lot from a dog: obedience, loyalty, and the importance of turning around three times before lying down.
quotes.author: Robert Benchley

quotes.quote: I like pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Did you ever walk into a room and forget why you walked in? I think that's how dogs spend their lives.
quotes.author: Sue Murphy

quotes.quote: Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a function.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: I think we ought always to entertain our opinions with some measure of doubt. I shouldn't wish people dogmatically to believe any philosophy, not even mine.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: The point of philosophy is to start with something so simple as not to seem worth stating, and to end with something so paradoxical that no one will believe it.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: This is patently absurd; but whoever wishes to become a philosopher must learn not to be frightened by absurdities.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: There's a difference between a philosophy and a bumper sticker.
quotes.author: Charles M. Schulz

quotes.quote: There is nothing so absurd but some philosopher has said it.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Who you are isn't tied solely to what you say, even though it may feel that way to you now.
quotes.author: Diane Ackerman

quotes.quote: I went off to college planning to major in math or philosophy-- of course, both those ideas are really the same idea.
quotes.author: Frank Wilczek

quotes.quote: Philosophy consists very largely of one philosopher arguing that all others are jackasses. He usually proves it, and I should add that he also usually proves that he is one himself.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: Philosophy is a battle against the bewitchment of our intelligence by means of language.
quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.quote: One cannot conceive anything so strange and so implausible that it has not already been said by one philosopher or another.
quotes.author: Rene Descartes

quotes.quote: Philosophers say a great deal about what is absolutely necessary for science, and it is always, so far as one can see, rather naive, and probably wrong.
quotes.author: Richard Feynman

quotes.quote: All philosophies, if you ride them, are nonsense, but some are greater nonsense than others.
quotes.author: Samuel Butler

quotes.quote: Leisure is the mother of philosophy.
quotes.author: Thomas Hobbes

quotes.quote: True philosophy invents nothing; it merely establishes and describes what is.
quotes.author: Victor Cousin

quotes.quote: There is only one thing a philosopher can be relied upon to do, and that is to contradict other philosophers.
quotes.author: William James

quotes.quote:
There are more things in heaven and earth, Horatio,
Than are dreamt of in your philosophy.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: 'To the complaint, 'There are no people in these photographs,' I respond, 'There are always two people: the photographer and the viewer.'
quotes.author: Ansel Adams

quotes.quote: I have often thought that if photography were difficult in the true sense of the term -- meaning that the creation of a simple photograph would entail as much time and effort as the production of a good watercolor or etching -- there would be a vast improvement in total output. The sheer ease with which we can produce a superficial image often leads to creative disaster.
quotes.author: Ansel Adams

quotes.quote: A photograph is a secret about a secret. The more it tells you the less you know.
quotes.author: Diane Arbus

quotes.quote: Best wide-angle lens? Two steps backward. Look for the 'ah-ha'.
quotes.author: Ernst Haas

quotes.quote: The camera doesn't make a bit of difference. All of them can record what you are seeing. But, you have to SEE.
quotes.author: Ernst Haas

quotes.quote: We try to grab pieces of our lives as they speed past us. Photographs freeze those pieces and help us remember how we were. We don't know these lost people but if you look around, you'll find someone just like them.
quotes.author: Gene McSweeney

quotes.quote: Photographers deal in things which are continually vanishing and when they have vanished there is no contrivance on earth which can make them come back again.
quotes.author: Henri Cartier Bresson

quotes.quote: Maybe because it's entirely an artist's eye, patience and skill that makes an image and not his tools.
quotes.author: Ken Rockwell

quotes.quote: No matter how advanced your camera you still need to be responsible for getting it to the right place at the right time and pointing it in the right direction to get the photo you want.
quotes.author: Ken Rockwell

quotes.quote: The camera's only job is to get out of the way of making photographs.
quotes.author: Ken Rockwell

quotes.quote: Your equipment DOES NOT affect the quality of your image. The less time and effort you spend worrying about your equipment the more time and effort you can spend creating great images. The right equipment just makes it easier, faster or more convenient for you to get the results you need.
quotes.author: Ken Rockwell

quotes.quote: No matter how slow the film, Spirit always stands still long enough for the photographer It has chosen.
quotes.author: Minor White

quotes.quote: Photography, fortunately, to me has not only been a profession but also a contact between people - to understand human nature and record, if possible, the best in each individual.
quotes.author: Nickolas Muray

quotes.quote: Every portrait that is painted with feeling is a portrait of the artist, not of the sitter.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: They used to photograph Shirley Temple through gauze.  They should photograph me through linoleum.
quotes.author: Tallulah Bankhead

quotes.quote: All science is either physics or stamp collecting.
quotes.author: Ernest Rutherford

quotes.quote: In physics, your solution should convince a reasonable person. In math, you have to convince a person who's trying to make trouble. Ultimately, in physics, you're hoping to convince Nature. And I've found Nature to be pretty reasonable.
quotes.author: Frank Wilczek

quotes.quote: For the truth of the conclusions of physical science, observation is the supreme Court of Appeal. It does not follow that every item which we confidently accept as physical knowledge has actually been certified by the Court; our confidence is that it would be certified by the Court if it were submitted. But it does follow that every item of physical knowledge is of a form which might be submitted to the Court. It must be such that we can specify (although it may be impracticable to carry out) an observational procedure which would decide whether it is true or not. Clearly a statement cannot be tested by observation unless it is an assertion about the results of observation. Every item of physical knowledge must therefore be an assertion of what has been or would be the result of carrying out a specified observational procedure.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Eddington

quotes.quote: I ask you to look both ways. For the road to a knowledge of the stars leads through the atom; and important knowledge of the atom has been reached through the stars.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Eddington

quotes.quote: It is impossible to trap modern physics into predicting anything with perfect determinism because it deals with probabilities from the outset.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Eddington

quotes.quote: Not only is the universe stranger than we imagine, it is stranger than we can imagine.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Eddington

quotes.quote: Something unknown is doing we don't know what.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Eddington

quotes.quote: We have found a strange footprint on the shores of the unknown. We have devised profound theories, one after another, to account for its origins. At last, we have succeeded in reconstructing the creature that made the footprint. And lo! It is our own.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Eddington

quotes.quote: The secret to creativity is knowing how to hide your sources.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Don't worry about people stealing an idea. If it's original, you will have to ram it down their throats.
quotes.author: Howard Aiken

quotes.quote: I don't like composers who think. It gets in the way of their plagiarism.
quotes.author: Howard Dietz

quotes.quote: About the most originality that any writer can hope to achieve honestly is to steal with good judgment.
quotes.author: Josh Billings

quotes.quote: Art is either plagiarism or revolution.
quotes.author: Paul Gauguin

quotes.quote: Bite off more than you can chew, then chew it. Plan more than you can do, then do it.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: A goal without a plan is just a wish.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quotes.quote: Make no little plans; they have no magic to stir men's blood...Make big plans, aim high in hope and work.
quotes.author: Daniel H. Burnham

quotes.quote: In preparing for battle I have always found that plans are useless, but planning is indispensable.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: A good plan, violently executed now, is better than a perfect plan next week.
quotes.author: George S. Patton

quotes.quote: Zeus does not bring all men's plans to fulfillment.
quotes.author: Homer

quotes.quote: We must be willing to get rid of the life we've planned, so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.quote: Create a definite plan for carrying out your desire and begin at once, whether you are ready or not, to put this plan into action.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.quote: Plans are only good intentions unless they immediately degenerate into hard work.
quotes.author: Peter Drucker

quotes.quote: It is a bad plan that admits of no modification.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: Just because something doesn't do what you planned it to do doesn't mean it's useless.
quotes.author: Thomas A. Edison

quotes.quote: When we are planning for posterity, we ought to remember that virtue is not hereditary.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.quote: He who every morning plans the transaction of the day and follows out that plan, carries a thread that will guide him through the maze of the most busy life. But where no plan is laid, where the disposal of time is surrendered merely to the chance of incidence, chaos will soon reign.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.quote:
Most people ignore most poetry
because
most poetry ignores most people.
quotes.author: Adrian Mitchell

quotes.quote: It's easier to quote poets than to read them.
quotes.author: Allison Barrows

quotes.quote: There exist only three beings worthy of respect: the priest, the soldier, the poet. To know, to kill, to create.
quotes.author: Charles Baudelaire

quotes.quote: The freedom of poetic license.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: A poem is no place for an idea.
quotes.author: Edgar Watson Howe

quotes.quote: My poems are hymns of praise to the glory of life.
quotes.author: Edith Sitwell

quotes.quote: Poetry is the deification of reality.
quotes.author: Edith Sitwell

quotes.quote: All slang is a metaphor, and all metaphor is poetry.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: A poet more than thirty years old is simply an overgrown child.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: Many brave men lived before Agamemnon; but all are overwhelmed in eternal night, unwept, unknown, because they lack a sacred poet.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.quote: The worst tragedy for a poet is to be admired through being misunderstood.
quotes.author: Jean Cocteau

quotes.quote: One ought, every day at least, to hear a little song, read a good poem, see a fine picture, and if it were possible, to speak a few reasonable words.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: You don't have to suffer to be a poet; adolescence is enough suffering for anyone.
quotes.author: John Ciardi

quotes.quote: Poetry should please by a fine excess and not by singularity. It should strike the reader as a wording of his own highest thoughts, and appear almost as a remembrance.
quotes.author: John Keats

quotes.quote: Poetry often enters through the window of irrelevance.
quotes.author: M. C. Richards

quotes.quote: I was working on the proof of one of my poems all the morning, and took out a comma. In the afternoon I put it back again.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: In science one tries to tell people, in such a way as to be understood by everyone, something that no one ever knew before. But in poetry, it's the exact opposite.
quotes.author: Paul Dirac

quotes.quote: A poem is never finished, only abandoned.
quotes.author: Paul Valery

quotes.quote: Every English poet should master the rules of grammar before he attempts to bend or break them.
quotes.author: Robert Graves

quotes.quote: A poet who reads his verse in public may have other nasty habits.
quotes.author: Robert Heinlein

quotes.quote: A prose writer gets tired of writing prose, and wants to be a poet. So he begins every line with a capital letter, and keeps on writing prose.
quotes.author: Samuel McChord Crothers

quotes.quote: A poet ought not to pick nature's pocket. Let him borrow, and so borrow as to repay by the very act of borrowing. Examine nature accurately, but write from recollection, and trust more to the imagination than the memory.
quotes.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quotes.quote:
A poet's hope: to be,
like some valley cheese,
local, but prized elsewhere.
quotes.author: W. H. Auden

quotes.quote: The poet judges not as a judge judges but as the sun falling around a helpless thing.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.quote: A garden, you know, is a very usual refuge of a disappointed politician. Accordingly, I have purchased a few acres about nine miles from town, have built a house, and am cultivating a garden.
quotes.author: Alexander Hamilton

quotes.quote: Under every stone lurks a politician.
quotes.author: Aristophanes

quotes.quote: You have all the characteristics of a popular politician: a horrible voice, bad breeding, and a vulgar manner.
quotes.author: Aristophanes

quotes.quote: Now I know what a statesman is; he's a dead politician. We need more statesmen.
quotes.author: Bob Edwards

quotes.quote: I have come to the conclusion that politics are too serious a matter to be left to the politicians.
quotes.author: Charles De Gaulle

quotes.quote: Since a politician never believes what he says, he is quite surprised to be taken at his word.
quotes.author: Charles De Gaulle

quotes.quote: Government is too big and too important to be left to the politicians.
quotes.author: Chester Bowles

quotes.quote: Anyone who is capable of getting themselves made President should on no account be allowed to do the job.
quotes.author: Douglas Adams

quotes.quote: Get all the fools on your side and you can be elected to anything.
quotes.author: Frank Dane

quotes.quote: Ninety percent of the politicians give the other ten percent a bad reputation.
quotes.author: Henry Kissinger

quotes.quote: If I wanted to go crazy I would do it in Washington because it would not be noticed.
quotes.author: Jay Leno

quotes.quote: If God had wanted us to vote, he would have given us candidates.
quotes.author: Maureen Murphy

quotes.quote: The reason there are so few female politicians is that it is too much trouble to put makeup on two faces.
quotes.author: Nikita Khrushchev

quotes.quote: Politicians are the same all over. They promise to build a bridge even where there is no river.
quotes.author: Oscar Levant

quotes.quote: I once said cynically of a politician, 'He'll doublecross that bridge when he comes to it.'
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: The two parties which divide the state, the party of Conservatism and that of Innovation, are very old, and have disputed the possession of the world ever since it was made.
quotes.author: Richard M. Nixon

quotes.quote: He has been called a mediocre man; but this is unwarranted flattery. He was a politician of monumental littleness.
quotes.author: Richard M. Nixon

quotes.quote: There is no such thing as a nonpolitical speech by a politician.
quotes.author: Simon Cameron

quotes.quote: An honest politician is one who, when he is bought, will stay bought.
quotes.author: Whoopi Goldberg

quotes.quote: You've got to vote for someone. It's a shame, but it's got to be done.
It is the duty of every citizen according to his best capacities to give validity to his convictions in political affairs.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: There is hardly a political question in the United States which doesn't sooner or later turn into a judicial one.
quotes.author: Alexis De Tocqueville

quotes.quote: Crime does not pay ... as well as politics.
quotes.author: Alfred E. Newman

quotes.quote: Politics, n. Strife of interests masquerading as a contest of principles.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: Man is by nature a political animal.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: I have come to the conclusion that politics are too serious a matter to be left to the politicians.
quotes.author: Charles De Gaulle

quotes.quote: Politics is made up largely of irrelevancies.
quotes.author: Dalton Camp

quotes.quote: Politics ought to be the part-time profession of every citizen who would protect the rights and privileges of free people and who would preserve what is good and fruitful in our national heritage.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it whether it exists or not, diagnosing it incorrectly, and applying the wrong remedy.
quotes.author: Ernest Benn

quotes.quote: Being in politics is like being a football coach. You have to be smart enough to understand the game, and dumb enough to think it's important.
quotes.author: Eugene McCarthy

quotes.quote: When the political columnists say 'Every thinking man' they mean themselves, and when candidates appeal to 'Every intelligent voter' they mean everybody who is going to vote for them.
quotes.author: Franklin P. Adams

quotes.quote: The whole aim of practical politics is to keep the populace alarmed (and hence clamorous to be led to safety) by menacing it with an endless series of hobgoblins, all of them imaginary.
quotes.author: Henry Adams

quotes.quote: Practical politics consists in ignoring facts.
quotes.author: Henry Cate VII

quotes.quote: The problem with political jokes is they get elected.
quotes.author: Jimmy Wales

quotes.quote: Most people assume the fights are going to be the left versus the right, but it always is the reasonable versus the jerks.
quotes.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quotes.quote: Nothing is so admirable in politics as a short memory.
quotes.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quotes.quote: Politics is not the art of the possible. It consists in choosing between the disastrous and the unpalatable.
quotes.author: Larry Hardiman

quotes.quote: The word 'politics' is derived from the word 'poly', meaning 'many', and the word 'ticks', meaning 'blood sucking parasites'.
quotes.author: Lester B. Pearson

quotes.quote: Politics is the skilled use of blunt objects.
quotes.author: Mao Tse-Tung

quotes.quote: Politics is war without bloodshed while war is politics with bloodshed.
quotes.author: Margaret Cho

quotes.quote: Politics has less to do with where you live than where your heart is.
quotes.author: Mark B. Cohen

quotes.quote: Nothing can so alienate a voter from the political system as backing a winning candidate.
quotes.author: Otto Von Bismarck

quotes.quote: Politics is the art of the possible.
quotes.author: Paul Valery

quotes.quote: Politics is the art of preventing people from taking part in affairs which properly concern them.
quotes.author: R. A. Butler

quotes.quote: Before we get too depressed about the state of our politics, let's remember our history. The great debates of the past, all stirred great passions. They all made somebody angry, and at least once led to a terrible war. What is amazing, is that despite all the conflict, our experiment in democracy has worked better than any form of government on earth.
quotes.author: R. A. Butler

quotes.quote: If we choose only to expose ourselves to opinions and viewpoints that are in line to our own, we become more polarized, more set in our own ways. It will only reinforce and deepen the political divides in our country. But if we choose to actively seek out information that challenges our assumptions and beliefs, perhaps we can begin to understand where the people who disagree with us are coming from.
quotes.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quotes.quote: Politics has never been for the thin-skinned or the faint of heart, and if you enter the arena , you should expect to get roughed up. Moreover, Democracy in a nation of more than 300 million people is inherently difficult.
In politics you must always keep running with the pack. The moment that you falter and they sense that you are injured, the rest will turn on you like wolves.
Politics is largely a matter of heart.
The whole art of politics consists in directing rationally the irrationalities of men.
Most things worth having require some sacrifice, usually more than you expect.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.quote: We too often let the material things serve as indicators that we're doing well, even though something inside us tells us that were not doing our best. That we are avoiding that which is hard, but also necessary. That we are shrinking from rather than vising to the challenges of the age.
quotes.author: Bias

quotes.quote: The wise man carries his possessions within him.
quotes.author: Colleen Wainwright

quotes.quote: I love stuff as much as the next guy, but I�ve come to understand that, regardless of the cost of acquiring it, the price of having it is freedom.
quotes.author: Colley Cibber

quotes.quote: Possession is eleven points in the law.
quotes.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: I take care of my things. After all, those of us as has few things to begin with must take care, lest we have fewer.
quotes.author: John Ruskin

quotes.quote: Before we set our hearts too much upon anything, let us examine how happy those are who already possess it.
quotes.author: Lao-tzu

quotes.quote: Every increased possession loads us with new weariness.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.quote:
To have little is to possess.
To have plenty is to be perplexed.
quotes.author: Pliny the Younger

quotes.quote: Desire makes everything blossom; possession makes everything wither and fade.
quotes.author: Terence

quotes.quote: An object in possession seldom retains the same charm that it had in pursuit.
quotes.author: Vida D. Scudder

quotes.quote: I have everything, yet have nothing; and although I possess nothing, still of nothing am I in want.
It is through creating, not possessing, that life is revealed.
Poverty is the schoolmaster of character.
quotes.author: Antiphanes

quotes.quote: Poverty is the parent of revolution and crime.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Where justice is denied, where poverty is enforced, where ignorance prevails, and where any one class is made to feel that society is in an organized conspiracy to oppress, rob, and degrade them, neither persons nor property will be safe.
quotes.author: Frederick Douglass

quotes.quote: You are going to let the fear of poverty govern your life and your reward will be that you will eat, but you will not live.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: It is not the rich man you should properly call happy, but him who knows how to use with wisdom the blessings of the gods, to endure hard poverty, and who fears dishonor worse than death, and is not afraid to die for cherished friends or fatherland.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.quote: Climbing out of poverty by your own efforts that is something on which to pride yourself, but poverty itself is romanticized only by fools.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: It is not an ennobling experience. Poverty entails fear and stress and sometimes depression. It means a thousand petty humiliations and hardships.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: It is not easy for men to rise whose qualities are thwarted by poverty.
quotes.author: Juvenal

quotes.quote: It is pretty hard to tell what does bring happiness; poverty and wealth have both failed.
quotes.author: Kin Hubbard

quotes.quote: Wealth is the parent of luxury and indolence, and poverty of meanness and viciousness, and both of discontent.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: Far better to think historically, to remember the lessons of the past. Thus, far better to conceive of power as consisting in part of the knowledge of when not to use all the power you have. Far better to be one who knows that if you reserve the power not to use all your power, you will lead others far more successfully and well.
quotes.author: A. Bartlett Giamatti

quotes.quote: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: You see what power is - holding someone else's fear in your hand and showing it to them!
quotes.author: Amy Tan

quotes.quote: The sole advantage of power is that you can do more good.
quotes.author: Baltasar Gracian

quotes.quote: To know the pains of power, we must go to those who have it; to know its pleasures, we must go to those who are seeking it.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.quote: It is said that power corrupts, but actually it's more true that power attracts the corruptible. The sane are usually attracted by other things than power.
quotes.author: David Brin

quotes.quote: Let not thy will roar, when thy power can but whisper.
quotes.author: Dr. Thomas Fuller

quotes.quote: Ultimately, the only power to which man should aspire is that which he exercises over himself.
quotes.author: Elie Wiesel

quotes.quote: It is when power is wedded to chronic fear that it becomes formidable.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: There are similarities between absolute power and absolute faith: a demand for absolute obedience, a readiness to attempt the impossible, a bias for simple solutionsto cut the knot rather than unravel it, the viewing of compromise as surrender. Both absolute power and absolute faith are instruments of dehumanization. Hence, absolute faith corrupts as absolutely as absolute power.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: If absolute power corrupts absolutely, does absolute powerlessness make you pure?
quotes.author: Harry Shearer

quotes.quote: The great secret of power is never to will to do more than you can accomplish.
quotes.author: Henrik Ibsen

quotes.quote: Be fit for more than the thing you are now doing. Let everyone know that you have a reserve in yourself; that you have more power than you are now using. If you are not too large for the place you occupy, you are too small for it.
quotes.author: James A. Garfield

quotes.quote: The essence of government is power; and power, lodged as it must be in human hands, will ever be liable to abuse.
quotes.author: James Madison

quotes.quote: The essence of Government is power; and power, lodged as it must be in human hands, will ever be liable to abuse.
quotes.author: James Madison

quotes.quote: Power corrupts. Absolute power is kind of neat.
quotes.author: John Lehman

quotes.quote: One person with a belief is equal to a force of 99 who have only interests.
quotes.author: John Stuart Mill

quotes.quote: The secret of all power is - save your force. If you want high pressure you must choke off waste.
quotes.author: Joseph Farrell

quotes.quote: If power was an illusion, wasn't weakness necessarily one also?
quotes.author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quotes.quote: Power tends to corrupt, and absolute power corrupts absolutely.
quotes.author: Lord Acton

quotes.quote: The highest proof of virtue is to possess boundless power without abusing it.
quotes.author: Lord Macaulay

quotes.quote: Power never takes a back step - only in the face of more power.
quotes.author: Malcolm X

quotes.quote: The problem of power is how to achieve its responsible use rather than its irresponsible and indulgent use - of how to get men of power to live for the public rather than off the public.
quotes.author: Robert F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: Most powerful is he who has himself in his own power.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Knowledge is power.
quotes.author: Sir Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: We thought, because we had power, we had wisdom.
quotes.author: Stephen Vincent Benet

quotes.quote: We have, I fear, confused power with greatness.
quotes.author: Stewart L. Udall

quotes.quote: An honest man can feel no pleasure in the exercise of power over his fellow citizens.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Be thou the first true merit to befriend, his praise is lost who stays till all commend.
quotes.author: Alexander Pope

quotes.quote: There are two modes of establishing our reputation: to be praised by honest men, and to be abused by rogues. It is best, however, to secure the former, because it will invariably be accompanied by the latter.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.quote: Such praise coming from so degraded a source, was degrading to me, its recipient.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: He who praises you for what you lack wishes to take from you what you have.
quotes.author: Don Juan Manuel

quotes.quote: It is a sign of a creeping inner death when we no longer can praise the living.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: The meanest, most contemptible kind of praise is that which first speaks well of a man, and then qualifies it with a "but".
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.quote: Praise the young and they will flourish.
quotes.author: Irish Proverb

quotes.quote: The praise that comes from love does not make us vain, but more humble.
quotes.author: James M. Barrie

quotes.quote: You do ill if you praise, but worse if you censure, what you do not understand.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.quote: We are always more anxious to be distinguished for a talent which we do not possess, than to be praised for the fifteen which we do possess.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Don't discuss yourself, for you are bound to lose; if you belittle yourself, you are believed; if you praise yourself, you are disbelieved.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.quote: Praise, like gold and diamonds, owes its value only to its scarcity.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: Be not too hasty either with praise or blame; speak always as though you were giving evidence before the judgement-seat of the Gods.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: You can tell the character of every man when you see how he receives praise.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Praise from the common people is generally false, and rather follows the vain than the virtuous.
quotes.author: Sir Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Real joy comes not from ease or riches or from the praise of men, but from doing something worthwhile.
quotes.author: Sir Wilfred Grenfell

quotes.quote: If a man is proud of his wealth, he should not be praised until it is known how he employs it.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Think not those faithful who praise all thy words and actions; but those who kindly reprove thy faults.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Their silence is sufficient praise.
quotes.author: Terence

quotes.quote: I do not confer praise or blame: I accept. I am the measure of all things. I am the centre of the world.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: People ask for criticism, but they only want praise.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: I pay no attention whatever to anybody's praise or blame. I simply follow my own feelings.
quotes.author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

quotes.quote: You must pray that the way be long, full of adventures and experiences.
quotes.author: Constantine Peter Cavafy

quotes.quote: Pray as if everything depended upon God and work as if everything depended upon man.
quotes.author: Francis Cardinal Spellman

quotes.quote: One single grateful thought raised to heaven is the most perfect prayer.
quotes.author: G. E. Lessing

quotes.quote: Prayer indeed is good, but while calling on the gods a man should himself lend a hand.
quotes.author: Hippocrates

quotes.quote: The time to pray is not when we are in a tight spot but just as soon as we get out of it.
quotes.author: Josh Billings

quotes.quote: You should pray for a sound mind in a sound body.
quotes.author: Juvenal

quotes.quote: If the only prayer you ever say in your whole life is "thank you," that would suffice.
quotes.author: Meister Eckhart

quotes.quote: When the gods wish to punish us, they answer our prayers.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Do not pray for easy lives. Pray to be stronger men. Do not pray for tasks equal to your powers. Pray for powers equal to your tasks. Then the doing of your work shall be no miracle, but you shall be the miracle.
quotes.author: Phillips Brooks

quotes.quote: You can pray for someone even if you don't think God exists.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote: There are more tears shed over answered prayers than over unanswered prayers.
quotes.author: Saint Theresa of Jesus

quotes.quote: I have never made but one prayer to God, a very short one: 'O Lord, make my enemies ridiculous.' And God granted it.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age eighteen.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The greatest friend of Truth is time, her greatest enemy is Prejudice, and her constant companion Humility.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.quote: Everyone is a prisoner of his own experiences. No one can eliminate prejudices - just recognize them.
quotes.author: Edward R. Murrow

quotes.quote: Opinions founded on prejudice are always sustained with the greatest of violence.
quotes.author: Francis Jeffrey

quotes.quote: If we were to wake up some morning and find that everyone was the same race, creed and color, we would find some other cause for prejudice by noon.
quotes.author: George Aiken

quotes.quote: Criticism is prejudice made plausible.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: It is never too late to give up our prejudices.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote:
When the judgement's weak,
The prejudice is strong.
quotes.author: Kane O'Hara

quotes.quote: Education is a method whereby one acquires a higher grade of prejudices.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.quote: Nobody outside of a baby carriage or a judge's chamber believes in an unprejudiced point of view.
quotes.author: Lillian Hellman

quotes.quote: There are, in every age, new errors to be rectified and new prejudices to be opposed.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: Never try to reason the prejudice out of a man. It was not reasoned into him, and cannot be reasoned out.
quotes.author: Sydney Smith

quotes.quote: When faced with sexism or ageism or lookism or even really aggressive Buddhism, ask yourself the following question:"Is this person in between me and what do I want to do?" If the answer is no, ignore it and move on. Your energy is better used doing your work and outpacing people that way. Then, when you're in charge, don't hire the people who were jerky to you.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: Prejudice is opinion without judgement.
quotes.author: W. C. Fields

quotes.quote: I am free of all prejudice. I hate everyone equally.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.quote: Without the aid of prejudice and custom I should not be able to find my way across the room.
quotes.author: William James

quotes.quote: A great many people think they are thinking when they are really rearranging their prejudices.
To know a man, observe how he wins his object, rather than how he loses it; for when we fail our pride supports us; when we succeed, it betrays us.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.quote: Pride sullies the noblest character.
quotes.author: Claudianus

quotes.quote: When dealing with people, let us remember we are not dealing with creatures of logic. We are dealing with creatures of emotion, creatures bustling with prejudices and motivated by pride and vanity.
quotes.author: Dale Carnegie

quotes.quote: The pride of youth is in strength and beauty, the pride of old age is in discretion.
quotes.author: Democritus

quotes.quote: Be modest! It is the kind of pride least likely to offend.
quotes.author: Jules Renard

quotes.quote: Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: To find yourself jilted is a blow to your pride. Do your best to forget it and if you don't succeed, at least pretend to.
quotes.author: Moliere

quotes.quote: Pride is a powerful narcotic, but it doesn't do much for the auto-immune system.
quotes.author: Stuart Stevens

quotes.quote: The charity that hastens to proclaim its good deeds, ceases to be charity, and is only pride and ostentation.
quotes.author: William Hutton

quotes.quote: The path to our destination is not always a straight one. We go down the wrong road, we get lost, we turn back. Maybe it doesn't matter which road we embark on. Maybe what matters is that we embark.
quotes.author: Barbara Hall

quotes.quote: The chief obstacle to the progress of the human race is the human race.
quotes.author: Don Marquis

quotes.quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world; the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world; the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore, all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: What we call 'Progress' is the exchange of one nuisance for another nuisance.
quotes.author: Havelock Ellis

quotes.quote: The advancement of the arts from year to year taxes our credulity, and seems to presage the arrival of that period when human improvement must end.
quotes.author: Ogden Nash

quotes.quote: Progress might have been all right once, but it has gone on too long.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: I was to learn later that in life that we tend to meet any new situation by reorganizing; and what a wonderful method it can be for creating the illusion of progress while producing confusion, inefficiency, and demoralization.
quotes.author: Russell Baker

quotes.quote: Never discourage anyone...who continually makes progress, no matter how slow.
quotes.author: Samuel Butler

quotes.quote: Usually, terrible things that are done with the excuse that progress requires them are not really progress at all, but just terrible things.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: All progress is based upon a universal innate desire on the part of every organism to live beyond its income.

Every day you may make progress. Every step may be fruitful. Yet there will stretch out before you an ever-lengthening, ever-ascending, ever-improving path. You know you will never get to the end of the journey. But this, so far from discouraging, only adds to the joy and glory of the climb.
Progress is the product of human agency. Things get better because we make them better. Things go wrong when we get too comfortable, when we fail to take risks or seize opportunities.

No wonder Americans hate politics when, year in and year out, they hear politicians make promises that won't come true because they don't even mean them - campaign fantasies that win elections but don't get nations moving again.
quotes.author: Bill Clinton

quotes.quote: Hypocrisy can afford to be magnificent in its promises; for never intending to go beyond promises; it costs nothing.
quotes.author: Edmund Burke

quotes.quote: Promises that you make to yourself are often like the Japanese plum tree - they bear no fruit.
quotes.author: Francis Marion

quotes.quote: One must have a good memory to be able to keep the promises one makes.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: He that promises most will perform least.
quotes.author: Gaelic Proverb

quotes.quote: He who promises more than he is able to perform, is false to himself; and he who does not perform what he has promised, is a traitor to his friend.
quotes.author: George Shelley

quotes.quote: You can make those promises with just as much passion the second time around. Such is the regenerative power of the human heart.
quotes.author: Marion Wink

quotes.quote: When life seems chaotic, you don't need people giving you easy answers or cheap promises. There might not be any answers to your problems. What you need is a safe place where you can bounce with people who have taken some bad hops of their own.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote:
The woods are lovely, dark, and deep,
But I have promises to keep,
And miles to go before I sleep,
And miles to go before I sleep.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.quote: Magnificent promises are always to be suspected.
quotes.author: Theodore Parker

quotes.quote: If you refuse to be made straight when you are green, you will not be made straight when you are dry.
quotes.author: African Proverb

quotes.quote: When you have given nothing, ask for nothing.
quotes.author: Albanian Proverb

quotes.quote: Good habits result from resisting temptation.
quotes.author: Ancient Proverb

quotes.quote: Dwell not upon thy weariness, thy strength shall be according to the measure of thy desire.
quotes.author: Arab Proverb

quotes.quote: Examine what is said, not him who speaks.
quotes.author: Arab Proverb

quotes.quote: Make your bargain before beginning to plow.
quotes.author: Arab Proverb

quotes.quote: Don't make use of another's mouth unless it has been lent to you.
quotes.author: Belgian Proverb

quotes.quote: Seize opportunity by the beard, for it is bald behind.
quotes.author: Bulgarian Proverb

quotes.quote: Be not afraid of growing slowly, be afraid only of standing still.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: Do not employ handsome servants.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: Do not remove a fly from your friend's forehead with a hatchet.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: He who asks is a fool for five minutes, but he who does not ask remains a fool forever.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: If you bow at all, bow low.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: Keep your broken arm inside your sleeve.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: Raise your sail one foot and you get ten feet of wind.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: The gem cannot be polished without friction, nor man perfected without trials.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: The palest ink is better than the best memory.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: To know the road ahead, ask those coming back.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: When you drink the water, remember the spring.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: When you have only two pennies left in the world, buy a loaf of bread with one, and a lily with the other.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: Do not protect yourself by a fence, but rather by your friends.
quotes.author: Czech Proverb

quotes.quote: The big thieves hang the little ones.
quotes.author: Czech Proverb

quotes.quote: When you go to buy, use your eyes, not your ears.
quotes.author: Czech Proverb

quotes.quote: Ask advice only of your equals.
quotes.author: Danish Proverb

quotes.quote: He who would leap high must take a long run.
quotes.author: Danish Proverb

quotes.quote: A handful of patience is worth more than a bushel of brains.
quotes.author: Dutch Proverb

quotes.quote: A full cup must be carried steadily.
quotes.author: English Proverb

quotes.quote: Don't fall before you're pushed.
quotes.author: English Proverb

quotes.quote: Use soft words and hard arguments.
quotes.author: English Proverb

quotes.quote: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing. One cannot help but be in awe when he contemplates the mysteries of eternity, of life, of the marvelous structure of reality. It is enough if one tries merely to comprehend a little of this mystery every day. Never lose a holy curiosity.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: In all affairs it's a healthy thing now and then to hang a question mark on the things you have long taken for granted.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Look at all the sentences which seem true and question them.
quotes.author: David Reisman

quotes.quote: A thinker sees his own actions as experiments and questions--as attempts to find out something. Success and failure are for him answers above all.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: One's first step in wisdom is to question everything - and one's last is to come to terms with everything.
quotes.author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quotes.quote: A young man is embarrassed to question an older one.
quotes.author: Homer

quotes.quote: It is better to know some of the questions than all of the answers.
quotes.author: James Thurber

quotes.quote: If you ask too many questions, you will find no answers, only more questions.
quotes.author: Omaha Proverb

quotes.quote: Ask questions from your heart and you will be answered from the heart.
quotes.author: Protagoras

quotes.quote: You can question somebody's views and their judgment without questioning their motives or patriotism.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: There are two sides to every question.
quotes.author: Solomon Ibn Gabirol

quotes.quote: It is not every question that deserves an answer.
quotes.author: Stephen Jay Gould

quotes.quote: A wise man's question contains half the answer.
quotes.author: Terence

quotes.quote: The most erroneous stories are those we think we know best - and therefore never scrutinize or question.
quotes.author: Thorstein Veblen

quotes.quote:
So many men so many questions.
(Quot Homines Tot Sententiae)
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: The outcome of any serious research can only be to make two questions grow where only one grew before.
Judge of a man by his questions rather than by his answers.
Everything of importance has been said before by somebody who did not discover it.
quotes.author: Alfred North Whitehead

quotes.quote: I have suffered a great deal from writers who have quoted this or that sentence of mine either out of its context or in juxtaposition to some incongruous matter which quite distorted my meaning , or destroyed it altogether.
quotes.author: Alfred North Whitehead

quotes.quote: The point of quotations is that one can use another's words to be insulting.
quotes.author: Amanda Cross

quotes.quote: Quotation, n: The act of repeating erroneously the words of another.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: One must be a wise reader to quote wisely and well.
quotes.author: Amos Bronson Alcott

quotes.quote: When a thing has been said and well, have no scruple. Take it and copy it.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.quote: Be careful -- with quotations, you can damn anything.
quotes.author: Andre Malraux

quotes.quote: Write a wise saying and your name will live forever.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: It is unbecoming for young men to utter maxims.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: The wisdom of the wise, and the experience of ages, may be preserved by quotation.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: A quotation in a speech, article or book is like a rifle in the hands of an infantryman. It speaks with authority.
quotes.author: Brendan Francis

quotes.quote: To be amused by what you read--that is the great spring of happy quotations.
quotes.author: C. E. Montague

quotes.quote: I never have found the perfect quote. At best I have been able to find a string of quotations which merely circle the ineffable idea I seek to express.
quotes.author: Caldwell O'Keefe

quotes.quote: I improve on misquotation.
quotes.author: Cary Grant

quotes.quote: The American people would not want to know of any misquotes that Dan Quayle may or may not make.
quotes.author: Dan Quayle

quotes.quote: People will accept your ideas much more readily if you tell them Benjamin Franklin said it first.
quotes.author: David H. Comins

quotes.quote: What's the use of a good quotation if you can't change it?
quotes.author: Doctor Who

quotes.quote: A facility for quotation covers the absence of original thought.
quotes.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quotes.quote: I might repeat to myself slowly and soothingly, a list of quotations beautiful from minds profound - if I can remember any of the damn things.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.quote:
Some for renown, on scraps of learning dote,
And think they grow immortal as they quote.
quotes.author: Edward Young

quotes.quote: An epigram often flashes light into regions where reason shines but dimly.
quotes.author: Edwin P. Whipple

quotes.quote: If you have any doubts that we live in a society controlled by men, try reading down the index of contributors to a volume of quotations, looking for women's names.
quotes.author: Elaine Gill

quotes.quote: I often quote myself. It adds spice to my conversation.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: After all, all he did was string together a lot of old, well-known quotations.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: Misquotation is, in fact, the pride and privilege of the learned. A widely- read man never quotes accurately, for the rather obvious reason that he has read too widely.
quotes.author: Hesketh Pearson

quotes.quote: Misquotations are the only quotations that are never misquoted.
quotes.author: Hesketh Pearson

quotes.quote: Life itself is a quotation.
quotes.author: Jorge Luis Borges

quotes.quote: A fine quotation is a diamond on the finger of a man of wit, and a pebble in the hand of a fool.
quotes.author: Joseph Roux

quotes.quote: What a good thing Adam had. When he said a good thing he knew nobody had said it before.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: I love quotations because it is a joy to find thoughts one might have, beautifully expressed with much authority by someone recognized wiser than oneself.
quotes.author: Marlene Dietrich

quotes.quote: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Everything is a dangerous drug except reality, which is unendurable.
quotes.author: Cyril Connolly

quotes.quote: You bluffed me! I don't like it when people bluff me. It makes me question my perception of reality.
quotes.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider
