quotes.quote: Set up as an ideal the facing of reality as honestly and as cheerfully as possible.
quotes.author: Dr. Karl Menninger

quotes.quote:
Joel: That's the movies, Ed. Try reality.
Ed: No thanks.
quotes.author: Ellen Herman

quotes.quote: I believe in looking reality straight in the eye and denying it.
quotes.author: Garrison Keillor

quotes.quote: The real distinction is between those who adapt their purposes to reality and those who seek to mold reality in the light of their purposes.
quotes.author: Henry Kissinger

quotes.quote: Realism...has no more to do with reality than anything else.
quotes.author: Hob Broun

quotes.quote: Reality is nothing but a collective hunch.
quotes.author: Jane Wagner

quotes.quote: Reality is the leading cause of stress amongst those in touch with it.
quotes.author: Jane Wagner

quotes.quote: Important days don't look like anything special when they start. Invariably, the sun rises and people wake up. Coffee is swilled and eggs are swallowed. Everybody goes about the business of acting like their lives matter and then, no matter how important the events of the day end up being, the sun invariably sets. The sun rose before the soldiers stormed Omaha Beach on D-Day, and the sun set after Archduke Franz Ferdinand was killed. Sunrises and sunsets are real jerks about putting things in perspective.
quotes.author: Jules de Gaultier

quotes.quote: Imagination is the one weapon in the war against reality.
quotes.author: Lily Tomlin

quotes.quote: Reality is a crutch for people who can't cope with drugs.
quotes.author: Liza Minnelli

quotes.quote: Reality is something you rise above.
quotes.author: Mary Chase

quotes.quote: I've wrestled with reality for 35 years, Doctor, and I'm happy to state I finally won out over it.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.quote: Everything you can imagine is real.
quotes.author: Philip K. Dick

quotes.quote: Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away.
quotes.author: T. S. Eliot

quotes.quote: Humankind cannot stand very much reality.
A man always has two reasons for what he does-a good one and the real one.
quotes.author: Karl Marx

quotes.quote: Reason has always existed, but not always in a reasonable form.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Do not banish reason for inequality; but let your reason serve to make the truth appear where it seems hid, and hide the false seems true.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Every why hath a wherefore.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: His reasons are as two grains of wheat his in two bushels of chaff: you shall seek all day ere you find them, and when you have them, they are not worth the search.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Many that are not mad have, sure, more lack of reason.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Strong reasons make strong actions.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Sure, he that made us with such large discourse, looking before and after, gave us not that capability and god-like reason to fust in us unus'd.
Man is so made that he can only find relaxation from one kind of labor by taking up another.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.quote: To be able to fill leisure intelligently is the last product of civilization, and at present very few people have reached this level.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: This art of resting the mind and the power of dismissing from it all care and worry is probably one of the secrets of energy in our great men.
quotes.author: Captain J. A. Hadfield

quotes.quote: Acquire inner peace and a multitude will find their salvation near you.
quotes.author: Catherine de Hueck Doherty

quotes.quote: Nothing is permanent in this wicked world - not even our troubles.
quotes.author: Charlie Chaplin

quotes.quote: Sometimes the cure for restlessness is rest.
quotes.author: Colleen Wainwright

quotes.quote: Put duties aside at least an hour before bed and perform soothing, quiet activities that will help you relax.
quotes.author: Dianne Hales

quotes.quote: No matter how much pressure you feel at work, if you could find ways to relax for at least five minutes every hour, you'd be more productive.
quotes.author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quotes.quote: There is no need to go to India or anywhere else to find peace. You will find that deep place of silence right in your room, your garden or even your bathtub.
quotes.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quotes.quote: We have to fight them daily, like fleas, those many small worries about the morrow, for they sap our energies.
quotes.author: Etty Hillesum

quotes.quote: Light be the earth upon you, lightly rest.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: When we are unable to find tranquility within ourselves, it is useless to seek it elsewhere.
quotes.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: During [these] periods of relaxation after concentrated intellectual activity, the intuitive mind seems to take over and can produce the sudden clarifying insights which give so much joy and delight.
quotes.author: Fritjof Capra

quotes.quote: What's the use of worrying? It never was worthwhile.
quotes.author: George Asaf

quotes.quote: He enjoys true leisure who has time to improve his soul's estate.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: If a man insisted always on being serious, and never allowed himself a bit of fun and relaxation, he would go mad or become unstable without knowing it.
quotes.author: Herodotus

quotes.quote: We spend most of our time and energy in a kind of horizontal thinking. We move along the surface of things [but] there are times when we stop. We sit still. We lose ourselves in a pile of leaves or its memory. We listen and breezes from a whole other world begin to whisper.
quotes.author: James Carroll

quotes.quote: To sit in the shade on a fine day, and look upon verdure is the most perfect refreshment.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: Never lose sight of this important truth, that no one can be truly great until he has gained a knowledge of himself, a knowledge which can only be acquired by occasional retirement.
quotes.author: Johann Georg von Zimmermann

quotes.quote: I take it that what all men are really after is some form or perhaps only some formula of peace.
quotes.author: Joseph Conrad

quotes.quote: If you can attain repose and calm, believe that you have seized happiness.
quotes.author: Julie-Jeanne-Eleonore de Lespinasse

quotes.quote: Besides the noble art of getting things done, there is a nobler art of leaving things undone. The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of nonessentials.
quotes.author: Lin Yutang

quotes.quote: Stress is an ignorant state. It believes that everything is an emergency. Nothing is that important.
quotes.author: Natalie Goldberg

quotes.quote: Before you agree to do anything that might add even the smallest amount of stress to your life, ask yourself: What is my truest intention? Give yourself time to let a yes resound within you. When it's right, I guarantee that your entire body will feel it.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: Take rest; a field that has rested gives a bountiful crop.
quotes.author: Ovid

quotes.quote: Learning to ignore things is one of the great paths to inner peace.
quotes.author: Robert J. Sawyer

quotes.quote: Working in the garden...gives me a profound feeling of inner peace.
quotes.author: Ruth Stout

quotes.quote: Sometimes I sits and thinks, and sometimes I just sits.
quotes.author: Satchel Paige

quotes.quote: The time to relax is when you don't have time for it.
quotes.author: Sydney J. Harris

quotes.quote: When I do good, I feel good; when I do bad, I feel bad, and that is my religion.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: My religion consists of a humble admiration of the illimitable superior spirit who reveals himself in the slight details we are able to perceive with our frail and feeble mind.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: I won't take my religion from any man who never works except with his mouth.
quotes.author: Carl Sandburg

quotes.quote: I am determined that my children shall be brought up in their father's religion, if they can find out what it is.
quotes.author: Charles Lamb

quotes.quote: It is a fine thing to establish one's own religion in one's heart, not to be dependent on tradition and second-hand ideals. Life will seem to you, later, not a lesser, but a greater thing.
quotes.author: D. H. Lawrence

quotes.quote: Rational arguments don't usually work on religious people. Otherwise, there wouldn't be religious people.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: Clergymen have much the same in their breeches as other men.
quotes.author: Flavius Josephus

quotes.quote: The opposite of the religious fanatic is not the fanatical atheist but the gentle cynic who cares not whether there is a god or not.
quotes.author: George Burns

quotes.quote: Everyone ought to worship God according to his own inclinations, and not to be constrained by force.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: The secret of a good sermon is to have a good beginning and a good ending, then having the two as close together as possible.
quotes.author: Ian McKellen

quotes.quote: For centuries, theologians have been explaining the unknowable in terms of the-not-worth-knowing.
quotes.author: James Feibleman

quotes.quote: I've often thought the Bible should have a disclaimer in the front saying this is fiction.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: A myth is a religion in which no one any longer believes.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: Everybody likes to go their own way--to choose their own time and manner of devotion.
quotes.author: Lucretius

quotes.quote: It will, I believe, be everywhere found, that as the clergy are, or are not what they ought to be, so are the rest of the nation.
quotes.author: Matthew Arnold

quotes.quote: Such evil deeds could religion prompt.
quotes.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi

quotes.quote: The true meaning of religion is thus not simply morality, but morality touched by emotion.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Those who seek consolation in existing churches often pay for their peace of mind with a tacit agreement to ignore a great deal of what is known about the way the world works.
quotes.author: Randy K. Milholland

quotes.quote: The true mystery of the world is the visible, not the invisible.
quotes.author: Randy K. Milholland

quotes.quote: Never confuse the faith with the supposedly faithful.
quotes.author: Sir Richard Francis Burton

quotes.quote: The only time anyone's admitted they were a Christian before was when they were busy telling me why they're better than me.
quotes.author: Sophy Burnham

quotes.quote: The more I study religions the more I am convinced that man never worshipped anything but himself.
quotes.author: Stella Terrill Mann

quotes.quote: To believe in God or in a guiding force because someone tells you to is the height of stupidity. We are given senses to receive our information within. With our own eyes we see, and with our own skin we feel. With our intelligence, it is intended that we understand. But each person must puzzle it out for himself or herself.
quotes.author: Steven Weinberg

quotes.quote: Whatever God's dream about man may be, it seems certain it cannot come true unless man cooperates.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: With or without religion, you would have good people doing good things and evil people doing evil things. But for good people to do evil things, that takes religion.
quotes.author: Tom Wolfe

quotes.quote: Say nothing of my religion. It is known to God and myself alone. Its evidence before the world is to be sought in my life: if it has been honest and dutiful to society the religion which has regulated it cannot be a bad one.
quotes.author: Waiter Rant

quotes.quote: A cult is a religion with no political power.
Angels dancing on the head of a pin dissolve into nothingness at the bedside of a dying child.

There are two modes of establishing our reputation: to be praised by honest men, and to be abused by rogues. It is best, however, to secure the former, because it will invariably be accompanied by the latter.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.quote: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: Propriety was a rigid master, but one that must be obeyed if one wanted to keep a sterling reputation.
quotes.author: Lawana Blackwell

quotes.quote: A good name, like good will, is got by many actions and lost by one.
quotes.author: Lord Jeffery

quotes.quote: Until you've lost your reputation, you never realize what a burden it was.
quotes.author: Margaret Mitchell

quotes.quote: One can survive everything, nowadays, except death, and live down everything except a good reputation.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: A good reputation is more valuable than money.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: If I�ve learned one thing in the 14 years I�ve been a full-time cartoonist, it�s that you can not let anyone else define your professionalism. It has to be a personal ethos to which you adhere despite third party influence or acceptance. The old measuring sticks for professionalism are going away and now more than ever it�s time for independent creatives to set the bar. Set it high.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Regard your good name as the richest jewel you can possibly be possessed of - for credit is like fire; when once you have kindled it you may easily preserve it, but if you once extinguish it, you will find it an arduous task to rekindle it again. The way to gain a good reputation is to endeavor to be what you desire to appear.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
Good name in man and woman, dear my lord,
Is the immediate jewel of their souls:
Who steals my purse steals trash; 'tis something, nothing;
'Twas mine, 'tis his, and has been slave to thousands;
But he that filches from me my good name
Robs me of that which not enriches him
And makes me poor indeed.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
Good name in man and woman, dear my lord,
Is the immediate jewel of their souls:
Who steals my purse steals trash; 'tis something, nothing;
'Twas mine, 'tis his, and has been slave to thousands;
But he that filches from me my good name
Robs me of that which not enriches him
And makes me poor indeed.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Oh, I have lost my reputation! I have lost the immortal part of myself, and what remains is bestial.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Reputation is an idle and most false imposition; oft got without merit, and lost without deserving.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: The purest treasure mortal times afford is spotless reputation; that away, men are but gilded loam or painted clay.
He removes the greatest ornament of friendship, who takes away from it respect.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Respect yourself and others will respect you.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: The more things a man is ashamed of, the more respectable he is.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Respect a man, he will do the more.
quotes.author: James Howell

quotes.quote: Civilization is a method of living, an attitude of equal respect for all men.
quotes.author: Jane Addams

quotes.quote: Self-respect is the cornerstone of all virtue.
quotes.author: John Herschel

quotes.quote: Some people have so much respect for their superiors they have none left for themselves.
quotes.author: Peter McArthur

quotes.quote: If you want to be respected, you must respect yourself.
quotes.author: Spanish Proverb

quotes.quote: The way to procure insults is to submit to them: a man meets with no more respect than he exacts.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.quote: That you may retain your self-respect, it is better to displease the people by doing what you know is right, than to temporarily please them by doing what you know is wrong.
quotes.author: William J. H. Boetcker

quotes.quote: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: To give up the task of reforming society is to give up one's responsibility as a free man.
quotes.author: Alan Paton

quotes.quote: One can pass on responsibility, but not the discretion that goes with it.
quotes.author: Benvenuto Cellini

quotes.quote: I think of a hero as someone who understands the degree of responsibility that comes with his freedom.
quotes.author: Bob Dylan

quotes.quote: The perfect bureaucrat everywhere is the man who manages to make no decisions and escape all responsibility.
quotes.author: Brooks Atkinson

quotes.quote: There is a mysterious cycle in human events. To some generations much is given. Of other generations much is expected. This generation of Americans has a rendezvous with destiny.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Action springs not from thought, but from a readiness for responsibility.
quotes.author: G. M. Trevelyan

quotes.quote: Liberty means responsibility. That is why most men dread it.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: If you don't accept responsibility for your own actions, then you are forever chained to a position of defense.
quotes.author: Holly Lisle

quotes.quote: So many new ideas are at first strange and horrible, though ultimately valuable that a very heavy responsibility rests upon those who would prevent their dissemination.
quotes.author: J. B. S. Haldane

quotes.quote: There is an expiry date on blaming your parents for steering you in the wrong direction. The moment you are old enough to take the wheel, the responsibility lies with you.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: In every child who is born under no matter what circumstances and of no matter what parents, the potentiality of the human race is born again, and in him, too, once more, and each of us, our terrific responsibility toward human life: toward the utmost idea of goodness, of the horror of terrorism, and of God.
quotes.author: James Agee

quotes.quote: Character - the willingness to accept responsibility for one's own life - is the source from which self respect springs.
quotes.author: Joan Didion

quotes.quote: The more freedom we enjoy, the greater the responsibility we bear, toward others as well as ourselves.
quotes.author: Oscar Arias Sanchez

quotes.quote: We are at the very beginning of time for the human race. It is not unreasonable that we grapple with problems. But there are tens of thousands of years in the future. Our responsibility is to do what we can, learn what we can, improve the solutions, and pass them on.
quotes.author: Richard Feynman

quotes.quote: The price of greatness is responsibility.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: I tasted too what was called the sweet of revenge - but it was transient, it expired even with the object, that provoked it.
quotes.author: Ann Radcliffe

quotes.quote: There is no revenge so complete as forgiveness.
quotes.author: Josh Billings

quotes.quote: An eye for an eye makes the whole world blind.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: If an injury has to be done to a man it should be so severe that his vengeance need not be feared.
quotes.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quotes.quote: Life being what it is, one dreams of revenge.
quotes.author: Paul Gauguin

quotes.quote: Nothing inspires forgiveness quite like revenge.
quotes.author: Scott Adams

quotes.quote: In taking revenge, a man is but even with his enemy; but in passing it over, he is superior.
quotes.author: Sir Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Revenge is a kind of wild justice, which the more man's nature runs to the more ought law to weed it out.
quotes.author: Sir Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Live well. It is the greatest revenge.
quotes.author: The Talmud

quotes.quote: The first duty of a revolutionary is to get away with it.
quotes.author: Abbie Hoffman

quotes.quote: Poverty is the parent of revolution and crime.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Revolution is not a onetime event.
quotes.author: Audre Lorde

quotes.quote: The most radical revolutionary will become a conservative the day after the revolution.
quotes.author: Hannah Arendt

quotes.quote: Those who make peaceful revolution impossible will make violent revolution inevitable.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: The most important scientific revolutions all include, as their only common feature, the dethronement of human arrogance from one pedestal after another of previous convictions about our centrality in the cosmos.
quotes.author: Stephen Jay Gould

quotes.quote: And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom.
quotes.author: Anais Nin

quotes.quote: I guess what I'm trying to say is, I don't think you can measure life in terms of years. I think longevity doesn't necessarily have anything to do with happiness. I mean happiness comes from facing challenges and going out on a limb and taking risks. If you're not willing to take a risk for something you really care about, you might as well be dead.
quotes.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider

quotes.quote: Life is a risk.
quotes.author: Diane Von Furstenberg

quotes.quote: If you don't risk anything you risk even more.
quotes.author: Erica Jong

quotes.quote: Take calculated risks. That is quite different from being rash.
quotes.author: George S. Patton

quotes.quote: First weigh the considerations, then take the risks.
quotes.author: Helmuth von Moltke

quotes.quote: Great deeds are usually wrought at great risks.
quotes.author: Herodotus

quotes.quote: The policy of being too cautious is the greatest risk of all.
quotes.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quotes.quote: What you risk reveals what you value.
quotes.author: Jeanette Winterson

quotes.quote: Be wary of the man who urges an action in which he himself incurs no risk.
quotes.author: Joaquin Setanti

quotes.quote: There are risks and costs to a program of action. But they are far less than the long-range risks and costs of comfortable inaction.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: If you're never scared or embarrassed or hurt, it means you never take any chances.
quotes.author: Julia Sorel

quotes.quote: Risk! Risk anything! Care no more for the opinions of others, for those voices. Do the hardest thing on earth for you. Act for yourself. Face the truth.
quotes.author: Katherine Mansfield

quotes.quote: I don't think about risks much. I just do what I want to do. If you gotta go, you gotta go.
quotes.author: Lillian Carter

quotes.quote: In order for people to be happy, sometimes they have to take risks. It's true these risks can put them in danger of being hurt.
quotes.author: Meg Cabot

quotes.quote: It seems to me that people have vast potential. Most people can do extraordinary things if they have the confidence or take the risks. Yet most people don't. They sit in front of the telly and treat life as if it goes on forever.
quotes.author: Philip Adams

quotes.quote: To win without risk is to triumph without glory.
quotes.author: Pierre Corneille

quotes.quote: The universe will reward you for taking risks on its behalf.
quotes.author: Shakti Gawain

quotes.quote: Our lives improve only when we take chances - and the first and most difficult risk we can take is to be honest with ourselves.
quotes.author: Walter Anderson

quotes.quote: We started off trying to set up a small anarchist community, but people wouldn't obey the rules.
quotes.author: Alan Bennett

quotes.quote: It's not enough to create magic. You have to create a price for magic, too. You have to create rules.
quotes.author: Eric A. Burns

quotes.quote: The golden rule is that there are no golden rules.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: One of the best rules in conversation is, never to say a thing which any of the company can reasonably wish had been left unsaid.
quotes.author: Jonathan Swift

quotes.quote: It is much easier to break the rules when one s surrounded by strangers. One does not know any of them, so one cannot really care for their opinion.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.quote: Play by the rules, but be ferocious.
quotes.author: Thomas A. Edison

quotes.quote: Rules are just helpful guidelines for stupid people who can't make up their own minds.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: Here's to the crazy ones, the misfits, the rebels, the troublemakers, the round pegs in the square holes... the ones who see things differently -- they're not fond of rules... You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them, but the only thing you can't do is ignore them because they change things... they push the human race forward, and while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius, because the ones who are crazy enough to think that they can change the world, are the ones who do.
Hell, there are no rules here-- we're trying to accomplish something.
There are three rules for writing the novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are.
In a mad world only the mad are sane.
quotes.author: Akira Kurosawa

quotes.quote: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The knowing, I told myself, is only a vapor of the mind, and yet it can wreck havok with one's sanity.
quotes.author: Diane Ackerman

quotes.quote: Sometimes the mind, for reasons we don't necessarily understand, just decides to go to the store for a quart of milk.
quotes.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider

quotes.quote: Insanity in individuals is something rare - but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: Correct me if I'm wrong, but hasn't the fine line between sanity and madness gotten finer?
quotes.author: George Price

quotes.quote: Ordinarily he was insane, but he had lucid moments when he was merely stupid.
quotes.author: Heinrich Heine

quotes.quote: Truly great madness cannot be achieved without significant intelligence.
quotes.author: Henrik Tikkanen

quotes.quote: When dealing with the insane, the best method is to pretend to be sane.
quotes.author: Hermann Hesse

quotes.quote: I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me.
quotes.author: Hunter S. Thompson

quotes.quote: Part of being sane, is being a little bit crazy.
quotes.author: Janet Long

quotes.quote: Sanity calms, but madness is more interesting.
quotes.author: John Russell

quotes.quote: I think that maybe in every company today there is always at least one person who is going crazy slowly.
quotes.author: Joseph Heller

quotes.quote: A neurosis is a secret that you don't know you are keeping.
quotes.author: Kenneth Tynan

quotes.quote: It is no measure of health to be well adjusted to a profoundly sick society.
quotes.author: Krishnamurti

quotes.quote: I don't really trust a sane person.
quotes.author: Lyle Alzado

quotes.quote: There's a fine line between genius and insanity. I have erased this line.
quotes.author: Oscar Levant

quotes.quote: The statistics on sanity are that one out of every four Americans is suffering from some form of mental illness. Think of your three best friends. If they're okay, then it's you.
quotes.author: Rita Mae Brown

quotes.quote: You're only given a little spark of madness. You mustn't lose it.
quotes.author: Robin Williams

quotes.quote: There is only one difference between a madman and me. I am not mad.
quotes.author: Salvador Dali

quotes.quote: There is no great genius without some touch of madness.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote:
Joel: Ed, are you hallucinating?
Ed: Oh, yeah, but not right now.
quotes.author: Sy Rosen and Christian Williams

quotes.quote: Howard Hughes was able to afford the luxury of madness, like a man who not only thinks he is Napoleon but hires an army to prove it.
quotes.author: Ted Morgan

quotes.quote: Dreaming permits each and every one of us to be quietly and safely insane every night of our lives.
quotes.author: William Dement

quotes.quote:
Canst thou not minister to a mind diseased,
Pluck from the memory a rooted sorrow...
And with some sweet oblivious antidote
Cleanse the stuff'd bosom of that perilous stuff
Which weighs upon the heart?
quotes.author: William Shakespeare
