quotes.author: George F. Will

quotes.quote: Sports serve society by providing vivid examples of excellence.
quotes.author: George F. Will

quotes.quote:
For when the One Great Scorer comes
To write against your name,
He marks-not that you won or lost-
But how you played the game.
quotes.author: Grantland Rice

quotes.quote: Sports do not build character. They reveal it.
quotes.author: Heywood Broun

quotes.quote: Nobody in the game of football should be called a genius. A genius is somebody like Norman Einstein.
quotes.author: Joe Theismann

quotes.quote: It's not so important who starts the game but who finishes it.
quotes.author: John Wooden

quotes.quote: If it weren't for baseball, many kids wouldn't know what a millionaire looked like.
quotes.author: Phyllis Diller

quotes.quote: For people to judge a man's worth and his very manhood according to the way he feels about sport, and not to recognize it for the piddly, inconsequential goings on that it really is...
quotes.author: Robin Green and Mitchell Burgess

quotes.quote: I went to a fight the other night, and a hockey game broke out.
quotes.author: Rodney Dangerfield

quotes.quote: Not every age is fit for childish sports.
quotes.author: Titus Maccius Plautus

quotes.quote: A good hockey player plays where the puck is. A great hockey player plays where the puck is going to be.
quotes.author: Wayne Gretzky

quotes.quote: If all the year were playing holidays; To sport would be as tedious as to work.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Desire is the most important factor in the success of any athlete.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.quote: Baseball is 90% mental, the other half is physical.
If we had no winter, the spring would not be so pleasant: if we did not sometimes taste of adversity, prosperity would not be so welcome.
quotes.author: Anne Bradstreet

quotes.quote: [Spring is] when life's alive in everything.
quotes.author: Christina Rossetti

quotes.quote:
If there comes a little thaw,
Still the air is chill and raw,
Here and there a patch of snow,
Dirtier than the ground below,
Dribbles down a marshy flood;
Ankle-deep you stick in mud In the meadows while you sing,
"This is Spring."
quotes.author: Christopher Pearce Cranch

quotes.quote: Well, spring sprang. We've had our state of grace and our little gift of sanctioned madness, courtesy of Mother Nature. Thanks, Gaia. Much obliged. I guess it's time to get back to that daily routine of living we like to call normal.
quotes.author: David Assael

quotes.quote: Listen, can you hear it? Spring's sweet cantata. The strains of grass pushing through the snow. The song of buds swelling on the vine. The tender timpani of a baby robin's heart. Spring.
quotes.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider

quotes.quote: Spring is when you feel like whistling even with a shoe full of slush.
quotes.author: Doug Larson

quotes.quote: A little Madness in the Spring Is wholesome even for the King.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.quote: To be interested in the changing seasons is a happier state of mind than to be hopelessly in love with spring.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.quote: [Spring is] a true reconstructionist.
quotes.author: Henry Timrod

quotes.quote: If winter comes, can spring be far behind?
quotes.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quotes.quote: An optimist is the human personification of spring.
quotes.author: Susan J. Bissonette

quotes.quote: Winter is on my head, but eternal spring is in my heart.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.quote: In the spring time, the only pretty ring time, when birds do sing... sweet lovers love the spring.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
O, how this spring of love resembleth
The uncertain glory of an April day!
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: There are three kinds of lies: lies, damned lies, and statistics.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: USA Today has come out with a new survey - apparently, three out of every four people make up 75% of the population.
quotes.author: David Letterman

quotes.quote: Statistician: A man who believes figures don't lie, but admits that under analysis some of them won't stand up either.
quotes.author: Evan Esar

quotes.quote: Statistics: The only science that enables different experts using the same figures to draw different conclusions.
quotes.author: Evan Esar

quotes.quote: Smoking is one of the leading causes of statistics.
quotes.author: Fletcher Knebel

quotes.quote: I could prove God statistically.
quotes.author: George Gallup

quotes.quote: A single death is a tragedy; a million deaths is a statistic.
quotes.author: Joseph Stalin

quotes.quote: Small minds are much distressed by little things. Great minds see them all but are not upset by them.
quotes.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: If you ask what is the single most important key to longevity, I would have to say it is avoiding worry, stress and tension. And if you didn't ask me, I'd still have to say it.
quotes.author: George Burns

quotes.quote: Reality is the leading cause of stress amongst those in touch with it.
quotes.author: Jane Wagner

quotes.quote: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

quotes.quote: It is how people respond to stress that determines whether they will profit from misfortune or be miserable.
quotes.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi

quotes.quote: Stress is an ignorant state. It believes that everything is an emergency. Nothing is that important.
quotes.author: Natalie Goldberg

quotes.quote: Before you agree to do anything that might add even the smallest amount of stress to your life, ask yourself: What is my truest intention? Give yourself time to let a yes resound within you. When it's right, I guarantee that your entire body will feel it.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: Throw out an alarming alarm clock. If the ring is loud and strident, you're waking up to instant stress. You shouldn't be bullied out of bed, just reminded that it's time to start your day.
quotes.author: Sharon Gold

quotes.quote: If you had to define stress, it would not be far off if you said it was the process of living. The process of living is the process of having stress imposed on you and reacting to it.
Exercise relieves stress. Nothing relieves exercise.
Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Genius may have its limitations, but stupidity is not thus handicapped.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: Get all the fools on your side and you can be elected to anything.
quotes.author: Frank Dane

quotes.quote: Against stupidity the gods themselves contend in vain.
quotes.author: Friedrich von Schiller

quotes.quote: It is dangerous to be sincere unless you are also stupid.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: To be stupid, selfish, and have good health are three requirements for happiness, though if stupidity is lacking, all is lost.
quotes.author: Gustave Flaubert

quotes.quote: The two most common elements in the universe are Hydrogen and stupidity.
quotes.author: Harlan Ellison

quotes.quote: Ordinarily he was insane, but he had lucid moments when he was merely stupid.
quotes.author: Heinrich Heine

quotes.quote: There are more fools in the world than there are people.
quotes.author: Heinrich Heine

quotes.quote: There is nothing worse than aggressive stupidity.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Insanity is just what we call stupidity when it doesn't make sense.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.quote: Nothing in all the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity.
quotes.author: Scott Adams

quotes.quote: If there are no stupid questions, then what kind of questions do stupid people ask? Do they get smart just in time to ask questions?
quotes.author: Stephen Vizinczey

quotes.quote: Strange as it seems, no amount of learning can cure stupidity, and higher education positively fortifies it.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Artificial Intelligence is no match for natural stupidity.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Everyone is entitled to be stupid, but some abuse the privilege.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Fools rush in where fools have been before.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Never attribute to malice what can be adequately explained by stupidity.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: To succeed in the world it is not enough to be stupid, you must also be well-mannered.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Lord, what fools these mortals be!
Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any one thing.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: If A is success in life, then A equals x plus y plus z. Work is x; y is play; and z is keeping your mouth shut.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Try not to become a man of success but rather to become a man of value.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: A great secret of success is to go through life as a man who never gets used up.
quotes.author: Albert Schweitzer

quotes.quote: A discovery is said to be an accident meeting a prepared mind.
quotes.author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi

quotes.quote: To follow, without halt, one aim: There's the secret of success.
quotes.author: Anna Pavlova

quotes.quote: If your success is not on your own terms, if it looks good to the world but does not feel good in your heart, it is not success at all.
quotes.author: Anna Quindlen

quotes.quote: Success is the necessary misfortune of life, but it is only to the very unfortunate that it comes early.
quotes.author: Anthony Trollope

quotes.quote: It is possible to fail in many ways...while to succeed is possible only in one way.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Of course there is no formula for success except perhaps an unconditional acceptance of life and what it brings.
quotes.author: Arthur Rubinstein

quotes.quote: Find somebody to be successful for. Raise their hopes. Think of their needs.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.quote: I've come to embrace the notion that I haven't done enough in my life. I've come to confirm that one's title, even a title like president of the United States, says very little about how well one's life has been led. No matter how much you've done or how successful you've been, there's always more to do, always more to learn, and always more to achieve.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.quote: That's what building a body of work is all about. It's about the daily labor, the many individual acts, the choices large and small that add up over time, over a lifetime to a lasting legacy. It's about not being satisfied with the latest achievement, the latest gold star, because the one thing I know about a body of work is that it's never finished. It's cumulative. It deepens and expands with each day you give your best. You may have setbacks and you may have failures, but you're not done. You haven't even started.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.quote: The leaders we revere and the businesses that last are generally not the result of a narrow pursuit of popularity or personal advancement, but of devotion to some bigger purpose. That's the hallmark of real success. The other trapping of success might be the by product of this larger mission, but it can't be the central thing.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.quote: Why be a man when you can be a success?
quotes.author: Bertolt Brecht

quotes.quote: I don't know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everybody.
quotes.author: Bill Cosby

quotes.quote: What's money? A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and goes to bed at night and in between does what he wants to do.
quotes.author: Bob Dylan

quotes.quote: The person who makes a success of living is the one who see his goal steadily and aims for it unswervingly. That is dedication.
quotes.author: Cecil B. DeMille

quotes.quote: Nothing succeeds like the appearance of success.
quotes.author: Christopher Lasch

quotes.quote: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.
quotes.author: Christopher Morley

quotes.quote: There is only one success... to be able to spend your life in your own way, and not to give others absurd maddening claims upon it.
quotes.author: Christopher Morley

quotes.quote: The man of virtue makes the difficulty to be overcome his first business, and success only a subsequent consideration.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: Real success is finding your lifework in the work that you love.
quotes.author: David McCullough

quotes.quote: Envy was just the tax you paid on success.
quotes.author: David Rockefeller

quotes.quote: Success in business requires training and discipline and hard work. But if you're not frightened by these things, the opportunities are just as great today as they ever were.
quotes.author: Dr. David M. Burns

quotes.quote: Aim for success, not perfection. Never give up your right to be wrong, because then you will lose the ability to learn new things and move forward with your life.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: We succeed only as we identify in life, or in war, or in anything else, a single overriding objective, and make all other considerations bend to that one objective.
quotes.author: Ellen DeGeneres

quotes.quote: When I was younger I thought success was something different. I thought, " When I grow up, I want to be famous. I want to be a star. I want to be in movies. When I grow up I want to see the world, drive nice cars. I want to have groupies." But my idea of success is different today. For me, the most important thing in your life is to live your life with integrity and not to give into peer pressure, to try to be something that you're not. To live your life as an honest and compassionate person. To contribute in some way.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.quote: Success is counted sweetest by those who ne'er succeed.
To perceive is to suffer.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: But penance need not be paid in suffering...It can be paid in forward motion. Correcting the mistake is a positive move, a nurturing move.
quotes.author: Barbara Hall

quotes.quote: In the part of this universe that we know there is great injustice, and often the good suffer, and often the wicked prosper, and one hardly knows which of those is the more annoying.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Never to suffer would never to have been blessed.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.quote: I felt despair. Though it seems to me now there's two kinds of it: the sort that causes a person to surrender and then the sort I had which made me take risks and make plans.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: I have found that it don't really matter if you're brought up fine or rough, but that it helps to have someone to spill your sorrows to.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: But a somewhat more liberal and sympathetic examination of mankind will convince us that the cross is even older than the gibbet, that voluntary suffering was before and independent of compulsory; and in short that in most important matters a man has always been free to ruin himself if he chose.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: Although the world is full of suffering, it is full also of the overcoming of it.
quotes.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

quotes.quote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
quotes.author: Isodore Duncan

quotes.quote: You desire to know the art of living, my friend? It is contained in one phrase: make use of suffering.
quotes.author: Jose Marti

quotes.quote: So long as little children are allowed to suffer, there is no true love in this world.
quotes.author: Joseph Addison

quotes.quote: Man has to suffer. When he has no real afflictions, he invents some.
quotes.author: Leigh Hunt

quotes.quote: A misery is not to be measured from the nature of the evil, but from the temper of the sufferer.
quotes.author: Louise Bogan

quotes.quote: I have not yet met with a sorrow that could not be borne, nor with one who's passing did not leave me stronger.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Whenever evil befalls us, we ought to ask ourselves, after the first suffering, how we can turn it into good. So shall we take occasion, from one bitter root, to raise perhaps many flowers.
quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.quote: I cannot believe that the inscrutable universe turns on an axis of suffering; surely the strange beauty of the world must somewhere rest on pure joy!
quotes.author: Thomas Merton

quotes.quote: Crying is the refuge of plain women, but the ruin of pretty ones.
quotes.author: Thucydides

quotes.quote: People have a hard time letting go of their suffering. Out of a fear of the unknown, they prefer suffering that is familiar.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: The truth that many people never understand, until it is too late, is that the more you try to avoid suffering the more you suffer because smaller and more insignificant things begin to torture you in proportion to your fear of being hurt.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.quote: The sufferings that fate inflicts on us should be borne with patience, what enemies inflict with manly courage.
Pain is inevitable; suffering is optional.
If suffer we must, let's suffer on the heights.
In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: One swallow does not make a summer.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: There shall be eternal summer in the grateful heart.
quotes.author: Celia Thaxter

quotes.quote: Summer afternoon - Summer afternoon... the two most beautiful words in the English language.
quotes.author: Henry James

quotes.quote: Summer afternoon-summer afternoon; to me those have always been the two most beautiful words in the English language.
quotes.author: Henry James

quotes.quote: The tendinous part of the mind, so to speak, is more developed in winter; the fleshy, in summer. I should say winter had given the bone and sinew to literature, summer the tissues and the blood.
quotes.author: John Burroughs

quotes.quote: What a beautiful, sunny morning. It makes you happy to be alive, doesn't it? We can't let the sun outshine us! We have to beam, too!
quotes.author: Wallace Stevens

quotes.quote: The summer night is like a perfection of thought.
quotes.author: William Carlos Williams

quotes.quote: In summer, the song sings itself.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
Shall I compare thee to a summer's day?
Thou art more lovely and more temperate:
Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May,
And summer's lease hath all too short a date.
Faith must have adequate evidence, else it is mere superstition.
quotes.author: Alexander Hodge

quotes.quote: I have only one superstition. I touch all the bases when I hit a home run.
quotes.author: Babe Ruth

quotes.quote: Fear is the main source of superstition, and one of the main sources of cruelty. To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: We do not destroy religion by destroying superstition.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: A superstition is a premature explanation that overstays its time.
quotes.author: George Iles

quotes.quote: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature.... Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: Count Hermann Keyserling once said truly that the greatest American superstition was belief in facts.
quotes.author: John Gunther

quotes.quote: Great ability develops and reveals itself increasingly with every new assignment.
quotes.author: Baltasar Gracian

quotes.quote: Put yourself on view. This brings your talents to light.
quotes.author: Baltasar Gracian

quotes.quote: Hide not your talents, they for use were made. What's a sun-dial in the shade?
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: If you have a talent, use it in every which way possible. Don't hoard it. Don't dole it out like a miser. Spend it lavishly like a millionaire intent on going broke.
quotes.author: Brendan Francis

quotes.quote: Natural ability without education has more often attained to glory and virtue than education without natural ability.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Everyone has talent. What is rare is the courage to follow the talent to the dark place where it leads.
quotes.author: Erica Jong

quotes.quote: Work while you have the light. You are responsible for the talent that has been entrusted to you.
quotes.author: Henri-Fr�d�ric Amiel

quotes.quote: Use what talents you possess: the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
quotes.author: Henry Van Dyke

quotes.quote: It doesn't pay to be good at something unless you are the absolute best at it.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: We are always more anxious to be distinguished for a talent which we do not possess, than to be praised for the fifteen which we do possess.
quotes.author: Rosalynn Carter

quotes.quote: You have to have confidence in your ability, and then be tough enough to follow through.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Toil to make yourself remarkable by some talent or other.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

quotes.quote: Mediocrity knows nothing higher than itself, but talent instantly recognizes genius.
quotes.author: Sophia Loren

quotes.quote: Getting ahead in a difficult profession requires avid faith in yourself. That is why some people with mediocre talent, but with great inner drive, go much further than people with vastly superior talent.
quotes.author: Sydney Smith

quotes.quote: Whatever you are by nature, keep to it; never desert your line of talent. Be what nature intended you for and you will succeed.
The hardest thing in the world to understand is the income tax.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: He who builds a better mousetrap these days runs into material shortages, patent-infringement suits, work stoppages, collusive bidding, discount discrimination--and taxes."
quotes.author: H. E. Martz

quotes.quote: Unquestionably, there is progress. The average American now pays out twice as much in taxes as he formerly got in wages.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: Income tax returns are the most imaginative fiction being written today.
quotes.author: Herman Wouk

quotes.quote: The avoidance of taxes is the only intellectual pursuit that carries any reward.
quotes.author: John Maynard Keynes

quotes.quote: When there is an income tax, the just man will pay more and the unjust less on the same amount of income.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: The income tax has made more liars out of the American people than golf has.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: I never teach my pupils. I only attempt to provide the conditions in which they can learn.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Experience teaches only the teachable.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: The true teacher defends his pupils against his own personal influence.
quotes.author: Amos Bronson Alcott

quotes.quote: The whole art of teaching is only the art of awakening the natural curiosity of young minds for the purpose of satisfying it afterwards.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.quote: Passive acceptance of the teacher's wisdom is easy to most boys and girls. It involves no effort of independent thought, and seems rational because the teacher knows more than his pupils; it is moreover the way to win the favour of the teacher unless he is a very exceptional man. Yet the habit of passive acceptance is a disastrous one in later life. It causes man to seek and to accept a leader, and to accept as a leader whoever is established in that position.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Teachers open the door. You enter by yourself.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: Good teaching is one-fourth preparation and three-fourths theater.
quotes.author: Gail Godwin

quotes.quote: He who can, does. He who cannot, teaches.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Teaching is not a lost art, but regard for teaching is a lost tradition.
quotes.author: Tryon Edwards

quotes.quote: If you would thoroughly know anything, teach it to others.
quotes.author: W. C. Sellar and R. J. Yeatman

quotes.quote: For every person who wants to teach there are approximately thirty people who don't want to learn--much.
For a list of all the ways technology has failed to improve the quality of life, please press three.
quotes.author: Alice Kahn

quotes.quote: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
quotes.author: Arthur C. Clarke

quotes.quote: During my eighty-seven years I have witnessed a whole succession of technological revolutions. But none of them have done away with the need for character in the individual or the ability to think.
quotes.author: Bernard M. Baruch

quotes.quote: This is why I loved technology: if you used it right, it could give you power and privacy.
quotes.author: Cory Doctorow

quotes.quote: We make our gadgets our own by the way that we use them, with or without the permission of the manufacturer.
quotes.author: Max Frisch

quotes.quote: Technology is a way of organizing the universe so that man doesn't have to experience it.
quotes.author: Putt's Law

quotes.quote: Technology is dominated by two types of people: those who understand what they do not manage, and those who manage what they do not understand.
quotes.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

quotes.quote: Humanity is acquiring all the right technology for all the wrong reasons.
quotes.author: Richard Feynman

quotes.quote: For a successful technology, reality must take precedence over public relations, for Nature cannot be fooled.
quotes.author: Robert Pirsig

quotes.quote: There is an evil tendency underlying all our technology - the tendency to do what is reasonable even when it isn't any good.
Television is more interesting than people. If it were not, we would have people standing in the corners of our rooms.
quotes.author: Alan Corenk

quotes.quote: Seeing a murder on television... can help work off one's antagonisms. And if you haven't any antagonisms, the commercials will give you some.
quotes.author: Alfred Hitchcock

quotes.quote: Television has done much for psychiatry by spreading information about it, as well as contributing to the need for it.
quotes.author: Alfred Hitchcock

quotes.quote: Television has proved that people will look at anything rather than each other.
quotes.author: Ann Landers

quotes.quote: Television is the first truly democratic culture - the first culture available to everybody and entirely governed by what the people want. The most terrifying thing is what people do want.
quotes.author: Clive Barnes

quotes.quote: The one function TV news performs very well is that when there is no news we give it to you with the same emphasis as if there were.
quotes.author: David Brinkley

quotes.quote: Television enables you to be entertained in your home by people you wouldn't have in your home.
quotes.author: David Frost

quotes.quote: [The television is] an invention that permits you to be entertained in your living room by people you wouldn't have in your home.
quotes.author: David Frost

quotes.quote: MTV is the lava lamp of the 1980's.
quotes.author: Doug Ferrari

quotes.quote: I can think of nothing more boring for the American people than to have to sit in their living rooms for a whole half hour looking at my face on their television screens.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: Dealing with network executives is like being nibbled to death by ducks.
quotes.author: Eric Sevareid

quotes.quote: TV is chewing gum for the eyes.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.quote: Imitation is the sincerest form of television.
quotes.author: Fred Allen

quotes.quote: Television is a new medium. It's called a medium because nothing is well-done.
quotes.author: Fred Allen

quotes.quote: [Television is] the triumph of machine over people.
quotes.author: Fred Allen

quotes.quote: The great thing about television is that if something important happens anywhere in the world, day or night, you can always change the channel.
quotes.author: From "Taxi"

quotes.quote: Don't you wish there was a knob on the TV to turn up the intelligence? There's one marked 'Brightness,' but it doesn't work.
quotes.author: Gallagher

quotes.quote: I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.quote: Television news is like a lightning flash. It makes a loud noise, lights up everything around it, leaves everything else in darkness and then is suddenly gone.
quotes.author: Hodding Carter

quotes.quote: If it weren't for Philo T. Farnsworth, inventor of television, we'd still be eating frozen radio dinners.
quotes.author: Johnny Carson

quotes.quote: One of the few good things about modern times: If you die horribly on television, you will not have died in vain. You will have entertained us.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.quote: Thanks to TV and for the convenience of TV, you can only be one of two kinds of human beings, either a liberal or a conservative.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.quote: If there's anything unsettling to the stomach, it's watching actors on television talk about their personal lives.
quotes.author: Marlon Brando

quotes.quote: Imagine what it would be like if TV actually were good. It would be the end of everything we know.
quotes.author: Marvin Minsky

quotes.quote: Television is for appearing on - not for looking at.
quotes.author: Noel Coward

quotes.quote: My father hated radio and could not wait for television to be invented so he could hate that too.
quotes.author: Peter De Vries

quotes.quote: All television is children's television.
quotes.author: Richard P. Adler

quotes.quote: It is difficult to produce a television documentary that is both incisive and probing when every twelve minutes one is interrupted by twelve dancing rabbits singing about toilet paper.
quotes.author: Rod Serling

quotes.quote: Television has raised writing to a new low.
quotes.author: Samuel Goldwyn

quotes.quote: I think that parents only get so offended by television because they rely on it as a babysitter and the sole educator of their kids.
quotes.author: Trey Parker and Matt Stone

quotes.quote: Good habits result from resisting temptation.
quotes.author: Ancient Proverb

quotes.quote: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life.
quotes.author: Bible

quotes.quote: I never resist temptation because I have found that things that are bad for me do not tempt me.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: There is not any memory with less satisfaction than the memory of some temptation we resisted.
quotes.author: James Branch Cabell

quotes.quote: Those who flee temptation generally leave a forwarding address.
quotes.author: Lane Olinghouse

quotes.quote: I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.quote: There are several good protections against temptations, but the surest is cowardice.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: I can resist anything but temptation.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it. Resist it, and your soul grows sick with longing for the things it has forbidden to itself.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Why comes temptation, but for man to meet and master and crouch beneath his foot, and so be pedestaled in triumph?
quotes.author: Robert Browning

quotes.quote: Most people would like to be delivered from temptation but would like it to keep in touch.
quotes.author: Robert Orben

quotes.quote: The last temptation is the greatest treason: to do the right deed for the wrong reason.
quotes.author: T. S. Eliot

quotes.quote: Temptation rarely comes in working hours. It is in their leisure time that men are made or marred.
quotes.author: W. N. Taylor

quotes.quote: Often the best way to overcome desire is to satisfy it.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: It is good to be without vices, but it is not good to be without temptations.
quotes.author: Walter Bagehot

quotes.quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
quotes.author: Alan Kay

quotes.quote: I never think of the future - it comes soon enough.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: In the future everyone will be famous for fifteen minutes.
quotes.author: Andy Warhol

quotes.quote: The future will be better tomorrow.
quotes.author: Dan Quayle

quotes.quote: The future is much like the present, only longer.
quotes.author: Dan Quisenberry

quotes.quote: A preoccupation with the future not only prevents us from seeing the present as it is but often prompts us to rearrange the past.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: The future is an opaque mirror. Anyone who tries to look into it sees nothing but the dim outlines of an old and worried face.
quotes.author: Jim Bishop

quotes.quote: The future, according to some scientists, will be exactly like the past, only far more expensive.
quotes.author: John Sladek

quotes.quote: A man that don�t believe in destiny don�t need to know what his destiny is.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

quotes.quote: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.
quotes.author: Nicole Kidman

quotes.quote: When you relinquish the desire to control your future, you can have more happiness.
quotes.author: Niels Bohr

quotes.quote: Prediction is very difficult, especially about the future.
quotes.author: Paul Valery

quotes.quote: The trouble with our times is that the future is not what it used to be.
quotes.author: Robert Fulford

quotes.quote: I have seen the future and it doesn't work.
quotes.author: Robertson Davies

quotes.quote: The world is full of people whose notion of a satisfactory future is, in fact, a return to the idealised past.
quotes.author: Robin Green and Mitchell Burgess

quotes.quote: Time is just something that we assign. You know, past, present, it's just all arbitrary. Most Native Americans, they don't think of time as linear; in time, out of time, I never have enough time, circular time, the Stevens wheel. All moments are happening all the time.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: The empires of the future are the empires of the mind.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: Life wouldn't be worth living if I worried over the future as well as the present.
quotes.author: William Gibson

quotes.quote: The future is here. It's just not widely distributed yet.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.quote: The future ain't what it used to be.
This only is denied to God: the power to undo the past.
quotes.author: Agathon

quotes.quote: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.quote: Look not mournfully into the past. It comes not back again. Wisely improve the present. It is thine. Go forth to meet the shadowy future, without fear.
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.quote: I tend to live in the past because most of my life is there.
quotes.author: Herb Caen

quotes.quote: The farther behind I leave the past, the closer I am to forging my own character.
quotes.author: Isabelle Eberhardt

quotes.quote: We can draw lessons from the past, but we cannot live in it.
quotes.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quotes.quote: Time is just something that we assign. You know, past, present, it's just all arbitrary. Most Native Americans, they don't think of time as linear; in time, out of time, I never have enough time, circular time, the Stevens wheel. All moments are happening all the time.
quotes.author: Robin Green and Mitchell Burgess

quotes.quote: Live neither in the past nor in the future, but let each day's work absorb your entire energies, and satisfy your widest ambition.
quotes.author: Sir William Osler

quotes.quote: I don't think of the past. The only thing that matters is the everlasting present.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: Events in the past may be roughly divided into those which probably never happened and those which do not matter.
quotes.author: William Ralph Inge

quotes.quote: The world is round; it has no point.
quotes.author: Adrienne E. Gusoff

quotes.quote: I think the world is run by 'C' students.
quotes.author: Al McGuire

quotes.quote: The most incomprehensible thing about the world is that it is at all comprehensible.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: In the fight between you and the world, back the world.
quotes.author: Frank Zappa

quotes.quote: The world's as ugly as sin, and almost as delightful
quotes.author: Frederick Locker-Lampson

quotes.quote: The world is a tragedy to those who feel, but a comedy to those who think.
quotes.author: Horace Walpole

quotes.quote: All the world's a cage.
quotes.author: Jeanne Phillips

quotes.quote: Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: All the world's a stage and most of us are desperately unrehearsed.
quotes.author: Sean O'Casey

quotes.quote: All great deeds and all great thoughts have a ridiculous beginning.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: No man deserves punishment for his thoughts.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: When I only begin to read, I forget I'm on this world. It lifts me on wings with high thoughts.
quotes.author: Anzia Yezierska

quotes.quote: High thoughts must have high language.
quotes.author: Aristophanes

quotes.quote: Nurture your mind with great thoughts; to believe in the heroic makes heroes.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: Only he is free who cultivates his own thoughts, and strives without fear to do justice to them.
quotes.author: Berthold Auerbach

quotes.quote: The highest possible stage in moral culture is when we recognize that we ought to control our thoughts.
quotes.author: Charles Darwin

quotes.quote: Neither can embellishments of language be found without arrangement and expression of thoughts, nor can thoughts be made to shine without the light of language.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Our thoughts are free.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Don't think you are going to conceal thoughts by concealing evidence that they ever existed.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.quote: In this world second thoughts, it seems, are best.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: It is not a bad idea to get in the habit of writing down one's thoughts. It saves one having to bother anyone else with them.
quotes.author: Isabel Colegate

quotes.quote: You are today where your thoughts have brought you; you will be tomorrow where your thoughts take you.
quotes.author: James Lane Allen

quotes.quote: All truly wise thoughts have been thoughts already thousands of times; but to make them truly ours, we must think them over again honestly, till they take root in our personal experience.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: If any man wish to write in a clear style, let him be first clear in his thoughts; and if any would write in a noble style, let him first possess a noble soul.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: I have always thought the actions of men the best interpreters of their thoughts.
quotes.author: John Locke

quotes.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts, therefore guard accordingly; and take care that you entertain no notions unsuitable to virtue, and reasonable nature.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

quotes.quote: The universe is change; our life is what our thoughts make it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

quotes.quote: When I am attacked by gloomy thoughts, nothing helps me so much as running to my books. They quickly absorb me and banish the clouds from my mind.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
quotes.author: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.quote: A man is infinitely more complicated than his thoughts.
quotes.author: Paul Valery

quotes.quote: If you want peace, stop fighting. If you want peace of mind, stop fighting with your thoughts.
quotes.author: Peter McWilliams

quotes.quote: Thoughts give birth to a creative force that is neither elemental nor sidereal. Thoughts create a new heaven, a new firmament, a new source of energy, from which new arts flow. When a man undertakes to create something, he establishes a new heaven, as it were and from it the work that he desires to create flows into him. For such is the immensity of man that he is greater than heaven and earth.
quotes.author: Philipus Aureolus Paracelsus

quotes.quote: In every work of genius we recognize our own rejected thoughts; they come back to us with a certain alienated majesty.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: In every work of genius we see our own rejected thoughts.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Except our own thoughts, there is nothing absolutely in our power.
quotes.author: Rene Descartes

quotes.quote: They are never alone that are accompanied with noble thoughts.
quotes.author: Sir Philip Sidney

quotes.quote: Thoughts, like fleas, jump from man to man, but they don't bite everybody.
quotes.author: Stanislaw J. Lec

quotes.quote:
Watch your thoughts, they become words.
Watch your words, they become actions.
Watch your actions, they become habits.
Watch your habits, they become your character.
Watch your character, it becomes your destiny.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: There are some that only employ words for the purpose of disguising their thoughts.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: The dogmas of the quiet past, are inadequate to the stormy present. The occasion is piled high with difficulty, and we must rise with the occasion. As our case is new, so we must think anew and act anew. We must disenthrall ourselves, and then we shall save our country.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: All that really belongs to us is time; even he who has nothing else has that.
quotes.author: Baltasar Gracian

quotes.quote: An unhurried sense of time is in itself a form of wealth.
quotes.author: Bonnie Friedman

quotes.quote: Time is the coin of your life. It is the only coin you have, and only you can determine how it will be spent. Be careful lest you let other people spend it for you.
quotes.author: Carl Sandburg

quotes.quote: Calendars are for careful people, not passionate ones.
quotes.author: Chuck Sigars

quotes.quote: Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so.
quotes.author: Douglas Adams

quotes.quote: Time is a cruel thief to rob us of our former selves. We lose as much to life as we do to death.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Forsythe Hailey

quotes.quote: All my possessions for a moment of time.
quotes.author: Elizabeth I

quotes.quote: When people go through something rough in life, they say, "I'm taking it one day at a time." Yes, so is everybody. Because that's how time works.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: Oh! Do not attack me with your watch. A watch is always too fast or too slow. I cannot be dictated to by a watch.
quotes.author: Jef Mallett

quotes.quote: If time flies when you're having fun, it hits the afterburners when you don't think you're having enough.
quotes.author: Jim Bishop

quotes.quote: Nothing is as far away as one minute ago.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: The great French Marshall Lyautey once asked his gardener to plant a tree. The gardener objected that the tree was slow growing and would not reach maturity for 100 years. The Marshall replied, 'In that case, there is no time to lose; plant it this afternoon!'
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: We must use time as a tool, not as a crutch.
quotes.author: John Randolph

quotes.quote: Time is at once the most valuable and the most perishable of all our possessions.
quotes.author: John Ruskin

quotes.quote: Our duty is to preserve what the past has had to say for itself, and to say for ourselves what shall be true for the future.
quotes.author: Malcolm Forbes

quotes.quote: There is never enough time, unless you're serving it.
quotes.author: Maria Edgeworth

quotes.quote: If we take care of the moments, the years will take care of themselves.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Time cools, time clarifies; no mood can be maintained quite unaltered through the course of hours.
quotes.author: Mason Cooley

quotes.quote: Regret for wasted time is more wasted time.
quotes.author: Max Frisch

quotes.quote: Time does not change us. It just unfolds us.
quotes.author: Oscar Levant

quotes.quote: What very mysterious things days were. Sometimes they fly by, and other times they seem to last forever, yet they are all exactly twenty-four hours. There's quite a lot we don't know about them.
quotes.author: Paul Klee

quotes.quote: So little time and so little to do.
quotes.author: Plutarch

quotes.quote: A single day is enough to make us a little larger.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: The whole life of man is but a point of time; let us enjoy it.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: These times of ours are series and full of calamity, but all times are essentially alike. As soon as there is life there is danger.
quotes.author: Robert Byrne

quotes.quote: This time, like all times, is a very good one, if we but know what to do with it.
Doing a thing well is often a waste of time.
Laws alone can not secure freedom of expression; in order that every man present his views without penalty there must be spirit of tolerance in the entire population.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: In the modern world, self-control buys a good life indeed. Having self-control to spare is rare enough nowadays that the marketplace lavishes huge rewards on society's scary new self-control elite, those lords of discipline who not only withstood all that boring stuff in graduate school, but keep themselves thin by carefully regulating what they eat after flogging themselves off to the gym at the crack of dawn. It's as if they got the news ahead of the rest of us-no doubt by waking up earlier-that self-control may well be the most important trait of the twenty-first century.
quotes.author: Heinrich Heine

quotes.quote: Be entirely tolerant or not at all; follow the good path or the evil one. To stand at the crossroads requires more strength than you possess.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: The highest result of education is tolerance.
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.quote: To say the least, a town life makes one more tolerant and liberal in one's judgement of others.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: I have learnt silence from the talkative, toleration from the intolerant, and kindness from the unkind; yet strange, I am ungrateful to these teachers.
quotes.author: Ralph W. Sockman

quotes.quote: The test of courage comes when we are in the minority. The test of tolerance comes when we are in the majority.
quotes.author: Woodrow Wilson

quotes.quote: Once lead this people into war and they will forget there ever was such a thing as tolerance.
He who would travel happily must travel light.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quotes.quote: Thanks to the Interstate Highway System, it is now possible to travel from coast to coast without seeing anything.
quotes.author: Charles Kuralt

quotes.quote: When you travel, remember that a foreign country is not designed to make you comfortable. It is designed to make its own people comfortable.
quotes.author: Clifton Fadiman

quotes.quote: The true traveler is he who goes on foot, and even then, he sits down a lot of the time.
quotes.author: Colette

quotes.quote: A man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.
quotes.author: George Moore

quotes.quote: Before he sets out, the traveler must possess fixed interests and facilities to be served by travel.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.quote: The saying "Getting there is half the fun" became obsolete with the advent of commercial airlines.
quotes.author: Henry J. Tillman

quotes.quote: Certainly, travel is more than the seeing of sights; it is a change that goes on, deep and permanent, in the ideas of living.
quotes.author: Miriam Beard

quotes.quote: Travel is only glamorous in retrospect.
quotes.author: Paul Theroux

quotes.quote: Everywhere I go I find a poet has been there before me.
quotes.author: Sigmund Freud

quotes.quote: Travel only with thy equals or thy betters; if there are none, travel alone.
quotes.author: The Dhammapada

quotes.quote: No one travelling on a business trip would be missed if he failed to arrive.
quotes.author: Thorstein Veblen

quotes.quote: Suburbia is where the developer bulldozes out the trees, then names the streets after them.
quotes.author: Bill Vaughan

quotes.quote: He plants trees to benefit another generation.
quotes.author: Caecilius Statius

quotes.quote: Train up a fig tree in the way it should go, and when you are old sit under the shade of it.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.quote: Trees like to have kids climb on them, but trees are much bigger than we are, and much more forgiving.
quotes.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider

quotes.quote: He that plants trees loves others beside himself.
quotes.author: Dr. Thomas Fuller

quotes.quote:
I think that I shall never see
A poem lovely as a tree.
quotes.author: Joyce Kilmer

quotes.quote: The trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.
quotes.author: Moliere

quotes.quote:
I think that I shall never see
a billboard lovely as a tree.
Perhaps, unless the billboards fall,
I'll never see a tree at all.
quotes.author: Ogden Nash

quotes.quote:
There's nothing that keeps its youth,
So far as I know, but a tree and truth.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.quote: Trees, though they are cut and lopped, grow up again quickly, but if men are destroyed, it is not easy to get them again.
quotes.author: Pericles

quotes.quote: You should go to a pear tree for pears, not to an elm.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: You will find something more in woods than in books. Trees and stones will teach you that which you can never learn from masters.
quotes.author: Saint Bernard

quotes.quote: He that climbs the tall tree has won right to the fruit.
quotes.author: Sir Walter Scott

quotes.quote: I like trees because they seem more resigned to the way they have to live than other things do.
quotes.author: Willa Cather

quotes.quote: As the poet said, 'Only God can make a tree' -- probably because it's so hard to figure out how to get the bark on.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.quote: For somehow this is tyranny's disease, to trust no friends.
quotes.author: Aeschylus

quotes.quote: I never trust people's assertions, I always judge of them by their actions.
quotes.author: Ann Radcliffe

quotes.quote: A human being is only interesting if he's in contact with himself. I learned you have to trust yourself, be what you are, and do what you ought to do the way you should do it. You have got to discover you, what you do, and trust it.
quotes.author: Barbra Streisand

quotes.quote: You have got to discover you, what you do, and trust it.
quotes.author: Barbra Streisand

quotes.quote: A man who doesn't trust himself can never truly trust anyone else.
quotes.author: Cardinal de Retz

quotes.quote: Do not trust all men, but trust men of worth; the former course is silly, the latter a mark of prudence.
quotes.author: Democritus

quotes.quote: Anyone who goes through life trusting people without making sure they are worthy of trust is a fool. Yet there are people who may be trusted, men as well as women. There are are as many difference in their natures as there are flowers in these meadows.
quotes.author: Frank Crane

quotes.quote: In a networked world, trust is the most important currency.
quotes.author: Frank Herbert

quotes.quote: You may be deceived if you trust too much, but you will live in torment if you do not trust enough.
quotes.author: Graham Greene

quotes.quote: The people I distrust most are those who want to improve our lives but have only one course of action.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: It is impossible to go through life without trust: That is to be imprisoned in the worst cell of all, oneself.
quotes.author: Henry L. Stimson

quotes.quote: For it is mutual trust, even more than mutual interest that holds human associations together. Our friends seldom profit us but they make us feel safe... Marriage is a scheme to accomplish exactly that same end.
quotes.author: Henry Stimson

quotes.quote: The chief lesson I have learned in a long life is that the only way to make a man trustworthy is to trust him; and the surest way to make him untrustworthy is to distrust him and show your distrust.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: The only way to make a man trustworthy is to trust him.
quotes.author: Jerome Blattner

quotes.quote: Never trust anything that can think for itself if you can't see where it keeps its brain.
quotes.author: Johann K. Lavater

quotes.quote: A person who trusts no one can't be trusted.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Mistrust the man who finds everything good, the man who finds everything evil and still more the man who is indifferent to everything.
quotes.author: Martha Nussbaum

quotes.quote: As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: But the life that no longer trust another human being and no longer forms ties to the political community is not a human life any longer.
quotes.author: Randy K. Milholland

quotes.quote: Trust men and they will be true to you; treat them greatly, and they will show themselves great.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote: There are people I know who won't hurt me. I call them corpses.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: When you really trust someone, you have to be okay with not understanding some things.
quotes.author: Shakti Gawain

quotes.quote: It is better to suffer wrong than to do it, and happier to be sometimes cheated than not to trust.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.quote: When I'm trusting and being myself... everything in my life reflects this by falling into place easily, often miraculously.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.quote: If we are bound to forgive an enemy, we are not bound to trust him.
quotes.author: Virgil

quotes.quote: Trust thyself only, and another shall not betray thee.
Trust one who has gone through it.
Truth is generally the best vindication against slander.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: There are few nudities so objectionable as the naked truth.
quotes.author: Agnes Repplier

quotes.quote: Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it.
quotes.author: Andre Gide

quotes.quote: All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident.
quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.quote: Ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.
quotes.author: Bible

quotes.quote: Chase after truth like hell and you'll free yourself, even though you never touch its coat-tails.
quotes.author: Clarence Darrow

quotes.quote: It's a basic truth of the human condition that everybody lies. The only variable is about what. The weird thing about telling someone they're dying is it tends to focus their priorities. You find out what matters to them. What they're willing to die for. What they're willing to lie for.
quotes.author: David Shore

quotes.quote: The public will believe anything, so long as it is not founded on truth.
quotes.author: Edith Sitwell

quotes.quote: Truth is the only safe ground to stand on.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quotes.quote: The truth is more important than the facts.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.quote: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.
quotes.author: Galileo Galilei

quotes.quote: The truth that makes men free is for the most part the truth which men prefer not to hear.
quotes.author: Herbert Agar

quotes.quote: As scarce as truth is, the supply has always been in excess of the demand.
quotes.author: Josh Billings

quotes.quote: Say not, 'I have found the truth,' but rather, 'I have found a truth.'
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: Do not run from the truth. There be nought so hard to live with as a lie.
quotes.author: Lenin

quotes.quote: A lie told often enough becomes the truth.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: A lie can travel halfway around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities. Truth isn't.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: The history of our race, and each individual's experience, are sown thick with evidence that a truth is not hard to kill and that a lie told well is immortal.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Truth is more of a stranger than fiction.
quotes.author: Matthew Arnold

quotes.quote: Truth sits upon the lips of dying men.
quotes.author: Niels Bohr

quotes.quote: The opposite of a correct statement is a false statement. But the opposite of a profound truth may well be another profound truth.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
quotes.author: Quintus Septimius Tertullianus

quotes.quote: Truth persuades by teaching, but does not teach by persuading.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Truth is beautiful, without doubt; but so are lies.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote: I have been truthful all along the way. The truth is more interesting, and if you tell the truth you never have to cover your tracks.
quotes.author: Scott Westerfeld

quotes.quote: I guess sometimes you have to lie to find the truth.
quotes.author: Scott Westerfeld

quotes.quote: Turns out if you never lie, there's always someone mad at you.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

quotes.quote: How often have I said to you that when you have eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth?
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened.
Not to be absolutely certain is, I think, one of the essential things in rationality.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: When one admits that nothing is certain one must, I think, also admit that some things are much more nearly certain than others.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: No man can ever be secure until he has been forsaken by Fortune.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: I believe that uncertainty is really my spirit's way of whispering, "I'm in flux. I can't decide for you. Something is off-balance here."
quotes.author: Pliny the Elder

quotes.quote: In these matters the only certainty is that nothing is certain.

quotes.author: Alison Headley

quotes.quote: If the weak hand, that has recorded this tale, has, by its scenes, beguiled the mourner of one hour of sorrow, or, by its moral, taught him to sustain it - the effort, however humble, has not been vain, nor is the writer unrewarded.
quotes.author: Ann Radcliffe

quotes.quote: The best way to become acquainted with a subject is to write a book about it.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: Not every story has explosions and car chases. That's why they have nudity and espionage.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.quote: I have made this [letter] longer, because I have not had the time to make it shorter.
quotes.author: Bobby Knight

quotes.quote: All of us learn to write in the second grade. Most of us go on to greater things.
quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

quotes.quote: Don't use words too big for the subject. Don't say 'infinitely' when you mean 'very'; otherwise you'll have no word left when you want to talk about something really infinite.
quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

quotes.quote: Even in literature and art, no man who bothers about originality will ever be original: whereas if you simply try to tell the truth (without caring twopence how often it has been told before) you will, nine times out of ten, become original without ever having noticed it.
quotes.author: Carol Burnett

quotes.quote: Words, once they are printed, have a life of their own.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.quote: Many books require no thought from those who read them, and for a very simple reason; they made no such demand upon those who wrote them.
quotes.author: Charles de Montesquieu

quotes.quote: An author is a fool who, not content with boring those he lives with, insists on boring future generations.
quotes.author: Colleen Wainwright

quotes.quote: This is pretty much what journals are all about, at least to me. I knew as I wrote them that even though they provided an excellent place for brain (and heart, and psyche) dump, they were mainly a map of me.
quotes.author: Cyril Connolly

quotes.quote: Better to write for yourself and have no public, than to write for the public and have no self.
quotes.author: Daphne du Maurier

quotes.quote: Writers should be read, but neither seen nor heard.
quotes.author: David Sedaris

quotes.quote: Maybe that's just what happens; you start out wanting to change the world through language, and end up thinking it's enough to tell a few jokes.
quotes.author: Edith Wharton

quotes.quote: She was discovering once again that reading and writing were not the same-you couldn't just soak it up then squeeze it out again.
quotes.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quotes.quote: Sometimes, when it's going badly, she wonders if what she believes to be a love of the written word is really just a fetish for stationary. The true writer, the born writer, will scribble words on scraps of litter, the back of a bus ticket, on the wall of a cell.
quotes.author: Edward Gibbon

quotes.quote: Writing gives you the illusion of control, and then you realize it's just an illusion, that people are going to bring their own stuff into it.
quotes.author: Edwin Schlossberg

quotes.quote: A classic is classic not because it conforms to certain structural rules, or fits certain definitions (of which its author had quite probably never heard). It is classic because of a certain eternal and irrepressible freshness.
quotes.author: Elaine Liner

quotes.quote:
Beneath the rule of men entirely great,
The pen is mightier than the sword.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Forsythe Hailey

quotes.quote: Unprovided with original learning, unformed in the habits of thinking, unskilled in the arts of composition, I resolved to write a book.
quotes.author: Eric A. Burns

quotes.quote: The skill of writing is to create a context in which other people can think.
quotes.author: Florence Nightingale

quotes.quote: If writers stopped writing about what happened to them, then there would be a lot of empty pages.
quotes.author: Fran Lebowitz

quotes.quote: Please write again soon. Though my own life is filled with activity, letters encourage momentary escape into others lives and I come back to my own with greater contentment.
quotes.author: George Ade

quotes.quote: It's not enough to create magic. You have to create a price for magic, too. You have to create rules.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: You ask me why I do not write something....I think one's feelings waste themselves in words, they ought all to be distilled into actions and into actions which bring results.
Your life story would not make a good book. Don't even try.
After being Turned Down by numerous Publishers, he had decided to write for Posterity.
The man who writes about himself and his own time is the only man who writes about all people and all time.
The deepest definition of youth is life as yet untouched by tragedy.
quotes.author: Alfred North Whitehead

quotes.quote: The secret of eternal youth is arrested development.
quotes.author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

quotes.quote: The young know how truly difficult and dreadful youth can be. Their youth is wasted on everyone else, that's the horror. The young have no authority, no respect.
quotes.author: Anne Rice

quotes.quote: Young people are in a condition like permanent intoxication, because youth is sweet and they are growing.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Never suffer youth to be an excuse for inadequacy, nor age and fame to be an excuse for indolence.
quotes.author: Benjamin Haydon

quotes.quote: Youth is something very new: twenty years ago no one mentioned it.
quotes.author: Coco Chanel

quotes.quote: You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.
quotes.author: Dave Barry

quotes.quote: The foundation of every state is the education of its youth.
quotes.author: Diogenes Laertius

quotes.quote: What a mistake to suppose that the passions are strongest in youth! The passions are not stronger, but the control over them is weaker! They are more easily excited, they are more violent and apparent; but they have less energy, less durability, less intense and concentrated power than in the maturer life.
quotes.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quotes.quote: Yes is how you get your first job, and your next job, and your spouse, and even your kids. Even if it's a bit edgy, a bit out of your comfort zone, saying yes means that you will do something new, meet someone new and make a difference.
quotes.author: Evelyn Waugh

quotes.quote: What is youth except a man or a woman before it is ready or fit to be seen?
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: We cannot always build the future for our youth, but we can build our youth for the future.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher esteem those who think alike than those who think differently.
quotes.author: Friedrich von Schiller

quotes.quote: Keep true to the dreams of thy youth.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Youth is a wonderful thing. What a crime to waste it on children.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Youth, which is forgiven everything, forgives itself nothing:  age, which forgives itself everything, is forgiven nothing.
quotes.author: Henri Estienne

quotes.quote: If youth only knew: if age only could.
quotes.author: Herbert Henry Asquith

quotes.quote: Youth would be an ideal state if it came a little later in life.
quotes.author: Irish Proverb

quotes.quote: Praise youth and it will prosper.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: Age is foolish and forgetful when it underestimates youth.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.quote: Youth cannot know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.
quotes.author: James M. Barrie

quotes.quote: I'm youth, I'm joy, I'm a little bird that has broken out of the egg.
quotes.author: Jonathan Swift

quotes.quote: No wise man ever wished to be younger.
quotes.author: Lawana Blackwell

quotes.quote: Youth isn't always all it's touted to be.
quotes.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quotes.quote: Don't laugh at a youth for his affectations; he is only trying on one face after another to find his own.
quotes.author: Marie Ebner von Eschenbach

quotes.quote: In youth we learn; in age we understand.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.quote:
There's nothing that keeps its youth,
So far as I know, but a tree and truth.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: I am not young enough to know everything.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: To get back my youth I would do anything in the world, except take exercise, get up early, or be respectable.
quotes.author: P. G. Wodehouse

quotes.quote: Boyhood, like measles, is one of those complaints which a man should catch young and have done with, for when it comes in middle life it is apt to be serious.
